Gordon Betts, Peter Desaix, Eddie Johnson. , CC BY 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': 'ea6e8c6e-aab9-4a2d-868d-6ffcf3f1c3b9'}, {'anki_id': 1543418914741.0, 'document': 'Atopic dermatitis (eczema)::Diagnosis? - Chronic inflammatory skin rash characterized by dry skin patches with papules - Both infantile (resolves with initial years of life) and adult (recurrent) forms exist - Risk factors = asthma, allergic rhinitis, family history - H/P = pruritus; erythematous patches of dry skin with possible vesicles on flexor surfaces, dorsum of hands and feet, chest, back, or face; lesions more commonly on face and scalp in infants (Mnemonic: FACE→ F lexor A dults, C hildren E xtensors) - Treatment = avoidance of precipitating factors, moisturizing creams, topical corticosteroids or tacrolimus; severe cases can be treated with oral corticosteroids and antihistamines', 'ankihub_id': '14ece135-c611-4bbf-b43c-ff5ea06b3d50'}, {'anki_id': 1475364039224.0, 'document': "The ' tram-track ' appearance associated with MPGN is due to basement membrane splitting caused by mesangial cell ingrowth - When mesangial cells detect the deposits (IgG complexes in case of Type I), this causes them to proliferate and extend their cellular processes, causing the basement membrane to split - IgG complexes also result in activation of complement and inflammation (resulting in thickening of capillary membranes)", 'ankihub_id': '2ffd2a20-c8be-4e76-bf79-4900fe780d5a'}, {'anki_id': 1489112954716.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the muscle , bone , and connective tissue ? Meso::Endo/Meso/Ectoderm', 'ankihub_id': '557ebc67-ab32-48a6-8025-7c0f659842a8'}, {'anki_id': 1572901198239.0, 'document': 'In diffuse proliferative glomerulonephritis ::nephritic syndrome, IgG and anti-dsDNA immune complexes may deposit in the subendothelial space', 'ankihub_id': '929592ad-52c9-47c7-8a9d-c485edd2b100'}, {'anki_id': 1489112985969.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the parathyroid gland and parafollicular C cells ? Endo::Endo/Meso/Ectoderm Note : embryonic origin of parafollicular C cells has come into question over last couple years; consensus is that it is most likely endoderm rather than neural crest', 'ankihub_id': '43f10533-08b2-4c8c-879e-d4be27be02e8'}, {'anki_id': 1585266821707.0, 'document': 'Meltzer triad ( purpura, arthralgia, and fatigue) with increased serum concentration of polyclonal IgG and IgM is highly suggestive of mixed cryoglobulinemia - Type I cryoglobulinemia: an immune-mediated disorder characterized by the deposition of monoclonal immunoglobulins (IgG and IgM) within blood vessels. Most commonly associated with protein-secreting monoclonal gammopathies, including monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance, Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia, and multiple myeloma - Type II (mixed) cryoglobulins are monoclonal IgM and polyclonal IgG antibodies - Type III (mixed) cryoglobulins are polyclonal IgM and polyclonal IgG antibodies', 'ankihub_id': 'c44eb0fd-7197-4e5d-84af-fcaacae7d30b'}, {'anki_id': 1485127433105.0, 'document': 'Which anti-epileptic is most associated with drug-induced lupus ? Phenytoin HEα P S PIMP H ydralazine E tanercept α -methyldopa / IFN- α P henytoin S ulfa drugs P rocainamide I soniazid M ethimazole P TU', 'ankihub_id': '9f92b58d-312e-48d4-9a80-20326f250968'}, {'anki_id': 1489112976992.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the kidneys ? Meso::Endo/Meso/Ectoderm', 'ankihub_id': '34e12c58-2d54-40ed-97c4-6e46163d9a9b'}, {'anki_id': 1488680338882.0, 'document': 'What skin disorder is caused by autoimmune destruction of melanocytes ? Vitiligo - Biopsy shows absent melanocytes in skin - Compare with albinism (due to normal number of melanocytes that do not produce melanin due to ↓ tyrosinase) - Associated with other autoimmune conditions such as pernicious anemia, autoimmune thyroid disease (Hashimoto and Graves), T1DM, primary adrenal insufficiency, hypopituitarism, and alopecia areata', 'ankihub_id': '5e51bdc3-67c9-4c1e-902b-0ca8bc8a7398'}, {'anki_id': 1475376496099.0, 'document': 'The granular (" lumpy bumpy ") appearance of PSGN on immunofluorescence is due to deposits with immune complexes consisting of IgG / IgM and C3 - Additionally, there is enlarged, diffusely hypercellular glomeruli due to leukocyte infiltration and mesangial / endothelial proliferation - Complement activation here occurs primarily via the alternative / lectin pathway, resulting in C3 / C3b deposition without significant C1 / C4 deposits Hypercellular glomeruli in the second image', 'ankihub_id': 'ed7fedfe-fc15-4011-92a3-46416c6bd596'}, {'anki_id': 1475376612128.0, 'document': 'DPGN is characterized by subendothelial and sometimes intramembranous immune complexes on electron microscopy - Is less commonly characterized by subepithelial immune complexes - IgG-based immune complexes with C3 protein sometimes', 'ankihub_id': 'c0ae2029-d89d-4dc4-8123-2f7a05bd2398'}, {'anki_id': 1462809000922.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the adrenal cortex ? Mesoderm Remember the embryonic origin of the adrenal medulla is the neural crest', 'ankihub_id': '3d780a79-2270-41b0-825b-ec43a2b57868'}, {'anki_id': 1488680463261.0, 'document': 'The initial growth phase of melanoma is characterized by radial growth along the epidermis and superficial dermis Radial = horizontally along the surface', 'ankihub_id': '6bcd79cf-9e75-4bf8-b8bf-05984272851e'}, {'anki_id': 1484792801183.0, 'document': 'What is the treatment for postpartum depression ? Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) and/or SSRIs Two new drugs have recently been approved specifically for use in PPD: - Zulresso (brexanolone) for IV use [2019] - Zurzuvae (zuranolone) for PO use [2023]', 'ankihub_id': '2fdbb599-c4af-4845-92fa-c19374149416'}, {'anki_id': 1488680452133.0, 'document': 'Dysplastic nevus syndrome is a(n) autosomal dominant::inheritance disorder characterized by formation of dysplastic nevi Associated with mutations on chromosome 9p21 ( CDKN2A ), which causes loss of p16 (tumor suppressor gene)', 'ankihub_id': 'ee88e41d-eaa8-458d-9ecb-3abad51994ee'}, {'anki_id': 1473627988643.0, 'document': 'Smoking results in centriacinar emphysema that is most severe in the upper lobes of the lung - Centriacinar emphysema is characterized by damage to respiratory bronchioles that spares the distal alveoli - Whereas α 1 -antitrypsin deficiency results in panacinar emphysema that is most severe in the lower lobes of the lung', 'ankihub_id': '62dc31de-86f8-490f-b1db-fb809b5a32d9'}, {'anki_id': 1475364032274.0, 'document': 'Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN) is associated with basement membrane thickening and splitting on light microscopy This occurs due to subendothelial immune complex deposition', 'ankihub_id': '04656817-0163-4bff-be2e-acefe358cd2c'}, {'anki_id': 1487207112553.0, 'document': 'Type II HSRs can cause pathology by inducing cellular dysfunction, causing abnormal blockade or activation/inactivation of downstream cellular processes - e.g., myasthenia gravis, Graves disease, pemphigus vulgaris - In pemphigus vulgaris , autoantibodies against desmoglein-1 (αDsg1) / -3 (αDsg3) inactivate these proteins, resulting in loss of cell-cell adhesion', 'ankihub_id': '94221571-f3f5-47db-a652-05689fd0af1a'}, {'anki_id': 1488502331191.0, 'document': 'Which skin layers contain nerve endings , blood vessels , lymphatics , and adnexal structures (e.g., hair follicles, glands)? Dermis and hypodermis::2', 'ankihub_id': 'fff72a06-00a5-4fb0-80a8-d58b8648d182'}, {'anki_id': 1489112968862.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the peritoneum (serous lining of cavities)? Meso::Endo/Meso/Ectoderm', 'ankihub_id': '922f65d9-15c8-455d-aec4-8e020c295114'}, {'anki_id': 1463187654764.0, 'document': 'Surface epithelial tumors of the ovary are derived from the coelomic epithelium that lines the ovary (embryologically) - Coelomic epithelium embryologically produces the epithelial lining of the fallopian tube ( serous cells), endometrium, and endocervix ( mucinous cells) - Histologic findings of these tumors include anaplasia of epithelial cells with invasion into the stroma, along with multiple papillary formations with cellular atypia', 'ankihub_id': 'dfb11368-b211-4227-9461-cfed13f1eaaa'}, {'anki_id': 1486591167720.0, 'document': 'What demographic is classically affected by primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC)? Middle-aged men (classically with IBD) - In a young adult male, history of hematochezia (e.g., ulcerative colitis), the most likely etiology of recurrent acute cholangitis (e.g., similar symptoms in the past) is a biliary stricture due to primary sclerosing cholangitis - 90% have underlying IBD (mainly ulcerative colitis)', 'ankihub_id': '5a5a3df2-e47f-4dc6-b8be-3d5549233ae9'}, {'anki_id': 1584019894177.0, 'document': 'What is the appearance of Bowen disease on physical exam ? Well -defined, erythematous , scaly/crusting plaque AKA squamous cell carcinoma in situ I mage(s) licensed by DermNet and used with permission, CC-BY-NC-ND 3.0 NZ', 'ankihub_id': 'adaf34fe-fde7-419f-a704-23362c9c9442'}, {'anki_id': 1495725315618.0, 'document': 'What musculoskeletal pathologies are associated with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC)? - Osteoporosis - Osteomalacia - Precise etiology is not clear; possibly associated with vitamin D deficiency secondary to fat malabsorption - Order DEXA scan to establish baseline bone density - Other complications include malabsorption and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)', 'ankihub_id': '24ef5d14-03bc-4e78-9681-029e761ab711'}, {'anki_id': 1471806584678.0, 'document': 'What vasculitis is a granulomatous , necrotizing vasculitis with eosinophilia ? Eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA) EGPA was formerly known as Churg-Strauss syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '82ff04a1-d75c-42ad-a613-09c9b63f0886'}, {'anki_id': 1521770922392.0, 'document': 'The following CXR is highly suggestive of what restrictive pulmonary pathology in a ~ 50 year old man? Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis - Notably, there are increased reticular (interstitial) markings - Diffuse reticular opacities can be observed, these are typically associated with decreased lung volumes', 'ankihub_id': '04a6f61c-63d9-44bc-aa8d-2ee15a4505de'}, {'anki_id': 1482886696163.0, 'document': 'Hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia is a(n) autosomal dominant ::inheritance disorder resulting in thin-walled blood vessels , especially in the mouth and GI tract - AKA Osler-Weber-Rendu syndrome - Presents with blanching skin lesions ( telangiectasias ), recurrent epistaxis, skin discoloration, AV malformations , GI bleeding , and hematuria', 'ankihub_id': '82024f2c-92b7-43d9-898e-a5f7eaa72fb8'}, {'anki_id': 1468250283753.0, 'document': 'Type IV collagen is targeted by autoantibodies in Goodpasture syndrome - Specifically, the alpha 3 chain of type IV collagen is targeted - Found in lungs (hemoptysis) and glomeruli (GBM) - In contrast with Alport syndrome, which is due to an inherited defect in type IV collagen', 'ankihub_id': '27688293-36fb-48e2-b53a-bd14087934d4'}, {'anki_id': 1475376498638.0, 'document': 'PSGN is characterized by subepithelial::location immune complex " humps " on electron microscopy " P SGN = sube P ithelial"', 'ankihub_id': 'c1bae473-360b-4e3f-b006-e829f5e0f47f'}, {'anki_id': 1468531802595.0, 'document': 'The classical type of Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (joint and skin symptoms) is caused by a mutation in type V collagen - The classical type includes Ehlers-Danlos types 1 & 2 - Compared to the vascular type of EDS which is caused by a type III collagen deficiency', 'ankihub_id': '7a00e1c3-1cd3-46f4-8b04-cd3e16dc669a'}, {'anki_id': 1489976327304.0, 'document': 'Which porphyria presents with blistering cutaneous photosensitivity and hyperpigmentation ? Porphyria cutanea tarda - Accumulation of uroporphyrin (oxidation product) due to build up of uroporphyrinogen III is shunted to the skin, and then on exposure to light cause blisters and hyperpigmentation - Deficiencies in enzymes post porphobilinogen conversion can result in photosensitivity issues', 'ankihub_id': '469baad9-ed59-4805-9403-3d5d93045a9b'}, {'anki_id': 1545267033146.0, 'document': 'Itchy , coin -shaped, well-demarcated erythematous plaques associated with dry skin is characteristic of nummular eczema::condition Mohammad2018 (photo 2), both CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons - Topical glucocorticoids are first-line - Lesions usually on dorsal hands and feet, extensor surfaces of arms and legs, flanks, and hips - Keys to diagnosis are sharply defined, round, erythematous, scaly, fissured-plaque lesions; may also have intermittent exudate - Exact etiology unknown, but occurrence in the setting of chronically dry skin suggests decreased production of skin lipids - Skin biopsy is nonspecific and not often done, but may help exclude other diagnoses', 'ankihub_id': '4f2e2b78-36f5-44fb-8a6e-73d9573e7875'}, {'anki_id': 1483825140079.0, 'document': 'Goodpasture syndrome is an autoimmune disease that is associated with exposure to hydrocarbon solvents (e.g., dry-cleaning, paints, dyes) and cigarette smoke Also known as anti-glomerular basement membrane (GBM) disease', 'ankihub_id': 'd93d714c-e682-4d7e-8ead-725b3c3e5d3b'}, {'anki_id': 1503262965875.0, 'document': 'Lepromatous leprosy is associated with a strong Th 2 -cell response, allowing for humoral immunity - Also referred to as multi bacillary leprosy - Lack of Th 1 - Response results in lack of cell-mediated immunity and therefore lack of containment of the infection', 'ankihub_id': 'e9aae32a-937c-460b-9dc9-e8f344d09578'}, {'anki_id': 1538820814280.0, 'document': 'Characteristics of Ehlers-Danlos syndrome::genetic condition: - Hyper elasticity of skin - Joint hyper mobility - Tendency towards bleeding - Hell no, you didn’t do that with your fingers - Ddx. with homocystinuria : no tall stature, lens dislocation, or hypercoagulability', 'ankihub_id': 'f870220e-10a7-416b-9aad-83223c61e368'}, {'anki_id': 1486771325323.0, 'document': 'The pectinate ( dentate ) line is formed where anal endoderm (hindgut) meets ectoderm Transition point from simple columnar to stratified squamous epithelium Image(s) provided by www.radiologyassistant.nl . Used with permission.', 'ankihub_id': '819d3fd0-4af2-4333-9736-9e343d5662e0'}, {'anki_id': 1488502491982.0, 'document': 'Atopic dermatitis presents with an intensely pruritic , oozing rash with vesicles and edema due to a type I HSR " Eczematous " rash User:Madhero88, CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '0918cf8d-8bd9-4451-8d38-f408cf84f43f'}, {'anki_id': 1557425104408.0, 'document': 'What type(s) of Strep. pyogenes infection precipitate(s) post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis ? Pharyngitis Impetigo Rheumatic fever, by contrast, is only caused by pharyngitis-- worst one (pharyngitis) leads to the worst outcome (rheumatic fever)', 'ankihub_id': '10df86ce-3cd8-477a-9621-b5cc96c6b572'}, {'anki_id': 1482971264299.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the spleen ? Meso::Endo/Meso/Ectoderm - Arises in the mesentery of the stomach - Functional lymphatic organ by week 23', 'ankihub_id': '33314fbc-3ef7-4495-b15c-87ac9507afcb'}, {'anki_id': 1581890934727.0, 'document': 'Autoantibodies form complexes with antigens , which activate the classical complement pathway and induce tissue damage in SLE ::autoimmune disorder', 'ankihub_id': 'ca543a62-6071-4b6e-8872-555f1bb690fc'}, {'anki_id': 1505252173955.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with arthralgias , fatigue , and painless , palpable purpura on the bilateral legs? Laboratory examination reveals elevated LFTs, evidence of glomerulonephritis (hematuria & proteinuria), and low serum C4. Mixed cryoglobulinemia syndrome - Presents with fatigue, palpable purpura, arthralgias, renal disease, positive rheumatoid factor, elevated transaminases, hypocomplementemia, hepatosplenomegaly, peripheral neuropathy , and non-specific systemic symptoms - Tx: corticosteroids, rituximab, and treatment of the underlying cause', 'ankihub_id': 'f71b96d6-2de2-4bd1-a6fe-b16934d49fa8'}, {'anki_id': 1557328733870.0, 'document': 'Progressive exertional dyspnea and nonproductive cough with fine inspiratory crackles is suggestive of interstitial lung disease - Presents with inspiratory "Velcro" (fine, dry) crackles as one of the earliest signs - Restrictive lung disease - Early disease may not be seen on CXR ; need high resolution CT (HRCT) and PFTs', 'ankihub_id': '60c480e3-729f-4039-bfac-bfd35575091c'}, {'anki_id': 1473289822632.0, 'document': 'The volume that moves into the lung with each quiet inspiration is the tidal volume ~500 mL', 'ankihub_id': '5cdc8d1c-494a-4aa7-81ae-60af1a6e975f'}, {'anki_id': 1462053331431.0, 'document': 'How does cortisol affect secretion of ACTH from the anterior pituitary? Inhibits secretion, both directly and indirectly Photo cr edit: avensonline [ Avens Publishing Grou p - Neonatal Hypotension, the Role of Hydrocortisone and Other Pharmacological Agents in its Management (avensonline.org) ]', 'ankihub_id': '81356cf7-f090-4fc8-9370-c3e1ce7f18a2'}, {'anki_id': 1506553575196.0, 'document': 'What markers are in the blood during early symptomatic HBV infection ? HBsAg, HBeAg - Timeline of serological markers: SEC-ES - This is before the body can mount an immune response (hence, absence of anti-HBc IgM)', 'ankihub_id': '5c94951c-4d8b-4299-a32e-8fba8fb2a641'}, {'anki_id': 1475376654031.0, 'document': 'IgA nephropathy is characterized by mesangial::location immune complex deposits on electron microscopy', 'ankihub_id': '58389614-e91e-4dd7-b282-4e0e11bec24b'}, {'anki_id': 1484704557257.0, 'document': 'Cellulitis ::What skin pathology is characterized by an infection of the deeper dermis and subcutaneous tissues caused by S. aureus or S. pyogenes ::what (2) organisms? - Purulent cellulitis = S. aureus - Nonpurulent cellulitis = S. pyogenes (GAS)', 'ankihub_id': 'e851babf-c2f2-43f0-9c03-bd8789d9acd2'}, {'anki_id': 1484104052710.0, 'document': 'Guillain-Barré syndrome can arise due to the immunologic phenomenon known as molecular mimicry - An infectious agent contains a ganglioside-like substance in its LPS layer - Antibodies are formed against this substance, and activated T-cells cross-react with ganglioside components of myelin and schwann cells', 'ankihub_id': '6b4f9bb8-dcec-476c-9384-ef6b5324a1a5'}, {'anki_id': 1585515525072.0, 'document': 'Chronic granulomatous thyroiditis is thought to involve HLA- B35 polymorphisms and viral infection HLA-B35 and viral infection → molecular mimicry → recognition of self antigens in the thyroid → autoimmune destruction of thyroid', 'ankihub_id': '1f96fb90-3ccb-4f2a-ad02-0630212d6481'}, {'anki_id': 1462808901843.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of thyroid tissue? Endoderm Thyroid diverticulum arises at the primitive pharynx and then descends into the neck along the thyroglossal duct', 'ankihub_id': '79fc49bd-78aa-4035-a06f-fd203f60f15a'}, {'anki_id': 1488502326517.0, 'document': 'Which layer of the epidermis is characterized by keratin in anucleate cells ? Stratum corneum OpenStax College : J. Gordon Betts, Peter Desaix, Eddie Johnson. , CC BY 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': 'f13a3af0-8ae7-4d0b-a567-20d8f1749efe'}, {'anki_id': 1535308388008.0, 'document': 'Immune thrombocytopenia (ITP)::ITP/TTP = ↑ megakaryocytes - Formerly known as idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura - Compensatory response to destroyed platelets - Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP) = schistocytes from being ripped on "thrombi"', 'ankihub_id': '2b2a0a90-6497-4532-bfc3-ea4e3658ab35'}, {'anki_id': 1489112822671.0, 'document': 'Which genes of embryogenesis are produced at the apical ectodermal ridge (thickened ectoderm at distal end of each developing limb)? Wnt-7 and FGF genes::2 AER: Apical ectodermal ridge ZPA: The zone of polarizing activity', 'ankihub_id': '9db1df34-d9a0-48fe-8881-9800575f3df0'}, {'anki_id': 1524936681473.0, 'document': 'Dermatological manifestations of reactive arthritis include hyperkeratotic vesicles on the palms and soles , and a serpiginous annular dermatitis of the glans penis - Hyperkeratotic vesicles of palms and soles = keratoderma blennorrhagicum (first photo) - Serpiginous annular dermatitis of the glans penis = circinate balanitis (second photo)', 'ankihub_id': 'bf149a65-b467-46a6-acc3-40e261e2087a'}, {'anki_id': 1471806636140.0, 'document': 'Eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA)::Small-vessel vasculitis commonly presents with asymmetric multifocal neuropathy , typically manifesting with wrist and foot drop - This occurs due to the vasculitis affecting the epineural vessels (deficits in radial nerve and common fibular nerve) - Asymmetric multifocal neuropathy = mononeuritis multiplex - May also present with sinusitis and skin nodules / purpura - EGPA was formerly known as Churg-Strauss syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '53b6a603-a1e5-4b53-af55-a9354d301379'}, {'anki_id': 1475364042912.0, 'document': 'What immunofluorescence findings are associated with membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis ? Granular deposits (immune complex deposition) - Positive for IgG in Type I, but negative in Type II (but positive for C3) - Subendothelial C1q deposits are characteristic of type 1', 'ankihub_id': '7c5a1f56-d456-4a17-82ac-3c2babb42ad2'}, {'anki_id': 1475376486636.0, 'document': 'Post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis (PSGN) is characterized by a(n) granular ("lumpy bumpy") ::specific immunofluorescence pattern due to immune complex deposition - Due to IgG , IgM, and C3 deposition along GBM and mesangium - AKA "starry sky" appearance', 'ankihub_id': 'f8afc0cd-e1c5-4d50-9ee8-5f35b7a27d4e'}, {'anki_id': 1554223545390.0, 'document': 'Chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy (CIDP) presents with symptoms similar to Guillain-Barré syndrome::disease, though over a period of > 2 months (chronic) - Patients present with ascending symmetric sensory and motor deficits that progress over a period greater than two months - Likely autoimmune in nature as anti-GM1 antibodies , anti-contactin 1 , and anti-neurofascin have been detected', 'ankihub_id': '035351cb-b88e-4ab1-9882-f939f4629473'}, {'anki_id': 1585857434029.0, 'document': 'Sheets of small blue round cells organized around a central space ("Homer-Wright rosettes") characterizes histology of neuroblastoma ::which endocrine tumor? Also seen in medulloblastoma', 'ankihub_id': '29dfccc6-bff8-43be-8b57-064db96e2f4f'}, {'anki_id': 1463187954433.0, 'document': 'Struma ovarii is a cystic teratoma composed primarily of thyroid tissue and thus may cause hyperthyroidism © Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': '36fbbc82-4575-4bad-9f63-deb62f26d2f3'}, {'anki_id': 1484603457857.0, 'document': 'What virus commonly causes conjunctivitis ? Adenovirus Approximately 80% of cases of viral conjunctivitis are caused by adenoviruses', 'ankihub_id': 'c78444d1-d31f-4e6f-b70b-be2de8d90666'}, {'anki_id': 1576877940618.0, 'document': 'Cryoglobulinemia is a type III HSR -mediated vasculitis that typically affects older women ::demographic', 'ankihub_id': '102ae45d-0e34-430b-a044-dbdd4658cde6'}, {'anki_id': 1462219943721.0, 'document': 'Graves disease is associated with pretibial myxedema , which occurs due to activation of dermal fibroblasts - This is due to primarily TRAb (and to a lesser degree T-cell lymphocyte) activation of fibroblasts, which deposit GAGs that draw in water (non-pitting edema) - This is typically only seen in Graves and is infrequent (1-5% of cases)', 'ankihub_id': 'c323c71e-78e7-4204-b39b-d00cc0ae090c'}, {'anki_id': 1497302386533.0, 'document': 'What is the recommended management for a hemodynamically unstable Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome patient with atrial fibrillation ? Electrical cardioversion - Unstable = cardiovert! - Stable = procainamide', 'ankihub_id': '5ae6d009-4074-4c7c-85e5-349570c10713'}, {'anki_id': 1583375180336.0, 'document': 'What is the most common cause of bronchiectasis worldwide ? Tuberculosis Cystic fibrosis is the most common cause in the U.S. Bronchiectasis:', 'ankihub_id': 'cbadc8b2-ae16-4616-be32-a78b2e00371c'}, {'anki_id': 1504827892285.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with well-circumscribed and raised erythematous plaques with intense pruritus (pictured below)? The rash occurs episodically > 6 weeks, approximately 2–3x/day, with each episode lasting about 6–8 hours Chronic spontaneous urticaria - Due to mast cell activation - Work-up includes biopsy to rule out urticarial vasculitis or mastocytosis', 'ankihub_id': '013e8c48-a113-4378-95ea-d472d6f988ad'}, {'anki_id': 1515892012639.0, 'document': 'Epiglottitis with a(n) " thumbprint " sign on imaging is classic for Haemophilus influenzae infection - Do not confuse with the "steeple sign" seen with parainfluenza virus - H influenza → t H umbprint sign - P arainfluenza virus → stee P le sign left normal, right abnormal', 'ankihub_id': '19e2f90c-9b5d-42ac-92b2-9b4a447188d3'}, {'anki_id': 1481857904337.0, 'document': 'What is the mode of inheritance of Huntington disease ? Autosomal dominant', 'ankihub_id': '730c5424-ae53-4897-86be-b2e7ba6ea9bd'}, {'anki_id': 1514438709754.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient who recently finished taking penicillin that presents with mild fever , myalgias or arthralgias , and painful violaceous rash ? Hypersensitivity vasculitis (cutaneous small vessel vasculitis) - This is a leukocytoclastic vasculitis (type III HSR) involving post-capillary venules in the dermis - Usually seen with infections (HCV, HIV) or medications (penicillins, cephalosporins, sulfonamides, allpurionol, PTU, phenytoin) - Dark red spots are palpable purpura (spots are non-blanching) - Biopsy shows perivascular neutrophils and neutrophilic nuclear debris ("leukocytoclasia")', 'ankihub_id': 'ae549217-d821-495e-bd01-282ec02685bd'}, {'anki_id': 1488680694200.0, 'document': 'Which skin disorder begins as a " herald patch " followed days later by other scaly, erythematous plaques in a " Christmas tree " distribution on the trunk? Pityriasis rosea - Multiple plaques with collarette scale; self-resolving in 6-8 weeks - Pityriasis rosea and pityriasis versicolor do not involve the hands and soles while syphilis does James Heilman,MD, CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '1e7244a9-de99-4e5e-a674-979a1c02901b'}, {'anki_id': 1496864920755.0, 'document': 'Chimeric biologics can be recognized as their names will include the infix - xi - (e.g., rituximab, cetuximab, infliximab) Chimeric biologics are part animal-part human in their origin - therefore the immune system will think this biologic is a bad guy and generate antibodies against it', 'ankihub_id': '01fda1c7-959c-4d93-8477-640481eeed65'}, {'anki_id': 1468531824446.0, 'document': 'Ehlers-Danlos syndrome is characterized by faulty collagen synthesis causing hyperextensible skin', 'ankihub_id': 'de0ffa9e-edcb-4f0d-bf58-30c972c15eba'}, {'anki_id': 1557584908094.0, 'document': 'Pathergy test can be used to diagnose Behçet syndrome - Pathergy is an exaggerated ulcerated skin response to minor trauma (e.g., needle stick injury) - Pathergy may also be associated with development of pyoderma gangrenosum', 'ankihub_id': '4d018266-85af-40e6-a5f1-825759e296ad'}, {'anki_id': 1516754662170.0, 'document': 'In Legg-Calvé-Perthes , there is a(n) idiopathic mechanism of obstruction of blood to the femoral head - Thought to be related to factors that disrupt blood supply to the femoral head (coagulation abnormalities, trauma) - If blood supply to the epiphysis is disrupted, the bone dies → avascular necrosis', 'ankihub_id': '4bc684bf-c038-43fc-8509-c5b57d8337e7'}, {'anki_id': 1518568307229.0, 'document': 'Superficial partial thickness burns involve which layers of the skin? Epidermis, superficial dermis Superficial dermis = papillary dermis', 'ankihub_id': 'b0e44b32-6b76-4787-83c5-3ef30bb09b70'}, {'anki_id': 1524406406845.0, 'document': 'Biopsy of a lesion in syphilis (at all stages) will reveal proliferative endarteritis of small vessels with surrounding lymphocytes and plasma cells', 'ankihub_id': 'ae7594f5-758f-4049-b555-04e9fae57076'}, {'anki_id': 1686427339913.0, 'document': 'Autoimmune polyendocrine syndrome type 2 (Schmidt syndrome / APS-2) is characterized by a triad of: - Adrenal insufficiency - Autoimmune thyroid disease - T1DM - Classically associated with antibodies against adrenal steroid enzymes (e.g., 17α-hydroxylase) - Other associated conditions include alopecia areata, pernicious anemia, vitiligo, myasthenia gravis, and rheumatoid arthritis Autoimmune Polyendocrine Syndromes APS-1 APS-2 Clinical Features Adrenal insufficency, hypoparathyroidism, chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis, ectodermal dystrophy Adrenal insufficiency, autoimmune thyroid disease (e.g., Hashimoto or Graves), T1DM Age of Onset Childhood Adulthood Genetic Association AIRE gene mutaton HLA-DR3/DR-4', 'ankihub_id': '0a164c7a-0b78-463a-b066-718fe15a4a05'}, {'anki_id': 1517255304520.0, 'document': "Zellweger syndrome is a(n) autosomal recessive ::inheritance leukodystrophy caused by defective peroxisome biogenesis ::process Unable to metabolize VLCFA's and branched chain fatty acids (e.g., phytanic acid) and unable to synthesize plasmalogens", 'ankihub_id': '2d0addb8-39d9-45e9-8df8-4898c08a760e'}, {'anki_id': 1479351736926.0, 'document': 'Neurulation begins in the third week of fetal development', 'ankihub_id': '0de9da36-c452-4095-9144-d50fdb6b63d1'}, {'anki_id': 1484704987455.0, 'document': 'Post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis (PSGN) is a complication of GAS pharyngitis or skin infection that presents with hematuria (cola-colored urine) and facial swelling Subepithelial immune complex deposition → Complement activation → Glomerular damage - C3 and CH 50 are decreased - C4 is normal or slightly decreased', 'ankihub_id': 'eae45d7d-cef8-43d8-ab00-7d9a9b889594'}, {'anki_id': 1488418289795.0, 'document': 'Inflammation in polymyositis is cell -mediated, predominantly involving CD 8 + T cells - Increased expression of MHC1 antigens on sarcolemma is observed - vs. dermatomyositis which is antibody -mediated, predominantly involving CD 4 + T cells - Poly myositis → 8 > 4', 'ankihub_id': 'b8fa9b53-db67-438e-b661-8a82ec2ddb5f'}, {'anki_id': 1467819717437.0, 'document': 'Xeroderma pigmentosum is an inherited pathology due to a defective nucleotide excision repair pathway - This is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner - Can diagnose by measurement of repair mechanisms in WBCs', 'ankihub_id': '4789211e-1733-4936-8c2c-28e5f3db3f89'}, {'anki_id': 1471806647224.0, 'document': 'What significant laboratory finding is associated with eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA)? Positive p-ANCA::not eosinophilia or IgE - p-ANCA = perinuclear anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibody; also known as MPO-ANCA and anti-myeloperoxidase - EGPA was formerly known as Churg-Strauss syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '90dce8cb-76d6-4db6-b5e4-a09a2510a6de'}, {'anki_id': 1405189766131.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the alveolar , tracheal , and bronchial epithelium ? Endoderm However airway cartilage is from mesoderm', 'ankihub_id': 'c767a162-1cd6-405e-9ec9-788400598337'}, {'anki_id': 1503965930531.0, 'document': 'What is the likely underlying infection in a patient with recurrent blisters on sun-exposed areas with fatigue , nausea , and elevated LFTs ? Chronic hepatitis C infection - The patient likely has porphyria cutanea tarda , which is strongly associated with HCV → screen all patients with PCT for HCV! - PCT is frequently associated with hepatitis C and manifests as photosensitivity with blisters and skin fragility ; it may be triggered by alcohol or estrogens (e.g., OCPs) - Do not confuse with lichen planus which is a rare , chronic inflammatory skin disease that is also associated with Hepatitis C (HCV)', 'ankihub_id': 'd93b22e7-a0eb-4688-94a7-34661a909bb4'}, {'anki_id': 1582230503797.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the tracheal cartilage ? Meso::Endo/Meso/Ectoderm', 'ankihub_id': '9ed7e0f7-ea9c-4202-a238-a4c4189690bd'}, {'anki_id': 1479351739996.0, 'document': 'The notochord induces the overlying ectoderm to form the neural plate ( neuroectoderm )', 'ankihub_id': 'faefbbe2-59c5-4165-af1a-8e46c27ce5bb'}, {'anki_id': 1462228925054.0, 'document': 'In addition to "Orphan Annie eye" nuclei, papillary thyroid carcinoma may have cells with intranuclear grooves and inclusions the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously (© AnkiHub, LLC)', 'ankihub_id': 'e2e3e325-22ae-4c64-ab8e-5f225eea05b9'}, {'anki_id': 1678812591398.0, 'document': 'What is the most likely diagnosis in a patient with recurrent , pruritic , vesicular rash that primarily affects the palms , soles , and fingers ? Dyshidrotic eczema - AKA acute palmoplantar eczema, pompholyx - Treat with steroids', 'ankihub_id': '21090476-b119-4f66-ad77-b901899c84fa'}, {'anki_id': 1475713371980.0, 'document': 'A(n) " membranous" glomerular disorder is characterized by thickening of the glomerular basement membrane', 'ankihub_id': '31ef6252-5a46-49b4-bb8d-28633e6fa6a1'}, {'anki_id': 1518569426384.0, 'document': 'Deep partial thickness burns involve which layers of the skin? Epidermis, superficial dermis, deep dermis - Superficial dermis = papillary dermis - Deep dermis = reticular dermis , CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '1fa6ae84-6892-4ef4-92bc-4154cad31e00'}, {'anki_id': 1585609953732.0, 'document': 'Autoimmune polyendocrine syndrome type 1 (APS-1) is characterized by a triad of: - Hypoparathyroidism - Adrenal insufficiency - Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis APS-1 is due to mutations in the autoimmune regulatory gene (AIRE) which lead to impaired negative selection of T-cells Mnemonic: "without AIRE , your body will CHAR " C hronic mucocutaneous candidiasis H ypoparathyroidism A drenal insufficiency R ecurrent candida infections Autoimmune Polyendocrine Syndromes APS-1 APS-2 Clinical Features Adrenal insufficiency, hypoparathyroidism, chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis, ectodermal dystrophy Adrenal insufficiency, autoimmune thyroid disease (e.g., Hashimoto or Graves), T1DM Age of Onset Childhood Adulthood Genetic Association AIRE gene mutation HLA-DR3/DR-4', 'ankihub_id': '6f323bc7-fdb7-4d8c-b09d-9d42fb03173f'}, {'anki_id': 1471806392633.0, 'document': 'Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA) is a small-vessel vasculitis GPA was formerly known as Wegener granulomatosis', 'ankihub_id': 'c84c85ab-3dec-49b1-89c1-be06d98f1e3e'}, {'anki_id': 1522767851746.0, 'document': 'A Bartholin cyst may develop into a(n) abscess secondary to obstruction and inflammation', 'ankihub_id': '867ca59d-57d2-4d86-84b7-97c41f8bccb9'}, {'anki_id': 1471806359114.0, 'document': 'Thromboangiitis obliterans (Buerger disease) is a form of segmenting medium-vessel vasculitis that extends into contiguous veins and nerves - Buerger disease is also known as thromboangiitis obliterans - Extension into veins and nerves is rarely seen in other types of vasculitis; commonly involves the tibial and radial arteries - This relatively spares the vessel wall (intact internal elastic lamina)', 'ankihub_id': '84962ec8-d959-4ef2-b283-032c507bd092'}, {'anki_id': 1572897100639.0, 'document': 'PSGN may display leukocytic (lots of nuclei present) infiltrate in the mesangium and endothelium on light microscopy Immune complex deposits below the podocyte foot processes, creating subepithelial humps', 'ankihub_id': '663c4c5b-d7be-4b04-9066-639b312e1194'}, {'anki_id': 1545848012792.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis ? Described as groups of flesh-colored to erythematous papules that coalesce to form an annular plaque on a distal extremity Granuloma annulare No scaling (tinea corporis has scaling) Annular = ring-shaped', 'ankihub_id': '85a850a6-2c12-4fc8-8cb8-31774d7c582b'}, {'anki_id': 1517365356878.0, 'document': 'IPEX syndrome is associated with a variety of dermatological findings , but in particular patients present with dermatitis , nail dystrophy , and other autoimmune dermatologic conditions (especially autoimmune alopecia ) James Heilman, MD , CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons; Anthere , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '569fdf60-f831-4133-82d6-3db2e330b29b'}, {'anki_id': 1463101220961.0, 'document': 'What demographic is most commonly associated with embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma ( sarcoma botryoides )? Girls < 4 years old Rare malignant mesenchymal proliferation of immature skeletal muscle', 'ankihub_id': '7df33fa2-f8e5-4ea2-bafa-6d3e2a9a9d9c'}, {'anki_id': 1488502588078.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is characterized histologically by acanthosis with parakeratosis i.e. epidermal hyperplasia of the stratum spinosum (acanthosis) and retention of keratinocyte nuclei in the stratum corneum (parakeratosis) Panel a: lesional psoriatic skin Panel b: non-lesional psoriatic skin', 'ankihub_id': '106318bc-edb6-49e6-8cdf-883a26b029d1'}, {'anki_id': 1462223891730.0, 'document': 'Histologically , Hashimoto thyroiditis is associated with chronic inflammation with well-developed germinal centers This is an autoimmune disorder as T-cells attack thyroid and B-cells get activated', 'ankihub_id': '4c9e42ce-df0c-4100-bf08-b5bfbd0ad06d'}, {'anki_id': 1482191354802.0, 'document': 'Behçet syndrome occurs due to immune-complex vasculitis involving primarily small vessels Due to Th 17 dysfunction and associated with HLA-B51', 'ankihub_id': 'a35cc890-af99-4835-96d4-59fc10ec8711'}, {'anki_id': 1475376628335.0, 'document': 'Which causes of pauci-immune glomerulonephritis are associated with p-ANCA (MPO-ANCA)? Microscopic polyangiitis (MPA), eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA)::2 - No Ig / C3 deposition - EGPA was formerly known as Churg-Strauss syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '722b876d-1827-4c61-8f1e-5a2fb20350cc'}, {'anki_id': 1505744613897.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with a history of poorly controlled HIV who presents with floaters and blurred vision ? Funduscopic examination reveals yellow-white exudates adjacent to the fovea and retinal vessels CMV retinitis CMV is painless and characterized by perivascular lesions (vs HSV, which is painful and characterized by peripheral pale lesions and central retinal necrosis) a Gallery , Public Domain, Willis Lam , CC BY-SA 2.0 , via Wikimedia Commons; the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously, licensed under CC BY-SA 2.0', 'ankihub_id': '1689e90c-1913-423b-a5ae-aa4b213dd148'}, {'anki_id': 1578248499297.0, 'document': 'C1 esterase inhibitor deficiency (C1-INH) is a(n) autosomal dominant ::inheritance pattern primary immunodeficiency that presents with widespread angioedema Can involve GI tract too', 'ankihub_id': 'fd9fbee1-87c7-495f-8ec2-2f02139d1886'}, {'anki_id': 1518401707034.0, 'document': 'The carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) is a serum tumor marker that has major associations with colorectal and pancreatic cancers Applications : - Monitoring treatment : tracks treatment effectiveness - Detecting recurrence : persistent elevated levels post-resection may suggest recurrence - Staging and localization : assists in cancer staging and spread localization through biological fluid measurement - Major associations : Colorectal and Pancreatic Cancers - Minor Associations : Gastric and Breast Cancers', 'ankihub_id': '184218c6-f5c3-438b-9a86-4b92dbab7f8a'}, {'anki_id': 1525462354077.0, 'document': 'Febrile neutropenia is a fever with an absolute neutrophil count (ANC) < 500 cells/mm 3 often seen during chemotherapy - These patients are at risk for severe infection (most commonly due to endogenous bacterial flora ), thus broad spectrum antibiotic therapy is indicated - Monotherapy with an antipseudomonal beta-lactam (e.g., cefepime, meropenem, piperacillin-tazobactam) provides both gram-negative and gram-positive coverage and is recommended initially - Give filgrastim/sargramostim to boost defenses', 'ankihub_id': 'a329ae06-ad5e-4c08-9544-93c32e2e3dee'}, {'anki_id': 1549111730028.0, 'document': 'What is the treatment of androgen insensitivity syndrome ( phenotypic female with 46-XY )? Bilateral gonadectomy after puberty Decreases the risk of testicular malignancy but allows for completion of puberty ( testosterone for attainment of adult height) Andrew cry- ptorchidism because of breast and no genitals', 'ankihub_id': '67e9baf7-10df-4e05-880e-a11a1da9be27'}, {'anki_id': 1484872061892.0, 'document': 'Scalded skin syndrome is caused by Staphylococcus aureus ::which organism? Exfoliative exotoxin destroys the keratinocyte attachments in the stratum granulosum, resulting in the skin sloughing off CNX OpenStax, CC BY 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': 'dcb47774-1a75-4197-880f-4679f785177a'}, {'anki_id': 1544832356705.0, 'document': 'Primary immunodeficiency ::Immunology disorder increases the risk for autoimmune disease , malignancy , and infection *Bonus: what is the most common malignancy seen? *Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) - Also ↑ risk for bronchiectasis and sinopulmonary infection', 'ankihub_id': 'b2f7145f-3f0e-4b55-b0bb-ab51ee5cb189'}, {'anki_id': 1500419514988.0, 'document': 'Silver (methenamine)::2 names stain is used to stain: Fungi Pneumocystis jirovecii Cryptococcus neoformans Coccidioides Bacteria Legionella H. pylori איתן פרמן , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons; the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously, licensed under CC BY-SA 2.0', 'ankihub_id': '90b86c09-c5a1-457f-b954-8d2c1daf793f'}, {'anki_id': 1552143381121.0, 'document': 'The best initial pharmacological therapy for peripheral neuropathy is pregabalin or gabapentin :: 2 - Options include pregabalin (1st choice), amitriptyline (TCA), and venlafaxine / duloxetine (SNRI) - Treatment also includes addressing the underlying cause (e.g., glycemic control for patients with diabetes)', 'ankihub_id': 'ec0e1546-e472-404c-a318-39c42675525b'}, {'anki_id': 1505163055122.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an elderly patient with multiple ecchymoses on the hands and forearms ? The lesions are not itchy nor painful and laboratory studies are within normal limits. Senile purpura - Due to age-related loss of elastic fibers in perivascular connective tissue → easy bruising - Usually spontaneously regress over weeks without intervention', 'ankihub_id': '8b3d94cc-4904-4ef8-8b9b-a1c380942454'}, {'anki_id': 1471806250450.0, 'document': 'Early lesions of polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) are characterized by transmural inflammation with fibrinoid necrosis - This weakens the vessel wall and facilitates aneurysm formation - Late lesions of polyarteritis nodosa are characterized by fibrosis', 'ankihub_id': 'c6ac3fe7-fb06-4b84-8b9f-abdfb28a07b3'}, {'anki_id': 1556715628409.0, 'document': 'Oligohydramnios is characterized by an amniotic fluid index ≤ 5 cm or a single deepest pocket ≤ 2 cm - Oligohydramnios = indication for delivery in late-term pregnancies (sign of uteroplacental insufficiency) - Increased risk of uteroplacental insufficiency in late term (41 wks–41 wks and 6 days) and post term (≥ 42 wks) pregnancies → consider / recommend induction of labor - Biophysical profile : Started at 41 wks to assess fetal well-being; may show late decelerations and oligohydramnios - Pathophysiology : aging placenta → decreased fetal perfusion → decreased fetal renal perfusion → decreased fetal urinary output → oligohydramnios', 'ankihub_id': 'bbffcbd5-992d-4060-977b-97e47b18cae0'}, {'anki_id': 1486952569377.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of lymphocytes in the thymus ? Mesoderm - Thymus epithelium is derived from third pharyngeal pouch (endoderm), whereas thymic lymphocytes are of mesodermal origin - This card used to say "mesenchymal origin" but has been updated to "mesoderm" per AMBOSS & FA24 (Jan 2025)', 'ankihub_id': '03dbdc64-f640-46cd-babe-cad0efd759e3'}, {'anki_id': 1504830934779.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with recent steroid use who presents with uniform-appearing , erythematous papules across the back, shoulders, and upper arms ? The papules appear to be in same stage of development and do not have associated comedones Drug-induced acne (e.g., secondary to glucocorticoid use)', 'ankihub_id': '201e849b-865c-4c3f-9f20-69434f1b82f5'}, {'anki_id': 1475376529252.0, 'document': 'Rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis (RPGN) is characterized by crescents in Bowman space of the glomeruli ( light microscopy ) Hence, RPGN may be referred to as crescentic glomerulonephritis 3 mechanisms of this disease: - Anti-basement membrane disease → e.g., Goodpasture syndrome - Immune complexes → e.g., Lupus nephritis , IgA nephropathy - Vasculitis → e.g., granulomatosis with polyangiitis , microscopic polyangiitis', 'ankihub_id': '5cf1f070-cad8-453e-9a56-fbacf53930e2'}, {'anki_id': 1475364052433.0, 'document': 'MPGN type I is associated with subendothelial::location immune complex deposits "Tram track" appearance on PAS stain', 'ankihub_id': '5099f057-06c8-4e49-a480-abd732cf3d31'}, {'anki_id': 1478995320576.0, 'document': 'When temperatures drop below 30 °C , IgM AIHA antibodies may bind RBCs and activate complement - This occurs particularly in the extremities, as the RBC IgM complexes return back to the core the temperature increases - causing IgM to dissociate and leave C3 behind (which gets inactivated by DAF / MIRL); opsonized cells are cleared by the spleen - HOWEVER extreme activation of complement can lead to intravascular hemolysis', 'ankihub_id': 'e4146c64-6f79-45c3-a702-12c1fc3513e3'}, {'anki_id': 1509813091692.0, 'document': 'What drug is used in prophylaxis of toxoplasmosis (Toxoplasma gondii) ? TMP-SMX - Indicated for toxoplasmosis prophylaxis when CD4 count <100 cells/mm 3 (also used as prophylaxis of Pneumocystis pneumonia) - Sulfadiazine + pyrimethamine is used for treatment', 'ankihub_id': 'cfd2ab44-f39c-46df-b862-af3b45e3396e'}, {'anki_id': 1504224420389.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young adult with gray mucosal patches in the mouth, widespread (esp. epitrochlear ) lymphadenopathy , and a diffuse maculopapular rash ? Paget disease of the breast - Indications for urgent referral to breast cancer clinic: older age , unilateral involvement (skin or nipple change, bloody nipple discharge), refractory to steroids → more likely Paget vs. eczema - Male ≥ 50 years presenting with unilateral, firm subareolar mass → urgent referral to breast cancer clinic - Paget cells are malignant intraepithelial adenocarcinoma cells', 'ankihub_id': '35fb843e-5ea8-4061-b6fb-ab358aed194f'}, {'anki_id': 1556449884176.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an 8 year old male that presents with chronic hip / knee pain with limited internal rotation / abduction of the affected hip? The gait is antalgic Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease - Idiopathic osteonecrosis of the femoral head that typically presents in boys age 4 - 10 years old ; initial X-rays may be negative - Antalgic = shorter time weight bearing on the bad side secondary to pain - Compare with slipped capital femoral epiphysis ( 10 - 16 y/o and obese with posterior displacement of femoral head; "slip on the fat") Moderate grade SCFE on the right side', 'ankihub_id': 'e5c1d968-17ec-4254-950b-b1400e4b97b5'}, {'anki_id': 1584121453264.0, 'document': 'What level of random serum glucose is diagnostic for type 2 diabetes mellitus ? > 200 mg/dL on 2 separate occasions/1 symptomatic occasion 200 mg/dL = 11.1 mM', 'ankihub_id': 'e05ea121-2c29-4d9a-8fd4-68f1754ed281'}, {'anki_id': 1556459078626.0, 'document': 'Lytic bone lesion, eczema, and hypernatremia / polyuria is suggestive of Langerhans cell histiocytosis::diagnosis - Langerhans cell invades the bone (lytic lesion), skin (eczema), and CNS (central DI) - Symptoms : lytic bone lesions, purplish papules, eczematous rash, lymphadenopathy, hepatosplenomegaly, pulmonary cysts / nodules, central DI - Diagnosis : Langerhans cells / Birbeck granules on bone / skin biopsy - Treatment : chemotherapy (prednisone + vinblastine), desmopressin (central DI)', 'ankihub_id': '46e7a970-6dab-45fd-9ef3-b1525b8221d3'}, {'anki_id': 1486831451445.0, 'document': 'B cells stimulated in germinal centers of Peyer patches differentiate into IgA-secreting plasma cells , which reside in the lamina propria IgA receives a protective secretory component and is then transported across the epithelium to the gut to deal with intraluminal antigen', 'ankihub_id': 'c0c2b725-1c54-448b-9b80-1c7222fef1d8'}, {'anki_id': 1506457874779.0, 'document': 'What is used for prevention of respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) in premature infants ? Used with permission.', 'ankihub_id': '26a0d1f5-65ef-479a-bfe6-a43ddde35d0d'}, {'anki_id': 1506292746852.0, 'document': 'Congenital varicella syndrome can result in dermatomal scarring::cutaneous pathology Results from maternal infection within the first two trimesters Characterized by: - Limb hypoplasia - Cutaneous dermatomal scarring - Blindness', 'ankihub_id': '41573f3d-e38d-4fd6-8fb3-0716db9defdb'}, {'anki_id': 1545268100346.0, 'document': "What is the likely diagnosis ? Urticaria Gzzz , CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons - Urticaria is characterized by raised, round or oval lesions that can change in size and appearance. They often have a red border (flare) and a pale center (wheal) - The condition may be caused by exposure to drugs, food, or other substances. A patient's medical history (e.g., drug, food, substance exposure) is important for diagnosis - A skin biopsy may be performed to confirm the diagnosis (nonspecific and not often done), but the distinctive appearance of the lesions is often enough for diagnosis", 'ankihub_id': '16bd8cd6-4a6b-41cf-b57d-574fa26cda10'}, {'anki_id': 1495901480538.0, 'document': 'What test/imaging study is the best diagnostic test for bronchiectasis ? High-resolution CT (HRCT) scan of the chest::Specific Characteristic findings include bronchial dilation , lack of airway tapering , and bronchial wall thickening (arrows) Three red arrows were added to image Bronchiectasis:', 'ankihub_id': '00e845e9-b6cc-482b-90e3-053fc3e59cc8'}, {'anki_id': 1476666833848.0, 'document': 'Protoporphyrin and Fe 2+ combine to form heme via the enzyme ferrochelatase Occurs in the mitochondria', 'ankihub_id': 'a6626a6d-d08c-461b-83be-4d2d9716faa7'}, {'anki_id': 1478995281604.0, 'document': 'Which form of immune hemolytic anemia may be caused by drugs ? Vesicle e.g., chickenpox, shingles Chicken pox:', 'ankihub_id': 'c4517687-f89e-4e84-a050-398ca562665b'}, {'anki_id': 1426105286514.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis ? Toxic epidermal necrolysis - Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS) : severe form of erythema multiforme affecting the mucous membranes and leading to plaque formation - May have myalgia, nausea, vomiting, pain in eye & mouth, and/or risk of dehydration due to the associated sloughing of skin - Treatment of SJS: In a burn unit stop the causative agent; administer steroids, analgesia & fluids - Toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) : Severe form of SJS with a high mortality rate (~30%), ↓ WBC, ↓ Hb, ↑ ALT and AST - Treatment of TEN: In a burn unit stop the causative agent; administer steroids, analgesia, fluids, IVIG, and acyclovir', 'ankihub_id': '690d0ea5-97b0-4d70-9285-8b65b1cef854'}, {'anki_id': 1585866270473.0, 'document': 'Sympathetic ophthalmia may present as unilateral or bilateral granulomatous anterior uveitis - This is an autoimmune reaction against retinal antigens that occurs days to years after a penetrating ocular injury or, less commonly, ocular surgery - Damage to the eye can sensitize the immune system to retinal antigens and subsequently cause bilateral granulomatous anterior uveitis - This manifests with bilateral eye pain, redness, and photophobia as seen in this case - Evidence of inflammation of the anterior chamber on slit lamp examination is typical - This patient is at risk of bilateral blindness; immediately initiate treatment with glucocorticoids', 'ankihub_id': '8f38d1c7-3e95-452f-b3ee-eeb4d3378526'}, {'anki_id': 1482191351300.0, 'document': 'Behçet syndrome is characterized by a triad of: - Recurrent aphthous ulcers - Uveitis - Genital ulcers - Classically presents in a young adult of Turkish, Middle Eastern, or Asian descent - Other manifestations include thrombosis and skin lesions (e.g., erythema nodosum) - Use colchicine to prevent recurrence - Mnemonic: Turkish RUG ( R ecurrent aphthous ulcers, U veitis, G enital ulcers)', 'ankihub_id': '26665cbd-2e17-4a7b-9b14-ad1984695203'}, {'anki_id': 1475376552582.0, 'document': 'Goodpasture syndrome is a form of rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis (RPGN) that presents with a(n) linear pattern on immunofluorescence', 'ankihub_id': '6966b443-bd7f-4586-b379-591c9bc69608'}, {'anki_id': 1482886699064.0, 'document': 'Hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia is also known as Osler-Weber-Rendu syndrome Presents with blanching skin lesions ( telangiectasias ), recurrent epistaxis, skin discoloration, AV malformations , GI bleeding , and hematuria', 'ankihub_id': '6362cd40-cf77-43e2-b913-3b8b130aebba'}, {'anki_id': 1487815322485.0, 'document': 'The characteristics of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) may be remembered with the mnemonic RASH OR PAIN R ash (malar or discoid) A rthritis (usually involving ≥ 2 joints) S erositis (pleuritis and pericarditis) H ematologic disorders (e.g., cytopenias) O ral or nasopharyngeal ulcers (usually painless) R enal disease P hotosensitivity A ntinuclear antibodies I mmunologic disorder (anti-dsDNA, anti-Sm, antiphospholipid) N eurologic disorder (seizures, psychosis)', 'ankihub_id': '1ee9512b-99ae-47f0-9edc-eb49c091de4b'}, {'anki_id': 1474763455361.0, 'document': 'The basement membrane of the glomerular filtration barrier contains heparan sulfate , which acts as a(n) negative charge barrier - Also contains type IV collagen; Crohn disease', 'ankihub_id': '618efb63-2395-4e20-9e84-a365e8edbfc2'}, {'anki_id': 1473388953084.0, 'document': 'Which two vasculitides are associated with positive serum p-ANCA ? Eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA) and microscopic polyangiitis (MPA) - Microscopic polyangiitis also lacks asthma and eosinophils - EGPA was formerly known as Churg-Strauss syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '0c44c5e4-42d2-4c3c-bc2c-704bbbd4a1b2'}, {'anki_id': 1578107966397.0, 'document': 'Pathogenesis of polymyositis begins with increased expression of MHC I on the sarcolemma Over-expression of MHC I proteins on the sarcolemma leads to infiltration with CD8+ T cells and myocyte damage', 'ankihub_id': '5567ca29-d1a8-467c-857d-f8fd531f5c0b'}, {'anki_id': 1503262211398.0, 'document': 'Tuberculoid leprosy is associated with a strong Th 1 -cell response, allowing for cell-mediated immunity - Also referred to as pauci bacillary leprosy - Mediates granuloma formation - Recall that Th 1 cells are responsible for cell-mediated immunity', 'ankihub_id': '92160ec2-0c6d-4498-ac7b-a3f2364fd0b8'}, {'anki_id': 1475376651770.0, 'document': 'IgA nephropathy is characterized by mesangial ::specific proliferation on light microscopy', 'ankihub_id': '65e898ec-dda1-4d40-a1c1-3072aaab858b'}, {'anki_id': 1462061140097.0, 'document': 'Glucocorticoids decrease glucose utilization by tissues and decrease insulin sensitivity of adipose tissue Diabetogenic effect', 'ankihub_id': '2d6f32a1-b41b-4d15-be0f-b5718aa29853'}, {'anki_id': 1462913613399.0, 'document': 'Which type(s) of diabetes mellitus may be treated with pramlintide (amylin analogs)? Type 1 and type 2 - vs. oral hypoglycemic drugs which treat T2DM only - Helpful in T1DM because it deals with the unopposed glucagon aspect of T1DM', 'ankihub_id': '040f367f-0ad8-4c0c-b0b7-665a7ee5298d'}, {'anki_id': 1692547647303.0, 'document': 'Causes of drug-induced lupus (DILE) may be remembered with the mnemonic HEαPS PIMP H ydralazine E tanercept α -methyldopa / IFN- α P henytoin S ulfa drugs P rocainamide I soniazid M ethimazole P ropylthiouracil (PTU) - Associated with anti-histone antibodies - Underlying etiology is believed to be genetic (presence of a genetic mutation that causes decreased acetyltransferase activity or presence of HLA-DR2, HLA-DR3, HLA-DR4, or an unexpressed C4 complement allele) - Also minocycline', 'ankihub_id': '02725426-4278-4151-a1f8-61067465946c'}, {'anki_id': 1500055049050.0, 'document': 'Branching hyphae similar to that of rose bushes are classically seen in Sporothrix schenckii ::which fungus? Culture grown at 25ºC ; the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously (© AnkiHub, LLC)', 'ankihub_id': '8cf70af1-8ad2-4cc8-9ec0-c9d5ce112312'}, {'anki_id': 1471806497406.0, 'document': 'Microscopic polyangiitis (MPA) is a small-vessel vasculitis', 'ankihub_id': '6830a2b4-ed65-4918-a975-c63ed15f2fd3'}, {'anki_id': 1471806188325.0, 'document': 'Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) is a medium-vessel vasculitis Immune-complex mediated', 'ankihub_id': '169f5ad4-e450-4432-859a-514700b3d50d'}, {'anki_id': 1488502580314.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is due to excessive keratinocyte::cell type proliferation Panel a: lesional psoriatic skin Panel b: non-lesional psoriatic skin', 'ankihub_id': 'ca92d0b3-fecb-4e39-8d8b-b051feba6085'}, {'anki_id': 1489112939263.0, 'document': 'What is the embryonic origin of the odontoblasts and bones of the skull ? Neural crest', 'ankihub_id': '2d84f591-2253-4294-8d46-b82720d3fbd5'}, {'anki_id': 1520444509518.0, 'document': 'What class of acute phase reactant can lead to amyloidosis when upregulated during chronic inflammation? Serum amyloid A (SAA) - AKA Serum amyloid-associated protein These proteins have a wide variety of roles: - Transport cholesterol to liver for bile (bile has antimicrobial membrane disruption properties) - Recruitment of immune cells to inflammatory sites - Induction of enzymes that degrade extracellular matrix (allowing inflammatory cells to migrate more rapidly)', 'ankihub_id': '98cc7163-b33c-4f41-a864-1791569b77d8'}, {'anki_id': 1472160901304.0, 'document': 'Ventricular septal defect leads to an increased O 2 saturation in the RV and pulmonary artery Oxygenated blood from the left ventricle crosses over to the RV and enters the pulmonary artery The original uploader was Drickey at English Wikipedia. , CC BY-SA 2.5 , via Wikimedia Commons; the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously, licensed under CC BY-SA 2.5', 'ankihub_id': '0f0e194f-c0f6-41ef-8b31-4be98003fbad'}, {'anki_id': 1496111443409.0, 'document': 'Pap smears are used to detect cervical dysplasia (CIN) before it becomes carcinoma - Cervical cells from area of the transformation cell are scraped using a brush and analyzed under a microscope - Abnormal pap smear is followed by a confirmatory colposcopy / biopsy - This is a form of secondary disease prevention - Limitations include inadequate sampling of transformation zone and limited efficacy in screening for adenocarcinoma', 'ankihub_id': '22682208-968f-48ab-a7fc-d830ebd381e8'}, {'anki_id': 1488418093751.0, 'document': 'Inflammation in dermatomyositis is antibody -mediated, predominantly involving CD 4 + T cells - CD4+ = derm4+omyositis - vs. polymyositis which is cell -mediated, predominantly CD 8 + T cells', 'ankihub_id': '74f66d18-1825-43b6-a30a-ac4db573b223'}, {'anki_id': 1583940566011.0, 'document': 'Rheumatoid arthritis may present with a(n) pannus , characterized by inflamed granulation tissue inside the joint capsule Which leads to ongoing inflammation due to cytokine by the pannus', 'ankihub_id': '05e8e61a-4f9d-4390-b9c7-362c0be7ee14'}, {'anki_id': 1484104018030.0, 'document': 'Acute inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (AIDP) is the most common subtype of Guillain-Barré syndrome - AIDP represents 60–80% of GBS cases - Treat with IVIG or plasmapheresis', 'ankihub_id': 'dc29df58-d48f-4b25-b26c-cd1b9ebbe8e6'}, {'anki_id': 1496607797915.0, 'document': 'What is the best test to screen for the initial stages of diabetic nephropathy ? Urine test for albumin :creatinine ratio - Either spot or timed urine collection for microalbuminuria - Preferred over dipsticks since dipsticks only detect excess urinary protein when > 300mg/24hr ( macro albuminuria) and thus are not useful for screening - Late renal disease may manifest as severe albuminuria with reduced GFR', 'ankihub_id': '120db928-bb6e-4ba2-b238-833f9c181422'}, {'anki_id': 1473638507055.0, 'document': 'Berylliosis is characterized by a(n) granulomatous histology and therefore is occasionally responsive to treatment with glucocorticoids', 'ankihub_id': '94275896-08c0-4e2a-ad5e-a1add37188f8'}, {'anki_id': 1554717919005.0, 'document': 'Pulmonary exam of CHF::CHF/COPD exacerbation will show bibasilar crackles , respiratory alkalosis ± wheezing - Respiratory alkalosis and ↓ CO 2 due to tachypnea, bibasilar crackles due to LV dysfunction leading to fluid backup (pleural effusion) - Pulmonary exam of COPD exacerbation = more wheezing and respiratory acidosis due to CO 2 retention', 'ankihub_id': '01173436-0068-478e-82e9-3d7ad69b8c85'}, {'anki_id': 1488154036143.0, 'document': 'Rickets may present with rachitic rosary due to osteoid deposition at the costochondral junction "Bead like" FotoKatolik from Polska , CC BY-SA 2.0 , via Wikimedia Commons; the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously, licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0', 'ankihub_id': '4ae158d4-b369-47ba-95fe-dbd9233162b6'}, {'anki_id': 1516579935876.0, 'document': 'A healthy-appearing newborn (e.g., 2–5 days of life) presents with scattered blanchable erythematous papules that spare the palms / soles. Secondary amyloidosis (AA) Facial swelling, lower extremity edema, and massive proteinuria are consistent with nephrotic syndrome (think deposition everywhere); these are secondary to the underlying inflammatory condition', 'ankihub_id': '12a556e3-000e-4be5-85bd-3431032a2681'}, {'anki_id': 1487815322484.0, 'document': 'The characteristics of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) may be remembered with the mnemonic " RASH OR PAIN ": R ash (malar or discoid):: R (skin) A rthritis (usually involving ≥ 2 joints):: A (symptom) S erositis (pleuritis and pericarditis):: S H ematologic disorders (e.g., cytopenias):: H O ral or nasopharyngeal ulcers (usually painless):: O R enal disease:: R P hotosensitivity:: P A ntinuclear antibodies:: A I mmunologic disorder (anti-dsDNA, anti-Sm, antiphospholipid):: I N eurologic disorder (seizures, psychosis):: N (+2 examples) Needs ≥ 4 criteria to diagnose', 'ankihub_id': 'e1812c6e-858e-49e9-8be9-2bf79c1cea66'}, {'anki_id': 1537556677772.0, 'document': 'Bulging fontanelle in an irritable baby is suggestive of meningitis::diagnosis Bulging = full fontanelle', 'ankihub_id': '1eb9b117-1197-43aa-9fa6-c01d4f21933e'}, {'anki_id': 1487550519179.0, 'document': 'Which types of amyloidosis cause deposits systemically ? Destroyed platelets release TXA 2 /ADP causing thrombocytopenia (mucosal bleeding, petechiae, ecchymoses) - Hemosiderinuria is seen days after hemolysis, hemoglobinuria can lead to renal failure - Predominantly intravascular, but can be extravascular (C3 fragments can act as opsonin) - There are no dermatological findings in this porphyria - * Common P-450 inducer triggers : Anticonvulsants, sulfonamides, anesthetics, hormone therapy - * Other triggers : Alcohol, smoking, endogenous sex hormones, fasting/diet, metabolic stress (e.g., surgery, infection) - ** Psychological disturbances : hallucinations, disorientation, insomnia, anxiety - Other associated symptoms : Nausea/vomiting, constipation, seizure', 'ankihub_id': 'd1799ffe-0e96-4e90-8213-d609cf26edb8'}, {'anki_id': 1463349512978.0, 'document': 'Breast tissue is a modified sweat gland that is embryologically derived from skin', 'ankihub_id': '4b1ee578-f53f-40a0-8e97-4159d43e9df5'}, {'anki_id': 1509842960812.0, 'document': 'Gardnerella vaginalis presents without itching or burning Trichomonas vaginalis Gardnerella vaginalis Symptoms Itching and burning Lack of irritation Discharge scent Foul Fishy Discharge color Yellow/green Gray/transparent Microscopy finding Motile trophozoites Clue cells', 'ankihub_id': '1a09519e-9091-47a8-aba4-198eceee34ec'}, {'anki_id': 1539167649907.0, 'document': 'Neonatal cephalic pustulosis is a self-limited papulopustular rash seen in babies in the first few weeks of life - Previously known as neonatal acne; now called neonatal cephalic pustulosis because it is NOT caused by androgen-induced stimulation of sebaceous glands (etiology is thought to be Malassezia spp) - Erythematous papules and pustules without comedones or nodulocystic lesions - Limited to face and scalp - Contrast with milia (newborns) and infantile acne (≥ 3 months)', 'ankihub_id': '2629690e-e5dc-4405-a682-f8f88432454f'}, {'anki_id': 1475376644933.0, 'document': 'IgA nephropathy typically follows a(n) respiratory or GI tract infection - IgA production is increased during mucosal infections - AKA Berger disease', 'ankihub_id': '2e5c4c46-0dca-46b7-8506-e9e9071b1b25'}, {'anki_id': 1500053417089.0, 'document': 'Onychomycosis describes dermatophyte infection of the nails Onychomycosis is also known as Tinea unguium "-oneycomb" mycosis', 'ankihub_id': 'df09a1bc-c07a-4386-8962-2ea6c9c94ea1'}, {'anki_id': 1475375262667.0, 'document': 'Nephrotic syndrome occurs due to podocyte damage disrupting the glomerular filtration charge barrier - vs. nephritic syndrome which occurs due to GBM disruption - Nephrotic syndrome may be primary (e.g., direct sclerosis of podocytes/GMB) or secondary (systemic process [e.g., diabetes] damaging podocytes/GMB)', 'ankihub_id': '88d8cbb4-0e48-45f5-b2cb-cbb82efdb230'}]

input:
Psoriatic arthritis is a chronic inflammatory joint disease that occurs in a subset of patients who have psoriasis, a skin disorder characterized by well-demarcated plaques covered in silvery scales. Psoriatic arthritis belongs to the group of seronegative spondyloarthropathies, which share these key features:

Negative Rheumatoid Factor
They typically do not have rheumatoid factor (RF) antibodies—hence the term “seronegative.”

Association With HLA-B27
There is a strong genetic link to the HLA-B27 allele in many patients.

Inflammation of the Axial Skeleton and/or Peripheral Joints
While psoriatic arthritis often involves the small joints of the hands and feet, it can also affect the spine or sacroiliac joints.

Classic Clinical Features
Skin and Nail Findings
Psoriatic arthritis is usually preceded (or accompanied) by psoriasis on the skin—red or “salmon-pink” plaques with silvery scales. Nail pitting (small depressions in the nail plate) or onycholysis (painless separation of the nail from the nail bed) is common.

Joint Involvement

DIP Predilection: Psoriatic arthritis frequently affects the distal interphalangeal (DIP) joints of the hands and feet. This is in contrast to rheumatoid arthritis, which more commonly spares the DIPs.

“Sausage” Digits (Dactylitis): Diffuse swelling of an entire finger or toe (“sausage digit”) caused by inflammation in both the joints and tendons.

“Pencil-in-Cup” Deformity: On X-ray, severe erosion at the DIP joint may give the appearance that the distal end of one bone tapers down into a cup-shaped end of the adjacent bone.

Enthesitis
Inflammation at the sites where tendons/ligaments insert into bones (entheses)—e.g., Achilles tendon insertion. This can cause heel pain or localized tenderness.

Asymmetric Oligoarthritis or Symmetric Polyarthritis
Some patients have only a few joints inflamed (oligoarthritis), and others have multiple joints (polyarthritis) in a distribution resembling rheumatoid arthritis.

Diagnosis
Clinical Examination
Look for psoriasis (active or past), characteristic nail changes, DIP involvement, and sausage digits.

Imaging

X-rays may reveal the classic “pencil-in-cup” deformity, periostitis (new bone formation along the shafts of bones), or erosive changes with adjacent new bone growth.

MRI can help detect enthesitis and early joint inflammation.

Serologies

Rheumatoid factor (RF) and anti-CCP are typically negative (hence “seronegative”).

HLA-B27 status may be checked in spondyloarthropathy workups but is not required for diagnosis.

Treatment
NSAIDs (e.g., Ibuprofen, Naproxen)
Often used first-line for symptomatic relief of mild disease.

DMARDs (Disease-Modifying Antirheumatic Drugs)

Methotrexate is commonly used for patients with moderate to severe psoriatic arthritis and/or significant skin involvement.

Leflunomide can also be helpful by blocking T-cell proliferation.

Biologic Agents

TNF-α inhibitors (e.g., etanercept, adalimumab, infliximab) may be indicated in patients whose symptoms do not respond to traditional DMARDs or who have severe joint or skin disease.

IL-17 or IL-12/IL-23 inhibitors (e.g., secukinumab, ixekizumab, ustekinumab) target specific cytokines implicated in psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis.

Lifestyle Measures

Physical therapy, regular exercise, and weight management can help preserve joint function and reduce stress on weight-bearing joints.

Key Points to Remember
Psoriatic arthritis is one of the seronegative spondyloarthropathies, often involves DIP joints, and can cause “sausage digits.”

Typical skin findings include well-demarcated psoriatic plaques and possible nail pitting.

X-ray may reveal “pencil-in-cup” deformities.

Treatment progresses from NSAIDs for milder disease to DMARDs, and biologics if needed.

IL-23 also leads to stimulation of gamma-delta T cells which is important for the development of psoriatic arthritis. - Newly approved treatment for UC. IL-23 is considered the central cytokine in Crohn and possibly UC (blocked by tildrakizumab )', 'ankihub_id': 'fbc3c6ce-df72-4ba3-aa03-52d2d180055d'}, {'anki_id': 1488248119666.0, 'document': 'Psoriatic arthritis is associated with a(n) " pencil-in-cup " deformity on X-ray Also associated with dactylitis Image(s) provided by www.radiologyassistant.nl . MAY need biopsy to rule out lymphoma if diagnosis is uncertain (e.g., lymphoma history) Watch associated Bootcamp video - Inflammatory Disease of the Skin: Red Plaque Disease', 'ankihub_id': 'f4542cf4-fa4f-44c2-86f0-fc2374c38a06'}, {'anki_id': 1505419268684.0, 'document': 'Spondyloarthropathies often result in inflammation at sites of tendon / ligament insertion (enthesitis), leading to gradual onset of low back pain and progressive stiffness Pain classically improves with activity or exercise', 'ankihub_id': '76d5b755-d8c5-43f9-8f8f-6fefede9a2a9'}, {'anki_id': 1523414928086.0, 'document': 'Many patients with ankylosing spondylitis develop peripheral arthritis and enthesitis (inflammation at tendon insertion into a bone)', 'ankihub_id': 'ddec6c2e-fa77-434f-9846-86dafc5956de'}, {'anki_id': 1553766395942.0, 'document': 'General treatment of seronegative spondyloarthropathies (PEAR) include: (1) NSAIDs (2) Local steroid injections (3) DMARDs (except axial skeleton) (4) TNF-α inhibitors Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs)', 'ankihub_id': '74e42647-19bc-4ac2-b2b5-07363aeac51e'}, {'anki_id': 1488248104781.0, 'document': 'What joint pathology is associated with skin psoriasis and nail lesions (e.g., pitting, onycholysis)? Used with permission.', 'ankihub_id': 'b5c55a89-d394-4ed5-a24a-2ddab491b3ad'}, {'anki_id': 1559071373822.0, 'document': 'Advanced rheumatoid arthritis may cause fibrous ankylosis (near-fused joints) and pannus (fibrovascular synovial hyperplasia) - Pannus: a mass of edematous synovium, inflammatory cells, granulation tissue, and fibroblasts that grows over the articular cartilage and causes erosion. Basically, it is an abnormal layer of fibrovascular tissue or granulation tissue. - Common sites for pannus formation include over the cornea , over a joint surface (as seen in rheumatoid arthritis ), or on a prosthetic heart valve . - Pannus (P) proliferates and releases cks (e.g., ILs, TNF) that eventually destroy the articular cartilage, leading to fusion of the joint by scar tissue (called ankylosis). Bone erosions are caused by osteoclasts.', 'ankihub_id': 'fbf7f794-ab09-4eff-a9e0-7c44d24f7cfd'}, {'anki_id': 1472078824458.0, 'document': 'What anti-neoplastic agents are associated with dilated cardiomyopathy ? Colonoscopy of the entire colon - High risk of concurrent neoplasia in right colon - If adenocarcinoma, also get CT chest, abdomen, and pelvis for staging & order CEA for prognostication', 'ankihub_id': 'cda8e50d-573a-4503-9458-9e976e51782b'}, {'anki_id': 1497197274253.0, 'document': 'Treatment of polymyositis / dermatomyositis involves corticosteroids followed by long-term methotrexate therapy', 'ankihub_id': '5ec042f0-558b-458a-8b5f-7993dfe1f3f7'}, {'anki_id': 1488502558195.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is characterized by well-circumscribed, salmon-colored plaques with silvery scale', 'ankihub_id': '5a548625-072c-4457-8827-44cc1b66e392'}, {'anki_id': 1583940566011.0, 'document': 'Rheumatoid arthritis may present with a(n) pannus , characterized by inflamed granulation tissue inside the joint capsule Which leads to ongoing inflammation due to cytokine by the pannus', 'ankihub_id': '05e8e61a-4f9d-4390-b9c7-362c0be7ee14'}, {'anki_id': 1505174541905.0, 'document': 'What musculoskeletal pathology is significantly more prevalent in patients with rheumatoid arthritis ? Osteopenia / osteoporosis Proinflammatory cytokines, corticosteroid therapy, and lack of physical activity → loss of bone mass', 'ankihub_id': '82922a3d-2097-40ef-962f-c710fefa854a'}, {'anki_id': 1487815322484.0, 'document': 'The characteristics of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) may be remembered with the mnemonic " RASH OR PAIN ": R ash (malar or discoid):: R (skin) A rthritis (usually involving ≥ 2 joints):: A (symptom) S erositis (pleuritis and pericarditis):: S H ematologic disorders (e.g., cytopenias):: H O ral or nasopharyngeal ulcers (usually painless):: O R enal disease:: R P hotosensitivity:: P A ntinuclear antibodies:: A I mmunologic disorder (anti-dsDNA, anti-Sm, antiphospholipid):: I N eurologic disorder (seizures, psychosis):: N (+2 examples) Needs ≥ 4 criteria to diagnose', 'ankihub_id': 'e1812c6e-858e-49e9-8be9-2bf79c1cea66'}, {'anki_id': 1484792779139.0, 'document': 'The onset of postpartum mood disturbances is typically within 4 weeks of delivery - If the onset is within 4 weeks, the DSM-5 specifier "with peripartum onset" is used - In clinical practice, the term "postpartum depression" is used to describe depression that begins in the first 12 months - Major depressive episode is defined as ≥5 SIG E CAPS symptoms', 'ankihub_id': '7a903fbe-c0e0-4cb8-84ef-27034e429189'}, {'anki_id': 1479267463438.0, 'document': 'Mast cells can bind the Fc portion of Ig E', 'ankihub_id': 'f4a7f9e9-843f-4ca2-ad7a-1132446725cd'}, {'anki_id': 1488502514188.0, 'document': 'Atopic dermatitis ( eczematous ) often manifests as lichenification on flexor surfaces in children and adults - e.g., antecubital fossa - Whereas psoriasis typically presents on the extensor surfaces Lichenification depicted (first image): Lichenification on the arm and the neck in skin of color (images below):', 'ankihub_id': '2074eed2-1922-4654-ba8e-99dcc12683b5'}, {'anki_id': 1482374347418.0, 'document': 'Smoking is protective against ulcerative colitis::IBD Nicotine may suppress your immune system, decrease the inflammation of ulcerative colitis , and boost production of the mucus in the colon that acts as a protective barrier', 'ankihub_id': '6a145819-2d71-4071-b880-96d87cf71fab'}, {'anki_id': 1482959688086.0, 'document': 'The microsatellite instability pathway of colorectal cancer is characterized by mutations or methylation of mismatch repair genes e.g., MLH1, MSH2', 'ankihub_id': '333ed639-dc18-4437-9eab-0f3da1254676'}, {'anki_id': 1494990045121.0, 'document': 'Vitamin D inhibits proliferation of keratinocytes which can be found in the epidermis Thus it is used to treat psoriasis', 'ankihub_id': 'd100d0ae-1277-4d1b-8689-64fd361838ad'}, {'anki_id': 1537563758464.0, 'document': "Child tugging at a painful ear for the last day ; low-grade fever , erythema, bulging membrane, loss of light reflex; immobile tympanic membrane on pneumatic insufflation ? Diagnosis? Acute otitis media Treatment? Observation or amoxicillin::2 Amoxicillin or observation are both correct in a child 2+ years old , as long as there aren't severe symptoms : - Persistent pain > 48h - Temperature > 39 °C (> 102.2 °F) - Toxic appearance", 'ankihub_id': '2f1e0203-2d16-48df-89f0-7b7cdb558d24'}, {'anki_id': 1574028816415.0, 'document': 'Sinding-Larsen-Johansson syndrome is an overuse injury caused by inflammation of the apophysis located on the inferior pole of the patella - Very similar to Osgood-Schlatter disease - Repeated stress on tendon during a time of rapid bone growth (e.g. puberty) can result in inflammation on the apophysis', 'ankihub_id': '187e77c3-ba52-4677-be20-490ed4472a98'}, {'anki_id': 1518968305406.0, 'document': 'Anakinra is an IL-1 receptor antagonist used to treat rheumatoid arthritis Patients with rheumatoid arthritis do not produce the endogenous form of anakinra in their synovium → excess IL-1 mediated inflammation / cartilage degradation', 'ankihub_id': 'f482cadd-5c71-4d9a-af6f-1b2c735ef6fb'}, {'anki_id': 1488247954935.0, 'document': 'Does rheumatoid arthritis present with symmetric or asymmetric joint involvement? Symmetric - Systemic autoimmune issue, both joints affected - Contrast with osteoarthritis (asymmetric)', 'ankihub_id': 'd68ef85a-7866-43e6-8ba3-f367c0ad6432'}, {'anki_id': 1555853028662.0, 'document': 'Is weight loss or exercise more important to reduce risk of osteoarthritis ? Weight loss - Reduce burden on the knees - Distinguish the risk factors for osteoarthritis vs. treatment (which includes exercise) - Vigorous exercise can actually INCREASE the risk for osteoarthritis - Risk factors: advanced age (>50 years), obesity , female sex, joint trauma, genetics, anatomic factors, lifestyle factors - Treatments: supportive measures (heat, decreased weight-bearing exercises, use of cane/crutches), NSAIDs, intra-articular corticosteroid injections, hyaluronate injections, joint replacement', 'ankihub_id': '3562d9b9-48af-4332-b2dd-3fd9205f8f11'}, {'anki_id': 1515539842486.0, 'document': 'Systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis is a childhood arthritis most commonly seen in patients between 2 – 4 years old JIA (all subtypes) can occur in patients < 16 yo, however, the systemic subtype has peak incidence between 2 – 4 years old', 'ankihub_id': '40939e46-460b-48ed-b380-dcff05219840'}, {'anki_id': 1682465194935.0, 'document': 'Patients with ankylosing spondylitis are at increased risk for osteoporosis::MSK due to chronic inflammation Chronic inflammation → activation of TNF-α and IL-6 → increased osteoclast activity → osteopenia / osteoporosis → risk of vertebral fracture', 'ankihub_id': '4d02b164-6ab2-4c2b-a658-e975b10b4f8d'}, {'anki_id': 1488247872865.0, 'document': 'Which finger/hand joints are affected in osteoarthritis ?
