Used with permission. X-ray of CMC osteoarthritis', 'ankihub_id': '8ac0fdbe-ff8b-4501-9189-6a5c5ec0244a'}, {'anki_id': 1488248067120.0, 'document': 'Seronegative spondyloarthropathies may present with inflammatory back pain that improves with exercise', 'ankihub_id': 'cee24ecb-e563-418e-bb23-99fb07f8b2b3'}, {'anki_id': 1488502604749.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is associated with increased thickness of the stratum spinosum Panel a: lesional psoriatic skin Panel b: non-lesional psoriatic skin OpenStax College : J. Gordon Betts, Peter Desaix, Eddie Johnson. , CC BY 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': 'c45ff735-6232-4e8d-8478-0c3517c60562'}, {'anki_id': 1520633254293.0, 'document': 'Diffuse esophageal spasm is caused by strong, non-peristaltic::peristaltic/non-peristaltic contractions of the esophageal body - These patients have normal esophageal function; manometry reveals multiple simultaneous contractions on tracings from mid / lower esophagus - AKA distal esophageal spasm', 'ankihub_id': 'cdd9731a-80a5-4ed9-8904-7e7de50f0e31'}, {'anki_id': 1517959410551.0, 'document': 'The DCC gene is a(n) tumor suppressor that is frequently mutated in advanced colorectal cancer - This gene is a dependence receptor , meaning it has two functions when it is bound and when it is not bound (as opposed to a classical receptor which is "on-off") - When DCC is bound by netrin-1, this induces a survival signal; when DCC is not bound by netrin-1, this induces an apoptotic signal', 'ankihub_id': '34a769e4-a3c0-4844-a55b-278ff577cc79'}, {'anki_id': 1488248021183.0, 'document': 'Heberden nodes refers to bony swellings in the distal interphalangeal (DIP) joints - " H igh" (distal) for H eberden (DIP) - " B elow" (proximal) for B ouchard (PIP)', 'ankihub_id': '2cf3cd1a-9f98-4459-b246-e507f6f91771'}, {'anki_id': 1488502588078.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is characterized histologically by acanthosis with parakeratosis i.e. epidermal hyperplasia of the stratum spinosum (acanthosis) and retention of keratinocyte nuclei in the stratum corneum (parakeratosis) Panel a: lesional psoriatic skin Panel b: non-lesional psoriatic skin', 'ankihub_id': '106318bc-edb6-49e6-8cdf-883a26b029d1'}, {'anki_id': 1583459318372.0, 'document': 'Systemic sclerosis may manifest in the hands with contractures in the interphalangeal joints AKA sclerodactyly', 'ankihub_id': 'aad79eb8-e561-4fda-8015-a7e3807e010b'}, {'anki_id': 1505258890764.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with a history of painful arthritis in the fingers and feet that presents to the clinic with the skin findings below? Tophaceous gout Urate crystals deposit as tophi', 'ankihub_id': '09619a9b-33ed-483d-902a-9df1ab37bf08'}, {'anki_id': 1496781825218.0, 'document': 'Eteplirsen is an antisense drug used to treat Duchenne muscular dystrophy by allowing the generation of a partially functional dystrophin protein - DMD is typically caused by a mutation that alters the reading frame of the RNA downstream of the mutation, Eteplirsen works by binding exon 51 and changing the reading frame (if given to a healthy person this produces a nonfunctional protein, but with a person with DMD this can restore the reading frame) - This does not fully restore functionality, but rather turns DMD into a less severe form (basically DMD → Becker muscular dystrophy)', 'ankihub_id': 'e455ac0c-713c-4de6-ac5e-58a8ef80aa6f'}, {'anki_id': 1547242134734.0, 'document': 'What is management of an infant whose mother has HIV with viral load >50 copies/mL? Multi-drug ART Zidovudine should be administered to the neonate for > 6 weeks > 50 = give more - The best way to prevent mother-to-child HIV transmission is combination antiretroviral therapy (ART) throughout pregnancy , regardless of CD4 count or viral load - ART should start as early as possible , even in the first trimester, to suppress maternal HIV and prevent transmission - With an undetectable viral load at delivery, the risk is <1%', 'ankihub_id': 'df0d6922-3faf-47aa-b01c-f8b0f4330f98'}, {'anki_id': 1557235353814.0, 'document': 'Tenderness at the inferior border of the patella seen in athletes is suggestive of patellar tendinitis::diagnosis - Repeated jumping (e.g., volleyball, basketball) → inflammation of the patellar tendon - Presentation is very similar to Osgood-Schlatter disease, but the tenderness is located at the inferior pole of the patella rather than the tibial tubercle', 'ankihub_id': '9d93288b-c4ed-4714-af57-1b28fb0acb53'}, {'anki_id': 1581988163757.0, 'document': 'What treatment of ankylosing spondylitis is most likely to improve mobility ? TNF-α inhibitors - e.g., infliximab, adalimumab - Life expectancy is not affected', 'ankihub_id': '86da17f0-342f-44c2-9dac-6762a358d2c3'}, {'anki_id': 1557144473720.0, 'document': 'Which tibial pathology presents with a point tenderness on palpation? Stress fracture::Shin splints/Stress fracture - "Stress the point " - Important distinguishing feature from shin splints (diffuse tenderness)', 'ankihub_id': '2868d69b-3549-4f1e-b7b5-7e7aef4d2120'}, {'anki_id': 1489968442057.0, 'document': 'Infliximab is a monoclonal antibody against TNF-α', 'ankihub_id': '3ea6b36b-c204-4116-a7f7-08d1b6a0e8ef'}, {'anki_id': 1509140226132.0, 'document': 'Which chemotherapeutic drug can be used in the treatment of ectopic pregnancy ? Methotrexate', 'ankihub_id': 'ead40742-81ab-4cce-afc6-eefc975f4c0c'}, {'anki_id': 1497215831699.0, 'document': 'Periodic fever syndromes can be treated with canakinumab - These are a group of disorders that have unregulated production of IL-1β for one reason or the other (typically due to disruption of the Inflammasome) - e.g., Muckle-Wells (AKA CAPS; sensorineural deafness, chills and hives, amyloidosis - caused by a defect in the inflammasome pattern recognition receptor cryopyrin)', 'ankihub_id': '82333407-4fa7-4a83-b273-050ae30eddfe'}, {'anki_id': 1494969411436.0, 'document': 'Which tibial pathology presents with a diffuse area of tenderness on palpation? Shin splints (medial tibial stress syndrome)::Shin splints/Stress fracture Important distinguishing feature from tibial stress fractures ( point tenderness)', 'ankihub_id': '27199ef5-5822-4acb-86bb-59265479fc41'}, {'anki_id': 1488418093751.0, 'document': 'Inflammation in dermatomyositis is antibody -mediated, predominantly involving CD 4 + T cells - CD4+ = derm4+omyositis - vs. polymyositis which is cell -mediated, predominantly CD 8 + T cells', 'ankihub_id': '74f66d18-1825-43b6-a30a-ac4db573b223'}, {'anki_id': 1496582832759.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for a patient with acute respiratory failure due to an acute COPD exacerbation who fails to improve with non-invasive positive pressure ventilation (NIPPV)? Endotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation - Intubation may be warranted prior to trial of NIPPV if condition is immediately life threatening or if NIPPV is contraindicated (e.g., AMS, agitation, hemodynamic instability) - If patient is not tolerating NIPPV and condition is not immediately life threatening, consider high flow nasal cannula', 'ankihub_id': '90a54803-8823-4906-97c8-85bc960a6c7d'}, {'anki_id': 1515540649782.0, 'document': 'Cyclosporine can be used to treat psoriasis and rheumatoid arthritis', 'ankihub_id': 'f73ef9de-067b-454e-b852-7840cc88f97c'}, {'anki_id': 1543418914741.0, 'document': 'Atopic dermatitis (eczema)::Diagnosis? - Chronic inflammatory skin rash characterized by dry skin patches with papules - Both infantile (resolves with initial years of life) and adult (recurrent) forms exist - Risk factors = asthma, allergic rhinitis, family history - H/P = pruritus; erythematous patches of dry skin with possible vesicles on flexor surfaces, dorsum of hands and feet, chest, back, or face; lesions more commonly on face and scalp in infants (Mnemonic: FACE→ F lexor A dults, C hildren E xtensors) - Treatment = avoidance of precipitating factors, moisturizing creams, topical corticosteroids or tacrolimus; severe cases can be treated with oral corticosteroids and antihistamines', 'ankihub_id': '14ece135-c611-4bbf-b43c-ff5ea06b3d50'}, {'anki_id': 1515539993315.0, 'document': 'Patients with systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) often develop uveitis in their eye - Inflammation of the anterior uvea leads to hypopyon (accumulation of pus in the anterior chamber) - Remember that hypopyon is associated with systemic inflammatory disorders', 'ankihub_id': '6071b060-d98d-4936-be90-341253f1f69b'}, {'anki_id': 1516219155630.0, 'document': 'What is the most common orthopedic disorder in newborns? Developmental dysplasia of the hip (DDH) Results in hip instability/dislocation', 'ankihub_id': '9ad37dc8-316c-4479-abc3-24218c5a1b90'}, {'anki_id': 1588630780125.0, 'document': 'Pathogenesis of dermatomyositis involves upregulation of type 1 interferons ::signaling molecule, which leads to damage of muscle fibers and capillaries Type 1 interferons = IFN-α and IFN-β', 'ankihub_id': '579aea0d-dde2-487d-80b8-ef9240e9c379'}, {'anki_id': 1488502523510.0, 'document': 'Atopic dermatitis ( eczematous ) is associated with increased serum Ig E Elevated IgE due to atopic dermatitis → increased risk of other atopic diseases (e.g., allergic rhinitis, asthma, food allergy ) Lichenification on the arm and the neck in skin of color (images below):', 'ankihub_id': '981abb12-f66e-433a-9a84-1dda862766db'}, {'anki_id': 1482886867250.0, 'document': 'Screening for colorectal polyps/carcinoma is performed by: - Colonoscopy - Testing for fecal occult blood (stool guaiac test) - Polyps are usually clinically silent but can bleed - Fecal occult blood test (FOBT) is tested for with hemoccult card (stool guaiac test) USPSTF-recommended Colorectal Cancer Screening Grade A ALL adults aged 50 to 75 years old Grade B Adults aged 45 to 49 years old - Screen all adults from 45 to 75 years old; selectively screen adults from 76 to 85 years old - Many screening tests are available; many factors are considered when deciding on which test will be used in screening depending on various factors eg. frequencies of screening, location, methods, anesthesia, and bowel preparation Discuss with patient how to screen while considering patient’s health status, previous screening, history, and preference', 'ankihub_id': '2a98b1cd-ccdf-4f7a-9912-79592a003b9b'}, {'anki_id': 1556664563918.0, 'document': 'Tenderness at the tibial tubercle is suggestive of Osgood-Schlatter disease::diagnosis - Due to repeated microfracture at the tendon insertion (i.e., traction apophysitis) - Inflammation where the patellar ligament attaches to the tibial tuberosity', 'ankihub_id': '4a6a02f9-6dd6-4af8-a770-82605e4fed2a'}, {'anki_id': 1517247777382.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a child that presents with two months of daily fever , pink macular rash , and knee / hip pain that is worse in the morning ? Systemic-onset juvenile idiopathic arthritis (systemic JIA) - Systemic type JIA is also known as Still disease ; most common in patients 2 – 4 years old - Symptoms : salmon-pink macular rash, hepatosplenomegaly, sore throat, lymphadenopathy, myalgias, fever, joint swelling and pain, pericarditis, pleuritis, myocarditis - Lab findings : leukocytosis, thrombocytosis, anemia, and elevated ESR Salmon colored macular rash (left); Destructive changes in the hips (right)', 'ankihub_id': '7ba7d532-9077-4302-b3ae-cba40c35885d'}, {'anki_id': 1520278629964.0, 'document': 'What trinucleotide repeat disorder is associated with autism ? Fragile X syndrome Patients have a normal life expectancy', 'ankihub_id': 'a9eb02da-1430-46c5-adbd-3c2a886e53b4'}, {'anki_id': 1482289520748.0, 'document': 'Meckel diverticulum is typically located in the small bowel, two feet proximal to the ileocecal valve Around 60 cm', 'ankihub_id': 'eb6792c1-ed82-469f-bf7b-93513666afca'}, {'anki_id': 1524150690333.0, 'document': "Which three pneumoconioses increase the risk for Caplan syndrome ? - Coal workers' pneumoconiosis - Asbestosis - Silicosis CA plan S yndrome", 'ankihub_id': '39cb5988-75c4-48f6-8daf-e36a8131601a'}, {'anki_id': 1475376574700.0, 'document': 'Goodpasture syndrome occurs due to antibodies against the glomerular and alveolar basement membranes Antibodies are specifically against the alpha 3 chain of type IV collagen', 'ankihub_id': '393d3f5a-a408-4094-9f52-9f756cfaab1e'}, {'anki_id': 1583964087768.0, 'document': 'Rheumatoid arthritis is a type III hypersensitivity reaction - Because rheumatoid factor (IgM) forms large complexes that deposit in tissues - Ar THREE itis = type 3 HSR', 'ankihub_id': '4acccad5-fcb6-4d3b-880f-57ad06be4c8a'}, {'anki_id': 1556362610548.0, 'document': 'Chondromalacia patellae presents similarly to patellofemoral pain syndrome (pain worsened with using stairs , prolonged sitting ) - Defined as inflammation of the patella and softening of the cartilage - Clinical presentation is identical to patellofemoral pain syndrome + effusion on physical exam if severe articular damage - Distinguished with patellofemoral pain syndrome because chondromalacia patellae = cartilage damage , while patellofemoral pain syndrome = NO cartilage damage - Diagnose with MRI', 'ankihub_id': 'a8e38095-8fed-4162-9545-476236170165'}, {'anki_id': 1516552577663.0, 'document': 'An apophysis is a(n) secondary ossification center which serves as an attachment for a tendon - Repeated stress on tendon during a time of rapid bone growth (e.g., puberty) can result in inflammation on the apophysis - Osgood-Schlatter = pull of patellar tendon on tibial tuberosity causing inflammation - Sinding-Larsen-Johansson = pull of patellar tendon on the inferior pole of the patella causing inflammation', 'ankihub_id': 'eaef5f24-6152-46da-9bac-9614193e632b'}, {'anki_id': 1497200675738.0, 'document': 'Azathioprine/6MP are used to treat chronic inflammatory diseases that are refractory to corticosteroids', 'ankihub_id': 'e8e0ea34-4c15-41f5-95dd-7738f0aec38c'}, {'anki_id': 1553592794460.0, 'document': 'Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)::Diagnosis Butterfly vs. Discoid rash Criteria for Systemic Lupus Erythematous Clinical Immunologic • Acute Cutaneous Lupus • Chronic Cutaneous Lupus • Oral or Nasal Ulcers • Non-scarring alopecia • Arthritis • Serositis • Renal • Neurologic • Hemolytic anemia • Leukopenia • Thrombocytopenia (<100,000/mm3) • ANA • Anti-DNA • Anti-Smith • Antiphospholipid Ab • Low complement (C3,C4, CHSO) • Direct Coombs 4 criteria required, with at least 1 clinical and 1 laboratory OR biopsy-proven lupus nephritis with positive ANA or Anti-DNA', 'ankihub_id': '43c395a6-ca2e-4acd-973d-4846129e2d18'}, {'anki_id': 1488502580314.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is due to excessive keratinocyte::cell type proliferation Panel a: lesional psoriatic skin Panel b: non-lesional psoriatic skin', 'ankihub_id': 'ca92d0b3-fecb-4e39-8d8b-b051feba6085'}, {'anki_id': 1488418289795.0, 'document': 'Inflammation in polymyositis is cell -mediated, predominantly involving CD 8 + T cells - Increased expression of MHC1 antigens on sarcolemma is observed - vs. dermatomyositis which is antibody -mediated, predominantly involving CD 4 + T cells - Poly myositis → 8 > 4', 'ankihub_id': 'b8fa9b53-db67-438e-b661-8a82ec2ddb5f'}, {'anki_id': 1487986333426.0, 'document': 'Anti-SRP antibodies are associated with polymyositis and dermatomyositis', 'ankihub_id': '790ad7f1-b20f-4538-9cc4-50efa4ca3fa1'}, {'anki_id': 1517365356878.0, 'document': 'IPEX syndrome is associated with a variety of dermatological findings , but in particular patients present with dermatitis , nail dystrophy , and other autoimmune dermatologic conditions (especially autoimmune alopecia ) James Heilman, MD , CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons; Anthere , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '569fdf60-f831-4133-82d6-3db2e330b29b'}, {'anki_id': 1487815353788.0, 'document': 'Which SLE antibody is a useful predictor of disease activity and renal involvement ? Anti-dsDNA antibodies Persistently elevated anti-dsDNA antibodies are a risk factor for disease flares', 'ankihub_id': '35e64f9d-6e16-4379-a8d2-3cfa952cf0ec'}, {'anki_id': 1577732407925.0, 'document': 'Why is there an increased risk of pyelonephritis during pregnancy ? Widened ureters (caused by progesterone) + increased glucose levels in the urine → ascension of organisms to the kidney Also contributing is the dextrorotation of the uterus as it rises out of the pelvis (12+) weeks. This laterally displaces and compresses the ureters at the pelvic brim leading to elevated intrauereteral tone and ureteral dilatation (Association of Professors of Gynecology and Obstetrics (APGO))', 'ankihub_id': '69f49ae8-ecbb-4079-b337-60665192caac'}, {'anki_id': 1555876256778.0, 'document': 'Clubbing of the fingers and toes with swelling and pain is characteristic of hypertrophic osteoarthropathy::diagnosis, and should be followed-up with chest x-ray::next step Often associated with lung cancer (adenocarcinoma) , therefore CXR is indicated to rule out malignancy or other lung pathology', 'ankihub_id': 'eab962fc-cd66-41f9-8e0b-206e527c7baf'}, {'anki_id': 1485127433105.0, 'document': 'Which anti-epileptic is most associated with drug-induced lupus ? Phenytoin HEα P S PIMP H ydralazine E tanercept α -methyldopa / IFN- α P henytoin S ulfa drugs P rocainamide I soniazid M ethimazole P TU', 'ankihub_id': '9f92b58d-312e-48d4-9a80-20326f250968'}, {'anki_id': 1497205557686.0, 'document': 'Tocilizumab is an anti- IL-6 receptor monoclonal antibody indicated for giant cell arteritis and cytokine release syndrome - Binds the IL-6 receptor and prevents IL-6 from binding - Importantly, this antagonizes IL-6R on the liver, reducing the amount of acute phase reactant proteins produced - Cytokine release syndrome is seen in patients who are treated with tisagenlecleucel and rituximab due to the generation of a " cytokine storm "', 'ankihub_id': 'ac038431-1377-4bd0-a9db-524e96f2ab82'}, {'anki_id': 1462834769845.0, 'document': 'MEN 2B is associated with mucosal neuromas (oral / intestinal ganglioneuromatosis) Small collections of nervous tissue on tongue, lips, and buccal mucosa Mikeybomb44 , CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons , the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously, licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0', 'ankihub_id': '708d94bc-1928-4835-93c9-4e13abac4235'}, {'anki_id': 1488409952800.0, 'document': 'Dermatomyositis is an inflammatory disorder of the skin and skeletal muscle', 'ankihub_id': '89cca87a-4cff-415e-b84c-8ffe196fc8dd'}, {'anki_id': 1587318818148.0, 'document': 'Which autoimmune disease may present with immunofluorescence and liquefactive degeneration/edema at the dermo-epidermal skin junction? Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) - Due to deposition of Ig and complement (C3, C4) - Between layer of dermis and epidermis', 'ankihub_id': 'aae660bd-d45c-4334-9a9d-bffb7381ea20'}, {'anki_id': 1488247943513.0, 'document': 'Rheumatoid arthritis classically presents with joint stiffness that improves with activity', 'ankihub_id': '1bb6cde8-92bb-40bf-9bc2-dc66b3833123'}, {'anki_id': 1488154353136.0, 'document': 'The causes of osteonecrosis may be remembered with the mnemonic CASTS B end LeGS This card recently was updated to include lupus in the mnemonic by adding an ‘S’ to CAST (Dec 2024) C orticosteroids A lcohol use disorder S ickle cell disease T rauma (most common) S LE Bend : "the Bends" (decompression sickness) Le gg-Calvé-Perthes disease G aucher disease S lipped capital femoral epiphysis (SCFE) - Other causes include vasculitis (e.g., lupus vasculitis) - C orticosteroids suppresses osteoblast function and stimulates osteoclast function - S ickle cell disease can clot medial femoral circumflex artery (MCFA) - T rauma to femoral neck (e.g., fracture) can cut off blood supply - B ends - when diving more gas is forced into liquid due to Henry\'s law, on slow ascent inert gas (nitrogen) comes out of solution via "offgassing" in lungs, rapid ascent causes offgassing to occur in blood, resulting in gas emboli that can affect vasculature and tissues - L egg-Calvé-Perthes - young children 5-10, initially painless limp but gradual onset of hip pain (no knee pain) due to ligamentum teres femoris constricting before MCFA has time take over blood supply - S CFE - obese children 11/12, knee and hip pain, increased axial force on femoral head results in epiphysis displacing relative to femoral neck', 'ankihub_id': '3971d1e6-2ac2-4164-9799-915602ea760c'}, {'anki_id': 1516579387663.0, 'document': 'What demographic is most commonly affected by Tinea capitis ? African American children', 'ankihub_id': '2bd591c9-bc09-40d8-97b3-3b83b302e5da'}, {'anki_id': 1488418305850.0, 'document': 'Polymyositis and dermatomyositis may have ANA , anti-Jo-1 , anti-Mi-2 , and/or anti-SRP antibodies Anti-Jo-1 : activity against histidyl-tRNA synthetase Anti-Mi-2 : activity against the Mi2 nuclear helicase protein Anti-SRP : activity against signal recognition particle involved in translocation of proteins to the endoplasmic reticulum', 'ankihub_id': '9be1646f-d647-45ae-839a-d9694a185b16'}, {'anki_id': 1488248086324.0, 'document': 'Reactive arthritis is characterized by a triad of conjunctivitis , urethritis , and arthritis , with patients often also having diarrhea::GI - Formerly known as Reiter syndrome , diarrhea is often seen due to GI tract infection - " Can\'t see, can\'t pee, can\'t climb a tree " - Patients can also develop keratoderma blennorrhagicum', 'ankihub_id': '56a04e22-72fd-4b19-bc07-60d01a58368f'}, {'anki_id': 1516041268478.0, 'document': 'Inflammation of the 1st dorsal compartment in De Quervain tenosynovitis is due to thickening / swelling of the extensor retinaculum, which causes friction with tendon movement The extensor retinaculum (AKA dorsal carpal ligament) is a thickened part of antebrachial fascia that holds the extensor tendons in place; its friction against the tenosynovial sheath results in inflammation', 'ankihub_id': 'd4cab5a4-65ce-4fed-9602-bb4fae6d869c'}, {'anki_id': 1515723786262.0, 'document': 'Greater trochanteric pain syndrome (GTPS) results from inflammation of the gluteus medius or minimus tendon located lateral to the greater trochanter of the femur - Typically due to gluteus medius overuse / tendinitis - Previously known as trochanteric bursitis, renamed as bursa involvement is uncommon - Initial treatment includes local heat, activity modification and NSAIDs; PT often helpful; treat persistent symptoms with corticosteroid injection', 'ankihub_id': 'a87399ba-c3a8-41b9-a5b4-6c5883634e52'}, {'anki_id': 1557335975983.0, 'document': 'Lupus is commonly associated with serositis , which can manifest as pericarditis::heart and pleuritis::lung - Pericarditis → Pericardial effusion (muffled heart sounds, pericardial friction rub, enlarged heart silhoutte) - Pleuritis → pleuritic chest pain, pleuritic rub - Symmetric arthritis - Cytopenias (low platelets, WBCs, anemia) - Renal disease (↑ Cr, proteinuria) - Malar rash - Immune markers', 'ankihub_id': 'c5709966-1ec8-40cc-8c51-4386d36f5ff8'}, {'anki_id': 1555667284721.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young adult female with symmetric, migratory , polyarticular arthritis/arthralgias with brief morning stiffness? The patient also has painless oral ulcers and splenomegaly . Laboratory examination reveals pancytopenia, RBCs, and proteinuria on urinalysis Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) Especially the knee , carpal joints , and joints of fingers ; joint involvement in SLE tends to be symmetric, migratory, non-erosive, and associated with brief morning stiffness (vs. RA); RBCs are reflective of glomerulonephritis', 'ankihub_id': 'c763b4db-67a5-4c28-9867-974ea0325102'}, {'anki_id': 1557328098047.0, 'document': "Pulmonary edema is seen in dilated cardiomyopathy::dilated cardiomyopathy / cardiac tamponade Cardiac tamponade: - Problem of getting blood in to the right heart → Beck's Triad (JVD, hypotension, distant heart sounds, alternans, clear lungs ) - Compare with cardiogenic shock, where we have JVD + crackles + S3 + hypotension", 'ankihub_id': 'c32bf5f7-8eff-43b6-b3f7-575fd762171a'}, {'anki_id': 1544808873376.0, 'document': 'What is the best initial analgesic therapy for osteoarthritis ? NSAIDs (e.g., ibuprofen) - First-line therapy is always non-pharmacologic (weight loss, strength training) - Acetaminophen (reserved for patients unable to tolerate NSAIDs) and glucocorticoid injections (severe cases) are both second line', 'ankihub_id': 'fcc3d309-0147-478b-b510-d0d5d9c97560'}, {'anki_id': 1509671678136.0, 'document': 'What is the likely underlying cause of psychosis in a young female that presents with psychosis and arthralgia ? Laboratory findings include thrombocytopenia and hematuria Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) - Other medical conditions that can cause psychosis include thyroiditis, metabolic or electrolyte disorders, CNS infection, and epilepsy - Mnemonic : RASH OR PAIN', 'ankihub_id': 'fc21852e-06f5-4b40-a303-b4aa07850512'}, {'anki_id': 1585183801578.0, 'document': 'What is the management for acute flares of rheumatoid arthritis ? Glucocorticoids - Glucocorticoids like prednisolone act rapidly to reduce symptoms of severe acute flares of rheumatoid arthritis - A short course of glucocorticoids is more effective than NSAID therapy in reducing joint tenderness and pain', 'ankihub_id': 'addc3dba-3ffb-472f-8d7f-b6b21d86e89a'}, {'anki_id': 1524936831829.0, 'document': 'Reactive arthritis may cause sacroiliitis in about 20% of cases, resulting in axial pain in the lower back / buttocks region', 'ankihub_id': '8b2b0812-17a3-48b3-84a7-4080e38793eb'}, {'anki_id': 1488247887852.0, 'document': 'Osteoarthritis often presents with pain in weight-bearing joints after use (e.g., hip, knees, lower lumbar spine) Image(s) provided by www.radiologyassistant.nl . Used with permission.', 'ankihub_id': 'ad345751-17cd-4c2e-a739-565acfd8e2d8'}, {'anki_id': 1488248002312.0, 'document': 'Which arthritis is characterized by non-inflammatory synovial fluid (WBC < 2000/mm 3 )? Osteoarthritis::Osteoarthritis or Rheumatoid arthritis', 'ankihub_id': '07382fce-407e-4c83-ba97-ada59bc5c068'}, {'anki_id': 1505435907624.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with elbow pain that worsens with resisted wrist extension and wrist passive flexion ? Lateral epicondylitis ("tennis elbow") Due to non-inflammatory angiofibroblastic tendinosis at the common extensor origin (think of a backhand tennis shot = going to the lateral side)', 'ankihub_id': '0d8f0365-ea9c-494c-ae1e-a3bf04e039c0'}, {'anki_id': 1505248320903.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a middle-aged patient with a history of SLE that presents with progressive hip pain for the past six weeks? The pain is worst with abduction and internal rotation Avascular necrosis ( osteonecrosis ) - SLE should tip you off that this is secondary to chronic glucocorticoid use - X-ray is often normal ( MRI is more sensitive )', 'ankihub_id': '1c49681a-8698-45c3-a569-61ace77be5d6'}, {'anki_id': 1692547647303.0, 'document': 'Causes of drug-induced lupus (DILE) may be remembered with the mnemonic HEαPS PIMP H ydralazine E tanercept α -methyldopa / IFN- α P henytoin S ulfa drugs P rocainamide I soniazid M ethimazole P ropylthiouracil (PTU) - Associated with anti-histone antibodies - Underlying etiology is believed to be genetic (presence of a genetic mutation that causes decreased acetyltransferase activity or presence of HLA-DR2, HLA-DR3, HLA-DR4, or an unexpressed C4 complement allele) - Also minocycline', 'ankihub_id': '02725426-4278-4151-a1f8-61067465946c'}, {'anki_id': 1486590962252.0, 'document': 'Hemochromatosis is characterized by decreased TIBC Total iron-binding capacity (TIBC) is a measure of transferrin molecules in the blood, and is saturated due to excess iron bound to transferrin → decreases synthesis of transferrin → decreased TIBC', 'ankihub_id': '3451a7e5-aa27-4e6e-8526-ae9db1cced12'}, {'anki_id': 1488247925489.0, 'document': 'Which joint pathology is caused by a synovitis leading to formation of a pannus (inflamed granulation tissue)? Rheumatoid arthritis - Pannus formation leads to the erosion of cartilage and bone - Pannus: a mass of edematous synovium, inflammatory cells, granulation tissue, and fibroblasts that grows over the articular cartilage and causes erosion. Basically, it is an abnormal layer of fibrovascular tissue or granulation tissue. - Common sites for pannus formation include over the cornea , over a joint surface (as seen in rheumatoid arthritis ), or on a prosthetic heart valve - Pannus (P) proliferates and releases cks (e.g., ILs, TNF) that eventually destroy the articular cartilage, leading to fusion of the joint by scar tissue (called ankylosis). Bone erosions are caused by osteoclasts', 'ankihub_id': '13c1de66-cc71-49ae-b96c-0814ace20f9e'}, {'anki_id': 1488247899844.0, 'document': 'Osteoarthritis is characterized by osteophyte formation , which are reactive bony outgrowths - Classically arises in the PIP and DIP joints of the fingers - Osteoarthritis arises towards the end of your life and the ends ( DIPs ) of your fingers', 'ankihub_id': 'd6825437-efa2-48bc-9a33-a9ea8cfa56a1'}, {'anki_id': 1516576752772.0, 'document': 'What is/are the first-line treatment(s) for mild-moderate atopic dermatitis ( eczema )? Topical emollients ± topical steroids::first-line or calcineurin inhibitors::second-line - Mild atopic dermatitis treatment: topical emollients only - Treatment also includes trigger avoidance to minimize irritation (e.g., using hypoallergenic cleansers) - Calcineurin inhibitors (e.g., pimecrolimus) - Common for resolution by adulthood - For ECS ema, use E mollients, C alcineurin inhibitors, and S teroids', 'ankihub_id': '67497694-147c-4b3e-ba47-5ee4a972b52c'}, {'anki_id': 1487986304432.0, 'document': 'Anti-histidyl-tRNA synthetase (anti-Jo-1) autoantibodies are associated with polymyositis and dermatomyositis', 'ankihub_id': 'dee043da-2bb1-4b5a-920c-3acb0cb34cf3'}, {'anki_id': 1497204171184.0, 'document': 'In the treatment of Crohn disease, natalizumab works by preventing adhesion of autoreactive gut homing Th 17 cells a4 b7 integrin binds to MadCAM-1 found on mucosal endothelial cells', 'ankihub_id': '159539ea-123f-45cf-b4fd-2faf9d0522b3'}, {'anki_id': 1482374210189.0, 'document': 'Which form of inflammatory bowel disease typically spares the rectum ? Crohn disease', 'ankihub_id': '618efb63-2395-4e20-9e84-a365e8edbfc2'}, {'anki_id': 1557141410199.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that develops acute posterior calf pain / swelling while walking? Physical examination shows tenderness / induration at the medial head of the gastrocnemius and a crescent-shaped patch of ecchymosis at the medial malleolus. Ruptured popliteal cyst - Due to extrusion of synovial fluid from the knee joint into the gastrocnemius / semimembranosus bursa, often in those with underlying osteoarthritis - Ddx. with DVT (onset with exercise, location of tenderness, ecchymosis at medial malleolus)', 'ankihub_id': '772ee7da-adc6-4c05-998f-9d5e78f8cf5c'}, {'anki_id': 1678812591398.0, 'document': 'What is the most likely diagnosis in a patient with recurrent , pruritic , vesicular rash that primarily affects the palms , soles , and fingers ? Dyshidrotic eczema - AKA acute palmoplantar eczema, pompholyx - Treat with steroids', 'ankihub_id': '21090476-b119-4f66-ad77-b901899c84fa'}, {'anki_id': 1488248012212.0, 'document': 'Which arthritis is characterized by an inflammatory synovial fluid (WBC > 5000/mm 3 )? Rheumatoid arthritis::Osteoarthritis or Rheumatoid arthritis Abundant neutrophils and high protein in synovial fluid', 'ankihub_id': '7a879082-a4aa-4053-9cc8-09eb7ccc55df'}, {'anki_id': 1553592793152.0, 'document': 'How do complement levels change in an acute lupus flare ? Decrease Since lupus is a complement-mediated disease, forming more complexes depletes complement', 'ankihub_id': 'fdeb614e-5574-4fc0-96e1-e579ff74dc82'}, {'anki_id': 1488502598078.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is associated with Auspitz sign , which is pinpoint bleeding when scale is picked off Due to thinning of the epidermis above elongated dermal papillae Auspitz sign (dashed circles) Panel a: lesional psoriatic skin; panel b: non-lesional psoriatic skin', 'ankihub_id': 'b6f3fde6-4c8c-4b91-864f-cee94abc5a3c'}, {'anki_id': 1482959808869.0, 'document': 'Is the CEA tumor marker useful for screening for colorectal carcinoma ? No - Too non-specific for diagnosis - Can be seen in other adenocarcinomas (e.g., pancreatic, gastric, etc.)', 'ankihub_id': 'f3317525-2e7f-4f7c-8592-15e33e5fe3f7'}, {'anki_id': 1480550410939.0, 'document': 'What is the mode of inheritance of Friedreich ataxia ? Autosomal recessive', 'ankihub_id': 'a9a0a60a-c097-4d4f-a964-bab9537634e6'}, {'anki_id': 1488247941142.0, 'document': 'Risk factors for rheumatoid arthritis include HLA- DR4 , HLA- DR1 , smoking , and silica exposure DR4, DR1 = 4 walls and 1 D oo R in a " rheum "', 'ankihub_id': '00d9fa50-7cd5-43ab-a88d-07cce6cf2b34'}, {'anki_id': 1557251997252.0, 'document': 'Initial management of knee osteoarthritis may include exercises to strengthen the quadriceps muscle - Strengthening the quads protects the articular cartilage from further stress - see how the joint space is increased - Along with weight loss, regular moderate activity, and NSAIDs See page for author , Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '1f0a31cf-24a7-4295-9917-bbe5a7023fd6'}, {'anki_id': 1488154353135.0, 'document': 'The causes of osteonecrosis may be remembered with the mnemonic " CASTS B end LeGS ": C orticosteroids:: C A lcohol use disorder:: A S ickle cell disease:: S T rauma:: T (most common) S LE:: S "The Bend s" (caisson disease / decompression sickness):: Bend Le gg -Calvé-Perthes disease:: Le G aucher disease:: G S lipped capital femoral epiphysis (SCFE):: S - This card recently was updated to include lupus in the mnemonic by adding an \'S\' to CAST (Dec 2024) - Other causes include vasculitis (e.g., lupus vasculitis), bisphosphonates, and denosumab - C orticosteroids suppress osteoblast function and stimulate osteoclast function - S ickle cell disease can cause clots in the medial femoral circumflex artery (MCFA) - T rauma to femoral neck (e.g., fracture) can cut off blood supply - B ends - when diving more gas is forced into liquid due to Henry\'s law, on slow ascent inert gas (nitrogen) comes out of solution via "offgassing" in the lungs; rapid ascent causes offgassing to occur in the blood, resulting in gas emboli that can affect the vasculature and tissues - L egg-Calvé-Perthes - young children 5-10; initially painless limp but with gradual onset of hip pain (no knee pain) due to ligamentum teres femoris constricting before the MCFA has time to take over the blood supply - S CFE - obese children 11-12; knee and hip pain; increased axial force on the femoral head results in the epiphysis displacing relative to the femoral neck', 'ankihub_id': '0439fb47-159f-4fd5-adfe-efff5e29f073'}, {'anki_id': 1482959713090.0, 'document': 'Lynch syndrome is an autosomal dominant condition associated with increased risk for colorectal, endometrial, ovarian, and gastric cancers - To help you memorize it "CEO of gastric cancer" - Prophylactic hysterectomy and bilateral oophorectomy are recommended at age 40 or after childbearing is complete (patients with a uterus should have annual endometrial biopsies beginning at age 30-35) - Minor risk for small bowel, hepatobiliary, & skin cancers', 'ankihub_id': '00809fcb-4ca2-443d-b695-017824fdfd48'}, {'anki_id': 1488502608707.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis is associated with decreased thickness of the stratum granulosum Panel a: lesional psoriatic skin Panel b: non-lesional psoriatic skin', 'ankihub_id': '25fe2797-a281-41e4-b228-d43100aa14ea'}, {'anki_id': 1471806636140.0, 'document': 'Eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA)::Small-vessel vasculitis commonly presents with asymmetric multifocal neuropathy , typically manifesting with wrist and foot drop - This occurs due to the vasculitis affecting the epineural vessels (deficits in radial nerve and common fibular nerve) - Asymmetric multifocal neuropathy = mononeuritis multiplex - May also present with sinusitis and skin nodules / purpura - EGPA was formerly known as Churg-Strauss syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '53b6a603-a1e5-4b53-af55-a9354d301379'}, {'anki_id': 1496351444482.0, 'document': "Medial epicondylitis (golfer's elbow) is an elbow injury that may be due to repetitive flexion ( forehand shots) that causes tendinosis of the pronator teres ::muscle and flexor carpi radialis ::muscle Results in pain near the medial epicondyle and worsened pain with resisted wrist flexion The pronator teres, flexor carpi radialis, and palmaris longus insert at the medial epicondyle, thus MRI may show tendinosis ( chronic medial epicondylitis ) of pronator teres and FCR Flexor carpi radialis is shown below in red:", 'ankihub_id': '356e8807-4922-44a9-b999-77e7023be98a'}, {'anki_id': 1488248025406.0, 'document': 'Bouchard nodes refers to bony swellings in the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joints - " H igh" (distal) for H eberden (DIP) - " B elow" (proximal) for B ouchard (PIP)', 'ankihub_id': '8eb41afb-9005-4ae9-aa1b-048ae823c5aa'}, {'anki_id': 1515868088868.0, 'document': 'Medial tibial stress syndrome is a common cause of shin pain and diffuse tenderness in runners::activity - Also seen in military recruits (who are doing a lot of military drills that involve running / marching) - Worse at beginning of exercise, decreases during running (differentiate from exertional compartment syndrome in which pain increases with running )', 'ankihub_id': 'd42a5f3d-2a86-4f56-be65-59baf557d215'}, {'anki_id': 1495740310438.0, 'document': 'Cyclophosphamide can be used as an immunosuppressant for the treatment of lupus nephritis , as well as for systemic vasculitides - e.g., eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA), microscopic polyangiitis, IgA vasculitis (Henoch-Schönlein purpura), granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA), polyarteritis nodosa - When given for vasculitides, often given with corticosteroids', 'ankihub_id': 'e6ec3e01-9ee7-4006-9cba-37b5d4cb580f'}, {'anki_id': 1497215299862.0, 'document': 'Canakinumab is a biologic that binds and prevents the activity of IL- 1β IL-1β (besides TNF-α) is the most important proinflammatory cytokine , which is released due to stimulation of the inflammasome', 'ankihub_id': '1f082fc3-3205-407f-b17a-7432820e04c9'}, {'anki_id': 1582143574608.0, 'document': 'In knee osteoarthritis , exercises to strengthen the quadriceps muscles can reduce abnormal loading on the joint and protect the articular cartilage from further stress', 'ankihub_id': '5021cf75-2ce1-48df-ba4e-bbd402e39c3e'}, {'anki_id': 1488247967890.0, 'document': 'Rheumatoid arthritis may present with ulnar finger deviation and radial wrist deviation R adial w R ist Image(s) provided by www.radiologyassistant.nl . Used with permission.', 'ankihub_id': 'e25a38ac-045f-4524-b5c4-9c6347e1573e'}, {'anki_id': 1515867987853.0, 'document': 'Medial tibial stress syndrome is also known as shin splints - Vague, diffuse pain along middle-distal tibia', 'ankihub_id': '8def153d-d853-4513-afa6-925df621272c'}, {'anki_id': 1509140538486.0, 'document': 'Methotrexate has a(n) immunosuppressive effect, hence why it is useful in the treatment of IBD, vasculitis, SLE, dermatomyositis, etc. Folate antagonist, hence will cause problems with immune cell production, e.g., bone marrow suppression', 'ankihub_id': '0aaeb22b-aaca-451b-a598-f9bb363af8f0'}, {'anki_id': 1582643605548.0, 'document': 'What is the cause of this nodular and partially pustular rash which is also noted on the hands and soles of the feet ? Secondary syphilis The rash may be described as disseminated, nonpruritic macular or papular', 'ankihub_id': '8efca395-7f0f-4573-92b4-778c41fbd67b'}, {'anki_id': 1509300103363.0, 'document': 'Which antitumor monoclonal antibody can treat rheumatoid arthritis ? Rituximab', 'ankihub_id': 'c79e0e0f-cdc0-43f1-abba-3e578b9dcd74'}, {'anki_id': 1556720642410.0, 'document': 'Fragile X syndrome premutation carriers = increased risk of primary ovarian insufficiency - e.g., secondary amenorrhea , elevated FSH , low estrogen - Premutation means 50–200 CGG repeats - Other premutation risks include ataxia and tremor - Carriers = women', 'ankihub_id': 'e6c3bbcf-602a-487a-bf06-82aecf5eb111'}, {'anki_id': 1496351602377.0, 'document': 'Lateral epicondylitis (AKA tennis elbow) is an elbow injury that may be due to repetitive extension ( backhand shots) that causes microtrauma of the extensor carpi radialis brevis (ECRB) tendon at its origin - Backhand strikes transmit sudden, extreme forces through the lateral epicondyle which, over time, may cause microtrauma of the extensor carpi radialis brevis (ECRB) - This microtrauma leads to excess fibroblasts and neovascularization at its origin on the lateral epicondyle - Results in pain near the lateral epicondyle and worsened pain with resisted wrist extension - HOWEVER, the pain will also be near proximal wrist extensors , and will worsen with resisted middle finger extension www.scientificanimations.com , CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '926bc051-b6f9-4de3-b2c8-d490111be2ac'}, {'anki_id': 1488247996122.0, 'document': 'Anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide (anti-CCP) antibody is specific for rheumatoid arthritis - Citrulline is an amino acid (urea cycle) that is incorporated into proteins post-translationally especially during inflammation - Rheumatoid factor (RF) is typically elevated in RA, but is nonspecific - When the patient is anti-CCP (+) it is associated with a more aggressive disease - Female, HLA-DR4, smoking, and rheumatoid factor are other predisposing factors - Joints contain abundant citrullinated type 2 collagen', 'ankihub_id': '2a8a3dfc-fb77-403f-8ec8-367f9761fc4c'}, {'anki_id': 1556715628409.0, 'document': 'Oligohydramnios is characterized by an amniotic fluid index ≤ 5 cm or a single deepest pocket ≤ 2 cm - Oligohydramnios = indication for delivery in late-term pregnancies (sign of uteroplacental insufficiency) - Increased risk of uteroplacental insufficiency in late term (41 wks–41 wks and 6 days) and post term (≥ 42 wks) pregnancies → consider / recommend induction of labor - Biophysical profile : Started at 41 wks to assess fetal well-being; may show late decelerations and oligohydramnios - Pathophysiology : aging placenta → decreased fetal perfusion → decreased fetal renal perfusion → decreased fetal urinary output → oligohydramnios', 'ankihub_id': 'bbffcbd5-992d-4060-977b-97e47b18cae0'}, {'anki_id': 1488247853332.0, 'document': 'What is the most common type of arthritis ? Osteoarthritis (degenerative joint disease)', 'ankihub_id': '981526ca-bf41-4cba-b35e-225329bf9cf2'}, {'anki_id': 1503183676277.0, 'document': 'Streptococcus agalactiae (GBS) causes neonatal meningitis , sepsis , and pneumonia Most common cause of neonatal meningitis', 'ankihub_id': '5d4bcd5f-51aa-42af-96f7-e1c189959292'}, {'anki_id': 1488154334689.0, 'document': 'What MSK pathology presents with bone pain , systemic signs of infection (e.g., fever, leukocytosis) and positive blood cultures ? Osteomyelitis - Also may have elevated CRP and ESR (non-specific) - MRI is the gold standard imaging modality - Bone biopsy and cultures usually required! Identify the pathogen!', 'ankihub_id': 'e41434bc-1e13-49a9-a708-ef296b40c3d0'}, {'anki_id': 1505252173955.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with arthralgias , fatigue , and painless , palpable purpura on the bilateral legs? Laboratory examination reveals elevated LFTs, evidence of glomerulonephritis (hematuria & proteinuria), and low serum C4. Mixed cryoglobulinemia syndrome - Presents with fatigue, palpable purpura, arthralgias, renal disease, positive rheumatoid factor, elevated transaminases, hypocomplementemia, hepatosplenomegaly, peripheral neuropathy , and non-specific systemic symptoms - Tx: corticosteroids, rituximab, and treatment of the underlying cause', 'ankihub_id': 'f71b96d6-2de2-4bd1-a6fe-b16934d49fa8'}, {'anki_id': 1509302652566.0, 'document': 'HER2 (c-erbB2) is a(n) epidermal growth factor receptor found in certain types of breast and gastric carcinomas Growth factor receptor, thus has intrinsic tyrosine kinase activity Positive HER2 by FISH in gastric adenocarcinoma: © Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': '5ab38cd8-7208-4ac9-a03e-ea97973dc7af'}, {'anki_id': 1549826347063.0, 'document': 'Lupus can cause uteroplacental insufficiency and lead to intrauterine growth restriction - Similar to preeclampsia - L upus = L ittle growth', 'ankihub_id': '75f3d0a8-8120-40cf-bac8-341e65f71476'}, {'anki_id': 1497200375971.0, 'document': 'Azathioprine/6MP are used to wean patients off of glucocorticoids in the treatment of chronic inflammatory diseases', 'ankihub_id': 'e5e799a3-261b-4527-8ea0-9e73d244e629'}, {'anki_id': 1485053788874.0, 'document': 'Adverse effects of vilazodone include anti cholinergic effects and weight gain - Other non-specific side effects include headache, nausea, and diarrhea - Can cause serotonin syndrome if taken with other serotonergic agents', 'ankihub_id': 'e6c21589-6116-4b82-8155-813588ae1be0'}, {'anki_id': 1488247972135.0, 'document': 'One complication of long-standing rheumatoid arthritis is subluxation of the cervical spine - This is a potentially lethal feature of RA - Erosions in C1/C2 can occur', 'ankihub_id': 'ba534e3c-7293-4a92-bd02-48831e7dfeea'}, {'anki_id': 1584555989733.0, 'document': 'Does cyclophosphamide cause peripheral neuropathy ? No', 'ankihub_id': '1a4c27e6-3eac-493f-807d-9d0665e7ac72'}, {'anki_id': 1509225165945.0, 'document': 'Drugs that end in -platin (cisplatin, carboplatin, oxaliplatin) are cytotoxic platinum analogs', 'ankihub_id': '4f4b58b4-95c0-4c50-8d52-9faa0b99d67b'}, {'anki_id': 1487815448509.0, 'document': 'Sjögren syndrome classically presents with dry eyes , known as keratoconjunctivitis sicca - Decreased tear production and subsequent corneal damage - Can progress to corneal ulceration - Treatment for isolated sicca symptoms (dry eyes/mouth) consists of pilocarpine/cevimeline (M 3 agonists) to increase secretions - Steroids and DMARDs are reserved for those with extraglandular manifestations (e.g., rash, arthritis)', 'ankihub_id': '92cf5256-e4cb-4d2b-a3ba-56091bb988f5'}, {'anki_id': 1516552228242.0, 'document': 'Osgood-Schlatter disease is an overuse injury caused by inflammation of the apophysis located on the tibial tuberosity - These patients present with progressive anterior knee pain - Repeated stress on this point results in microtrauma and microavulsion (proximal patellar tendon insertion separating from the tibial tubercle)', 'ankihub_id': 'f359bd94-f6e4-45bd-a894-f3eb2ea7025a'}, {'anki_id': 1579493448811.0, 'document': 'Why is the diagnosis of lupus nephritis important to make in the setting of SLE ? Severity of the disease dictates treatment - Plan can include prednisone, cytostatic drugs (e.g., mycophenolate, cyclophosphamide), and general measures to protect the kidneys (e.g., blood pressure control) may be necessary - In the setting of an SLE flare-up , prednisolone or hydroxychloroquine is all that is needed', 'ankihub_id': '1d0070fc-df7c-4c7f-86cb-f670b4bcd722'}, {'anki_id': 1544362392238.0, 'document': 'Initial workup for kidney stones may include urinalysis, although findings are often non-specific - Urinalysis is NOT diagnostic, and negative UA does NOT rule out stones - Hematuria and crystals are common; can also show WBCs due to inflammation - Can obtain UA to rule out concomitant UTI (would change management)', 'ankihub_id': '9e92e79f-9079-46a8-8d82-9e7d50ead82f'}, {'anki_id': 1506535107169.0, 'document': 'What is the confirmatory test for HIV ? HIV-1/2 antibody differentiation immunoassay - HIV-1 is more commonly the cause of AIDS worldwide while HIV-2 is endemic to West Africa - Do this if the 4 th generation assay returns positive - If the HIV-1/2 antibody differentiation immunoassay test is negative , you have likely just detected p24 , which means seroconversion has yet to happen (really early infection) → check NAAT for viral load confirmation', 'ankihub_id': '3b9ecfef-0d75-4246-b459-6b956dda7a7a'}, {'anki_id': 1578194990177.0, 'document': 'The most common locations of lesions of plaque psoriasis may be remembered with the mnemonic SHREK: Scalp:: S Hands:: H Rear end (Intergluteal cleft):: R Elbows:: E Knees:: K - Presents with large plaques on extensor surfaces of the knees and elbows - Presents with small plaques on the scalp , hands , and trunk', 'ankihub_id': 'ed31230e-bd05-4988-aaf5-a0872a061429'}, {'anki_id': 1489968470470.0, 'document': 'Daclizumab is a monoclonal antibody against CD25 (part of IL-2 receptor) that was previously used to treat relapsing multiple sclerosis This is the IL-2 R alpha chain; withdrawn from the market worldwide after reports of serious inflammatory brain disorders including encephalitis and meningoencephalitis', 'ankihub_id': '1de45014-e091-4db3-8551-ce0b4e90fee6'}, {'anki_id': 1523585012668.0, 'document': 'Patients with DRESS syndrome present with eosinophilia, atypical lymphocytosis, and elevated ALT DRESS syndrome D rug Allopurinol and antiepileptics (e.g., phenytoin, carbamazepine) R eaction (rash) Morbilliform starting on the face/upper trunk → becomes widespread Facial edema is common E osinophilia ↑ eosinophil count S ystemic symptoms Fever/malaise Diffuse lymphadenopathy ~90% of patients have involvement of ≥1 organ system ( e.g., liver [transaminitis], kidney, lung )', 'ankihub_id': '1c75ac3e-11a4-4eb4-b1a1-3f1ef07b04f3'}, {'anki_id': 1471378810567.0, 'document': 'How does increased efferent sympathetic firing (e.g., baroreceptor reflex) affect TPR ? Increased TPR (via increased arteriolar vasoconstriction)', 'ankihub_id': 'e628fcdd-bf60-459b-ba1a-5503fdd41554'}, {'anki_id': 1583978254414.0, 'document': 'The primary cause of pseudogout (CPPD) is most commonly idiopathic', 'ankihub_id': '3e47f45d-2a35-4821-8213-dd4bfa786e7a'}, {'anki_id': 1475364147786.0, 'document': 'The most commonly involved organ in systemic amyloidosis is the kidney Usually causes nephrotic syndrome', 'ankihub_id': 'df5f836e-cb5a-462b-8751-152a12762c9d'}, {'anki_id': 1578101601466.0, 'document': 'What is seen on fetal ultrasound below? Duodenal atresia The prenatal diagnosis of duodenal atresia can be made sonographically by the demonstration of the fluid filled dilated stomach and duodenum, which gives the typical "double bubble" sign on ultrasound', 'ankihub_id': '7b0326be-ce17-4567-bb4c-6542dd4f5df5'}, {'anki_id': 1509140667308.0, 'document': 'Methotrexate is first-line in treating rheumatoid arthritis::joint pathology Short-term relief with glucocorticoids and NSAIDs', 'ankihub_id': '13bf0b16-c8e7-40f3-92e0-99174a9a703a'}, {'anki_id': 1488248091607.0, 'document': 'Reactive arthritis classically arises in young adults after a(n) GI tract or Chlamydia trachomatis ::organism infection GI bugs include : (ShY Ch i CCS ) Sh igella , Y ersinia , Ch lamydia , C ampylobacter , C lostridioides difficile , S almonella', 'ankihub_id': '92c0f7d7-f96f-4581-ad33-2905d652bdbe'}, {'anki_id': 1555544458144.0, 'document': 'Cirrhosis is associated with normal levels of factor VIII - Can help distinguish cirrhosis from disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) which has lowered factor VIII - vWF is the only other thing made outside the liver in endothelial cells', 'ankihub_id': 'b46d5bd2-6e1c-4296-9613-e4016ffacc87'}, {'anki_id': 1488247912152.0, 'document': 'Does osteoarthritis present with symmetric or asymmetric joint involvement? Asymmetric Rheumatoid arthritis presents with symmetric joint involvement', 'ankihub_id': 'a64caabb-2b01-4b2a-81a2-7d4632f696be'}, {'anki_id': 1520180650147.0, 'document': 'Where does osteomyelitis most commonly occur in adults? Vertebral bodies Look for adults with fever and back pain', 'ankihub_id': 'a7e5dbb3-76b9-4a18-a61f-3d085c8236dd'}, {'anki_id': 1572895446529.0, 'document': 'IgA nephropathy (Berger disease) may be treated with glucocorticoids - If proteinuria: give ACE inhibitors/ARBs - If severe or rapidly progressive: give glucocorticoids +/- cyclophosphamide or azathioprine', 'ankihub_id': 'c1e8d421-d1ad-4c4c-9423-6003118c9d20'}, {'anki_id': 1557667997637.0, 'document': 'Pain less swelling of the elbows in a patient that regularly leans on them is suggestive of olecranon bursitis::diagnosis Conservative treatment, but may become septic', 'ankihub_id': '32e6d4f1-a2f0-4e97-a6d8-8d8c43eecf67'}, {'anki_id': 1487815405384.0, 'document': 'Antiphospholipid syndrome is characterized by a(n) hypercoagulable state Increased risk for thrombosis and recurrent pregnancy loss', 'ankihub_id': 'd07a8319-0fd2-499a-b490-1bd719f65a8b'}, {'anki_id': 1585184808594.0, 'document': 'What is the surgical management for a patient with Crohn disease and small bowel obstruction due to ileal strictures ? Stricturoplasty - Any surgical procedures to treat small bowel obstruction should be kept as restrictive as possible - Therefore, best option is a bowel-sparing technique like strictureplasty', 'ankihub_id': '2b6089a0-229b-4fd4-b11e-599471dc1705'}, {'anki_id': 1516041527280.0, 'document': 'Central to the pathogenesis of de Quervain tenosynovitis is repetitive wrist motion - This results in thickening of the extensor retinaculum , causing friction on the tendons of the abductor pollicis longus and the extensor pollicis brevis (muscles that extend and abduct the thumb) resulting in inflammation - Conservative management (NSAID, thumb spica splinting)', 'ankihub_id': 'e189053e-c379-4d1f-b731-0b4e8f14a9cd'}, {'anki_id': 1487815553270.0, 'document': 'Mixed connective tissue disease (MCTD) has features of: - Polymyositis - Rheumatoid arthritis - Scleroderma - Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) - Characterized by speckled ANA and anti-U1 RNP antibodies - Mnemonic: PR e SS ( P olymyositis, R heumatoid arthritis, e, S cleroderma, S LE)', 'ankihub_id': '1d2c1e08-61f4-48da-b948-36bd3621573d'}, {'anki_id': 1481857907047.0, 'document': 'Huntington disease is caused by expanded trinucleotide repeats of CAG in the huntingtin gene on chromosome 4 HUNT = 4 letters', 'ankihub_id': '8a49b206-c27d-4a40-9042-84b95497d8c5'}, {'anki_id': 1587495903318.0, 'document': 'In patients with SLE , leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, and/or pancytopenia may manifest through immune-mediated peripheral destruction', 'ankihub_id': '825027a1-1642-4391-ba73-760313ec6982'}, {'anki_id': 1517328960209.0, 'document': 'Seborrheic dermatitis is a common, chronic inflammatory disease that presents with a flaky , scaling , rash involving the scalp and eyebrows - These are erythematous, well-demarcated plaques with greasy yellow scales - Patients often complain of affected areas burning and itching', 'ankihub_id': '980fb1ed-2ba2-49ca-a0d3-5c791cf7ece6'}, {'anki_id': 1578251295674.0, 'document': 'Dermatitis herpetiformis : Causes: IgA Abs on transglutaminase ( cross-reactivity between anti-gliadin IgA antibodies and transglutaminase at the dermal basement membrane) Sx: Pruritic vesicular eruption on extensor surfaces of the body Dx and Bx: Anti-endomysial Abs or anti-transglutaminase Abs; neutrophil abscess Tx: Dapsone, remove gluten from the diet::2', 'ankihub_id': '326cc22c-81bd-43e8-855f-a59daf6938dc'}, {'anki_id': 1509289779035.0, 'document': 'Which of the cytotoxic microtubule inhibitors bind microtubules and inhibit their depolymerization ? Taxanes (e.g., paclitaxel)', 'ankihub_id': '4f57dd4b-dc66-44e9-a8bd-77203b7cbc96'}, {'anki_id': 1520444212406.0, 'document': 'What acute phase reactant is upregulated during inflammation to bind and sequester iron to inhibit microbial iron scavenging ? Ferritin - Ferritin is an iron storage facility in serum - Transferrin is an iron transporter family - Lactoferrin is a member of the transferrin family', 'ankihub_id': 'c4c8d3c8-8565-4b15-a096-0eee6836e8ff'}, {'anki_id': 1488418416727.0, 'document': 'Pharmacologic treatment for fibromyalgia may include anti convulsants or anti depressants e.g., gabapentin, TCAs, duloxetine', 'ankihub_id': 'c64154ab-d17e-41f5-a2ac-45dc7ea6208f'}, {'anki_id': 1474253793186.0, 'document': 'Von Gierke disease is associated with increased blood lactate , triglycerides ::lipid, and uric acid - Excess pyruvate is shunted into triglyceride synthesis - Cori (Lactate) Cycle fails because the liver cannot form glucose from 2 pyruvates , resulting in lactate building up in the blood - Lactic acid is an organic anion , and is a counter ion for uric acid at the URAT1 antiporter on the apical surface of the collecting duct ; thus the more lactate secreted into the urine, more uric acid reabsorbed into the blood', 'ankihub_id': 'd348a0ad-a6a6-4d42-bafe-7083db28e843'}, {'anki_id': 1688138926219.0, 'document': 'In suspected gout , the next step in management is arthrocentesis - Synovial fluid analysis will show needle-shaped monosodium urate crystals that are negatively birefringent under polarized light - Serum uric acid level may be normal (or even low) during acute flares and is not reliable for diagnosing gout', 'ankihub_id': '7de95993-f33e-4d60-a00c-9003e85dc9b7'}, {'anki_id': 1487815477590.0, 'document': 'The anti-SSA and anti-SSB antibodies in Sjögren syndrome are against ribonucleoproteins - Associated with extraglandular manifestations (e.g., neuropathy) - In the presence of ocular symptoms consistent with keratoconjunctivitis sicca and oral symptoms consistent with xerostomia, these antibodies can help confirm the diagnosis', 'ankihub_id': '2f903f7c-d9f6-4b2d-b5e8-97cf3b7d9065'}, {'anki_id': 1471806184543.0, 'document': 'What is the treatment for a patient with Takayasu arteritis ? Glucocorticoids PLUS a glucocorticoid-sparing agent (e.g., methotrexate, azathioprine, cyclophosphamide, TNF inhibitor)', 'ankihub_id': 'f22244c5-eef8-44a6-8075-0c2e7c50499b'}, {'anki_id': 1503254160003.0, 'document': 'Inhibition of TNF-α (e.g., immunosuppression, drugs) results in lack of granuloma formation and resultant reactivation of tuberculosis - Individuals who are to be started on a TNF-α inhibitor (e.g., infliximab ) should receive a PPD test - Lack of TNF-α = lack of granuloma = lack of containment of tuberculosis', 'ankihub_id': '3941277a-e8ca-40e9-a613-a468dd806511'}, {'anki_id': 1572902058325.0, 'document': 'Treatment of diffuse proliferative glomerulonephritis (DPGN)::which nephritic/nephrotic syndrome with glucocorticoids and cyclophosphamide may slow progression to CKD', 'ankihub_id': 'ee7cb6a3-d3fc-47a0-b0b8-fe44660993ea'}, {'anki_id': 1495489447045.0, 'document': 'What is the colonoscopy screening recommendation for patients with familial adenomatous polyposis and known polyps ? Begin at 10-15 years old and repeat q 1y - Proctocolectomy is delayed until early adulthood for children or at the time of diagnosis for adults - Severe disease (e.g., high grade dysplasia, high numbers of polyps) necessitates earlier surgery - FAP almost always involves the rectum, so flexible sigmoidoscopy may be considered in place of colonoscopy if there are no known polyps - EGD is indicated every 6m-4y starting at 25–30 years old', 'ankihub_id': '6a65a115-5a11-469d-be5f-3963ecb84d50'}, {'anki_id': 1532690742866.0, 'document': 'What is the treatment for primary hyperaldosteronism due to a unilateral adrenal adenoma ? Surgical resection (adrenalectomy)', 'ankihub_id': '80977417-6cc8-4566-9ef3-107979d86d35'}, {'anki_id': 1487642773652.0, 'document': 'Myeloperoxidase deficiency is associated with increased risk for Candida infection, however, most patients are asymptomatic - HClO is important for killing off Candida , but H 2 O 2 and other free radicals are sufficient for killing off catalase +ve species - In contrast to chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis, where there is a defect either with Th 17 response or AIRE', 'ankihub_id': '0b5eb772-2432-4057-9b8b-57b436f8b628'}, {'anki_id': 1578194990178.0, 'document': 'The most common locations of lesions of plaque psoriasis may be remembered with the mnemonic SHREK S calp H ands R ear end (Intergluteal cleft) E lbows K nees - Presents with large plaques on extensor surfaces of the knees and elbows - Presents with small plaques on the scalp , hands , and trunk', 'ankihub_id': 'd3b69aa5-a939-41c6-8913-6e87d2d1de3c'}, {'anki_id': 1473638629779.0, 'document': 'What skin pathologies are associated with sarcoidosis ? Cutaneous nodules , erythema nodosum , lupus pernio - Inflammation, elevation, and purple discoloration of scars and tattoos can also occur (" scar sarcoidosis ") - Lupus pernio = skin lesions on face resembling lupus - Erythema nodosum pictured below', 'ankihub_id': 'f27e34a5-b52e-4584-89ab-5d81ec1bf2bc'}, {'anki_id': 1555446288735.0, 'document': 'Elevated ACE and hypercalcemia is most likely sarcoidosis::condition Granulomas make 1α-hydroxylase (activate vitamin D) © Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': '38fadf44-ef52-4cdf-9087-b4fbb91928a1'}, {'anki_id': 1467819843271.0, 'document': "The triphosphate bond of DNA is the target of 3' hydroxyl attack (strand elongation)", 'ankihub_id': 'c832cb68-38b0-4dcc-85cf-5e1b8a920f59'}, {'anki_id': 1692547647302.0, 'document': 'Causes of drug-induced lupus (DILE) may be remembered with the mnemonic " HEαPS PIMP ": H ydralazine:: H E tanercept:: E α -methyldopa / IFN- α :: α (2) P henytoin:: P S ulfa drugs:: S P rocainamide:: P I soniazid:: I M ethimazole:: M P ropylthiouracil (PTU):: P - Associated with anti-histone antibodies - Underlying etiology is believed to be genetic (presence of a genetic mutation that causes decreased acetyltransferase activity or presence of HLA-DR2, HLA-DR3, HLA-DR4, or an unexpressed C4 complement allele) - Also minocycline', 'ankihub_id': '93366489-e924-47f0-8a57-bc1442a25552'}, {'anki_id': 1574299577773.0, 'document': 'Patellofemoral pain syndrome (PFPS) can be an overuse injury presenting as progressive knee pain that worsens with activities involving knee flexion - e.g., running, squatting, jumping, ascending/descending stairs, prolonged sitting - Pain is localized to the patella and associated with sensation of instability or "buckling" at the knee during weight-bearing - Can present with crepitation during knee flexion', 'ankihub_id': '59611e08-9621-4988-a454-22e2ae01424e'}, {'anki_id': 1489968431221.0, 'document': 'Certolizumab is a monoclonal antibody against TNF-α', 'ankihub_id': '1d8e235f-87a6-4f34-be99-140b580238dc'}, {'anki_id': 1471806132559.0, 'document': 'What is the treatment for a patient with giant cell arteritis (GCA)? High-dose glucocorticoids ± tocilizumab* *Give patients with newly diagnosed giant cell arteritis with an increased risk of glucocorticoid-related adverse effects tocilizumab or methotrexate as part of a glucocorticoid-sparing therapy - I nitiate treatment with high-dose glucocorticoid therapy immediately (before the biopsy results return) - Production of IL-6 is highly associated with severity of the disease, thus tocilizumab can be used to treat GCA (temporal arteritis) - Patients with an increased risk of glucocorticoid-related side effects: osteoporosis, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, or glaucoma', 'ankihub_id': '10909074-6367-4e13-8324-2ee40f2cd152'}, {'anki_id': 1557584908094.0, 'document': 'Pathergy test can be used to diagnose Behçet syndrome - Pathergy is an exaggerated ulcerated skin response to minor trauma (e.g., needle stick injury) - Pathergy may also be associated with development of pyoderma gangrenosum', 'ankihub_id': '4d018266-85af-40e6-a5f1-825759e296ad'}, {'anki_id': 1489354089411.0, 'document': 'Ceftriaxone is the drug of choice for what STI ? Gonorrhea AMBOSS: First-line treatment is single dose IM ceftriaxone', 'ankihub_id': 'df59aa24-7227-4b1a-bbc7-306845bd9edb'}, {'anki_id': 1503258860482.0, 'document': "An immunologic toxicity of isoniazid use is drug-induced lupus - The highest risk drug triggers for drug-induced lupus include procainamide and hydralazine Other triggers can be remembered using 'HEαPS PIMP' H ydralazine E tanercept α -methyldopa / IFN- α P henytoin S ulfa drugs P rocainamide I soniazid M ethimazole P TU", 'ankihub_id': 'ad8fed7c-13e2-4435-baa3-68941ba02621'}, {'anki_id': 1488158604836.0, 'document': 'The overlying cartilage in osteochondroma rarely transforms to chondrosarcoma', 'ankihub_id': 'cce88e79-943f-4ab3-a18a-6f7ff381f6e2'}, {'anki_id': 1488248305819.0, 'document': 'What joint is most commonly affected by pseudogout ? Slight pressure over the area causes expression of purulent material Dacryocystitis (infection of the lacrimal sac) - Due to nasolacrimal duct obstruction - Typically caused by Staphylococcus aureus and Streptococcus pyogenes; Dack / Sack / Pack imagine a Sack Packed with pus hanging off the medial part of eye - Treated with o ral amoxicillin-clavulanate the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously (© AnkiHub, LLC)', 'ankihub_id': '304fad25-1a97-453a-80b7-d0a2432d3fec'}, {'anki_id': 1512592675417.0, 'document': "What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with pain less , proximal muscle weakness of the lower extremities? The patient has a history of giant cell arteritis that is medically managed. ESR and CK levels are normal Corticosteroid-induced myopathy - The muscle is being catabolized, but there's no inflammation - In contrast, polymyalgia rheumatica responds rapidly to glucocorticoids and is associated with ↑ ESR , muscle pain , and no weakness", 'ankihub_id': '1533f26b-69db-4624-95da-3526449d645d'}, {'anki_id': 1487815326299.0, 'document': 'SLE is associated with malar ("butterfly") and discoid rashes , especially upon exposure to sunlight Malar rash (1 st image); Discoid rash = scaling that can scar (2 nd image): Mohammad2018 , CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': 'a4a49645-35e0-4f23-8a40-cd4b628a8756'}, {'anki_id': 1510189355490.0, 'document': 'Which bacteria produces Shiga-like toxin (verotoxin)? Enterohemorrhagic E. coli (EHEC) - Thus, inactivates the 60S ribosomal subunit, inhibiting protein synthesis - Can cause hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS) presenting with anemia, thrombocytopenia, and acute renal failure', 'ankihub_id': '47217789-f510-4e43-8b25-ed4ada4d7f49'}, {'anki_id': 1574029992016.0, 'document': 'Achilles tendon ruptures usually occur in the hypovascular watershed area 2 – 6 cm above the calcaneal insertion - Presents with palpable gap, increased resting ankle dorsiflexion, weak plantar flexion, and positive Thompson test - This card used to say 4–6, however, UWorld confirms it is 2–6; use location to differentiate from posterior heel pain caused by calcaneal apophysitis (which occurs within 2 cm of the insertion site)', 'ankihub_id': '6e1002fa-cfd5-4112-a608-d1fedfd22394'}, {'anki_id': 1568226253095.0, 'document': 'Pavlik harness and rigid bracing (of the hip in abduction) are appropriate treatments for children < 6 month(s) old with developmental dysplasia of the hip (DDH) - Treatment is done by an orthopedic surgeon - If left untreated, dysplasia of the hip results in severe gait abnormalities (e.g., Trendelenburg gait), and/or increasing adduction contraction of the hip, with a compensatory genu valgum deformity', 'ankihub_id': 'ef814a3a-3b43-4872-b468-9b4cb674a030'}, {'anki_id': 1695822410474.0, 'document': 'What type of study analysis uses data only from patients who completed the entire study ? Per-protocol analysis - Exclusion of dropouts creates "perfect scenario" → misrepresentation of intervention effect - Compare with intention-to-treat analysis, which includes dropout data', 'ankihub_id': 'ba03c36d-6148-4f49-b355-b1775666105c'}, {'anki_id': 1541861320212.0, 'document': 'Huntington disease is a neurological disorder characterized by a classic triad of choreiform movement, dementia/depression, and behavioral changes - The movement disorder can progress to full-on rigidity in severe cases - Behavioral changes vary, but typically involve irritability, moodiness and antisocial behavior - Patients often have a strong family history (autosomal dominant inheritance)', 'ankihub_id': '7818e22a-c558-4f97-b982-30b39e1f2b0e'}, {'anki_id': 1482276069472.0, 'document': 'Which type of duodenal ulcer is more commonly associated with perforation ?
