PCR Better than an IgM cold agglutinin test', 'ankihub_id': '4922d495-57d8-4ba0-badf-ad904ae98c3b'}, {'anki_id': 1481836415198.0, 'document': 'Long-term treatment of multiple sclerosis with disease-modifying therapies stops relapses and halts/slows progression of disease (options include interferon β , glatiramer , and natalizumab ) - IFN-β decreases blood brain barrier permeability - Glatiramer is a MBP analog that shifts Th 1 phenotype to Th 2 phenotype - Natalizumab is an α4-integrin inhibitor that prevents T cells from extravasating', 'ankihub_id': 'ec464cb4-2dee-4e34-a01e-221fb02b7b2a'}, {'anki_id': 1543232175136.0, 'document': 'Crohn disease::IBD = malabsorption and nutritional depletion - Terminal ileum → ↓ B 12 - Duodenum → ↓ Fe 2+ and Ca 2+', 'ankihub_id': '69f031b7-f174-40f9-91f8-28c10d0df928'}, {'anki_id': 1496865067791.0, 'document': 'Serum sickness can be treated with pulsed corticosteroid therapy', 'ankihub_id': '75486123-4f45-4c6d-9a82-a2d9878c78a2'}, {'anki_id': 1481335677363.0, 'document': 'The nodular sclerosis subtype of Hodgkin lymphoma classically presents as an enlarging cervical or mediastinal lymph node in a female - Can compress adjacent structures and cause a nonproductive cough, shortness of breath, and/or retrosternal pain - Most subtypes of Hodgkin lymphoma have a male predominance, with the exception of nodular sclerosis (which has equivalent incidence in both sexes)', 'ankihub_id': 'f3d05e3d-2f8c-4f96-aa06-a70459165ce2'}, {'anki_id': 1483492137748.0, 'document': 'Adverse effects of chronic aspirin use include: - Acute kidney injury - Acute interstitial nephritis - GI bleeding FA 2019 also adds allergic reactions especially in patients with asthma or nasal polyps', 'ankihub_id': 'e2291fea-9f3d-41ef-967f-14f092b93123'}, {'anki_id': 1516467972711.0, 'document': 'Subluxation of the radial head allows the annular ligament to slip over and into the radiocapitellar joint Thus this will cause a patient to feel lateral elbow pain Physeo and used with permission. Purchase full access', 'ankihub_id': '839c4fe1-bf35-4639-8600-71d3692640fe'}, {'anki_id': 1517249029650.0, 'document': 'What is the recommended treatment for transient synovitis ? Rest and NSAIDs - AKA toxic synovitis - History of recent URI or viral infection - Most common cause of hip pain in childhood especially in those < 5 years old , but can present in late adolescence - Pain worse in the morning and improves throughout the day and may be associated with absent/mild fever - Diagnosis: must exclude septic arthritis - Treatment: observation, self limited condition', 'ankihub_id': '3e523822-da0d-4f51-a965-f020d28a3792'}, {'anki_id': 1556314431638.0, 'document': 'Immunodeficiency increases::increases / decreases risk of Hodgkin lymphoma e.g., post-transplant immunosuppressants', 'ankihub_id': 'eafe76b6-2caa-443c-ace8-9042c934755a'}, {'anki_id': 1522551335510.0, 'document': 'Pes anserine bursitis is commonly seen in runners and typically presents with anteromedial knee pain - Imaging will show fluid accumulation around the pes anserine bursa - More often seen with overuse (imagine a Pez candy thing along the medial knee) - No pain with valgus stress test indicates no MCL involvement', 'ankihub_id': '178ffaa3-0c11-4ddd-81e4-ea2a6a8e2c7f'}, {'anki_id': 1525914049503.0, 'document': 'Proximal tibial nerve lesions present with: - Foot dorsiflexed and everted at rest - Loss of foot inversion and plantarflexion::2 - Weakness of the extrinsic muscles of the foot - The proximal tibial nerve gives off branches that innervate the tibialis posterior (involved in foot inversion), as well as the gastrocnemius / soleus / plantaris muscles (involved in foot plantar flexion) - Thus patients present with the foot held in the calcaneovalgus position (dorsiflexed / everted) - Extrinsic foot muscles (e.g., flexor digitorum longus, flexor hallucis longus) are also innervated by this part of the nerve (resulting in loss of toe flexion ) - Proximal tibial nerve lesions (e.g., at the popliteal fossa ) include knee surgery, baker cyst, and deep penetrating trauma', 'ankihub_id': '51a18f5e-448d-4544-a4e2-a7c127a57e10'}, {'anki_id': 1578888359536.0, 'document': 'Patellofemoral pain syndrome (PFPS) is an overuse injury of young, female athletes with anterior knee pain Exacerbated by prolonged sitting/running and weight-bearing on a flexed knee (e.g., ascending or descending stairs)', 'ankihub_id': 'c2f433f8-cb1e-400a-899b-dc41d56c60ed'}, {'anki_id': 1523880802980.0, 'document': 'Tendonitis of which muscle presents as tenderness at the bicipital groove ? Biceps brachii - This groove separates the lesser and greater tubercles of the humerus - Treatment includes rest from intense physical activity i.e., sports', 'ankihub_id': 'e081c585-64b0-4b39-b9a7-14bb7b6ae0f6'}, {'anki_id': 1487986331592.0, 'document': 'Anti-helicase (anti-Mi-2) autoantibodies are associated with polymyositis and dermatomyositis', 'ankihub_id': '98158082-1fbb-4eae-b73f-49341cd9829b'}, {'anki_id': 1463883738825.0, 'document': 'Once bound (activated), the glucocorticoid receptor enters the nucleus and binds to glucocorticoid response elements to regulate gene transcription When unbound, the glucocorticoid receptor is in the cytoplasm', 'ankihub_id': '43e7c384-12dd-4f6b-ac63-20c21dc8e08e'}, {'anki_id': 1553592793946.0, 'document': 'Systemic lupus erythematosus is an autoimmune disease caused by complement-forming complexes; it more often affects women::gender and people of color::ethnicity Criteria for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Clinical Immunologic • Acute Cutaneous Lupus • Chronic Cutaneous Lupus • Oral or Nasal Ulcers • Non-scarring alopecia • Arthritis • Serositis • Renal • Neurologic • Hemolytic anemia • Leukopenia • Thrombocytopenia (<100,000/mm3) • ANA • Anti-DNA • Anti-Smith • Antiphospholipid Ab • Low complement (C3,C4, CHSO) • Direct Coombs 4 criteria required, with at least 1 clinical and 1 laboratory OR biopsy-proven lupus nephritis with positive ANA or Anti-DNA', 'ankihub_id': '72fa8d03-51c7-4837-8fcf-11fcf7b1032e'}, {'anki_id': 1517249049783.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a child that presents with three months of symmetric arthritis involving ≥ 5 joints that is worse in the morning ? Polyarticular juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) Sero+/- Polyarticular JIA are the only subtypes of JIA that present with symmetric arthritis Sero negative polyarticular JIA : - Symmetric OR asymmetric joint involvement - Also may affect the c-spine and/or TMJ - Patients may present with anterior uveitis - Negative RF - Ages 1-4 yo and 6-12 yo (bimodal) OR Sero positive polyarticular JIA : - Symmetric joint involvement - Rheumatoid nodules (30%) - Positive RF - Ages 9-12 yo Lab findings reflect systemic inflammation: leukocytosis, thrombocytosis, anemia, and elevated ESR', 'ankihub_id': '81449d7b-0f1c-428f-bb1f-d1bcec786346'}, {'anki_id': 1504364393376.0, 'document': 'Which gout drugs can result in Stevens-Johnson syndrome ? Allopurinol and probenecid::2', 'ankihub_id': 'f9328da2-79b5-467d-8924-1f25c62d7612'}, {'anki_id': 1532194776193.0, 'document': 'What is the recommended pharmacological therapy to reduce overall cardiovascular mortality in patients with peripheral arterial disease ? Antiplatelet agent (e.g., aspirin) and statin::2 - Prevent platelet aggregation (TXA 2 ) and therefore thrombus formation - Recommended to prevent stroke and heart attack due to strong association between PAD and atherosclerosis - DOES NOT directly improve walking distance', 'ankihub_id': '3d45528c-fa9b-4939-b850-a40aaaae5324'}, {'anki_id': 1557256261454.0, 'document': 'Patellofemoral pain syndrome (PFPS) is treated with stretching / strengthening the quadriceps / hip abductors, activity modification ± NSAIDs - Similar to the treatment of knee osteoarthritis (decrease stress at the knee) - PFPS is a clinical diagnosis that presents with pain around / behind the patella that increases with weight bearing activities - Surgery has no role, and usually disease is self-limited', 'ankihub_id': '0b03aed1-cadb-4afa-a75c-6ca80e7718b8'}, {'anki_id': 1488248017865.0, 'document': 'Which arthritis improves with use ? Rheumatoid arthritis::Osteoarthritis or Rheumatoid arthritis', 'ankihub_id': '92d73de7-8a23-460e-8107-3b318414ad4a'}, {'anki_id': 1509211177761.0, 'document': 'Azathioprine/6-MP have a(n) immunosuppressive effect, hence why they are useful in the treatment of graft rejection, SLE, autoimmune hemolytic anemia, etc. - Reduces proliferation of all rapidly dividing cells (including both T and B lymphocytes) - Reduced number of B lymphocytes leads to low Ig levels - Reduced number of T lymphocytes leads to low IL-2 activity', 'ankihub_id': '302f1bb6-5e32-4079-ac71-48e5fd8f897f'}, {'anki_id': 1557096148254.0, 'document': 'What is shown here? Osteoarthritis::Diagnosis Chronic joint pain worse with activity and weight bearing Jmarchn , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons; the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously, licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0', 'ankihub_id': '8a0f33da-790e-4389-b6b4-16dd54dceaff'}, {'anki_id': 1497107684861.0, 'document': 'Mesalamine ( 5-ASA ) works by inhibiting the synthesis of proinflammatory eicosanoids and cytokines', 'ankihub_id': 'f7c47350-a740-48b0-8a87-70680d61098f'}, {'anki_id': 1482374212224.0, 'document': 'Which form of IBD always causes bloody diarrhea ? Ulcerative colitis', 'ankihub_id': '68932362-30d6-4ba2-b707-7376e59581f6'}, {'anki_id': 1581620017835.0, 'document': 'Takayasu arteritis is a type of vasculitis that may be associated with erythema nodosum In some patients, a necrotizing inflammation of medium-sized subcutaneous vessels occurs, which results in erythema nodosum', 'ankihub_id': '942f7deb-e154-472e-9b75-3c2a18b8d9da'}, {'anki_id': 1505255299022.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young adult male that presents with asymmetric oligoarthritis and urethral discharge ? The patient also complains of pain over the Achilles tendon and mouth ulcers Reactive arthritis - Classically presents with a triad of conjunctivitis, urethritis, and arthritis ("can\'t see, can\'t pee, can\'t climb a tree") - Factors such as low back pain, mucocutaneous lesions , enthesitis, and afebrile distinguish from gonorrhea', 'ankihub_id': '07eb8415-afff-4933-8e90-cd6d9236e925'}, {'anki_id': 1497307732349.0, 'document': 'Leflunomide inhibits T-cell proliferation , which makes it especially useful for rheumatoid arthritis and psoriatic arthritis - Th 1 cells are central to the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis - Th 17 cells are central to the pathogenesis of psoriatic arthritis', 'ankihub_id': '95d3c1db-79d2-45c0-8ecd-109e1b97370c'}, {'anki_id': 1487815454163.0, 'document': 'Sjögren syndrome classically presents with dry mouth , known as xerostomia - Treatment for isolated sicca symptoms (dry eyes / mouth) consists of pilocarpine / cevimeline (M 3 agonists) to increase secretions - Steroids and DMARDs are reserved for those with extraglandular manifestations (e.g., rash, arthritis)', 'ankihub_id': '952eae7c-60a9-4b54-9cf8-45366773af6f'}, {'anki_id': 1543365179286.0, 'document': 'What is the most likely diagnosis in a 46-year-old female with > 1 hour morning stiffness/pain , systemic symptoms , and improvement of symptoms with use? Rheumatoid arthritis - Autoimmune = systemic symptoms - Inflammatory junk that builds up and improves with movement', 'ankihub_id': '74ee4d47-018a-4c8d-ac60-a71b7fd809de'}, {'anki_id': 1509140691802.0, 'document': 'Which chemotherapeutic drug is first-line in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis ? Methotrexate', 'ankihub_id': 'b0b172fb-78cb-4b8d-84e1-dd65792372a2'}, {'anki_id': 1509813091692.0, 'document': 'What drug is used in prophylaxis of toxoplasmosis (Toxoplasma gondii) ? TMP-SMX - Indicated for toxoplasmosis prophylaxis when CD4 count <100 cells/mm 3 (also used as prophylaxis of Pneumocystis pneumonia) - Sulfadiazine + pyrimethamine is used for treatment', 'ankihub_id': 'cfd2ab44-f39c-46df-b862-af3b45e3396e'}, {'anki_id': 1488154222514.0, 'document': 'Paget disease of bone (osteitis deformans) may present with bone pain due to microfractures or long bone "chalk stick" fractures', 'ankihub_id': '103d04f2-8d41-4e45-a7ef-c76da4f6c4f6'}, {'anki_id': 1556994553654.0, 'document': 'Osteoarthritis::Diagnosis - Narrow joint space, osteophytes/bone spurs, subchondral sclerosis (arrow in image), subchondral cyst - Fight the arthritis - Sclerosis = white (due to compressive load on joint) - Cysts = due to necrosis from compressive load', 'ankihub_id': 'a92b0e5a-bd60-403f-a71f-f32d65eb1cd5'}, {'anki_id': 1515725038044.0, 'document': 'Patients with greater trochanteric pain syndrome (GTPS) present with lateral hip pain that may radiate down the thigh - Notably, no groin pain (a true hip disease has referred pain to the groin) - Previously known as trochanteric bursitis, renamed as bursa involvement is uncommon', 'ankihub_id': '9ed242d3-b986-4a48-bbf1-c33f0e642877'}, {'anki_id': 1488418293440.0, 'document': 'Dermatomyositis and polymyositis present with bilateral proximal (shoulders, hips)::proximal or distal muscle weakness - e.g., difficulty rising from chair , combing hair , climbing stairs (rhyming tasks!), or lifting heavy objects - Distal involvement can develop late in disease', 'ankihub_id': 'b6ab575f-cde8-44c8-a5d3-7dcbe5fbf0c5'}, {'anki_id': 1488502594677.0, 'document': 'Psoriasis may be associated with Munro microabscesses , which are collections of neutrophils in the stratum corneum', 'ankihub_id': '445cee4e-831e-417f-a07c-1180ba236cf2'}, {'anki_id': 1504646845298.0, 'document': "What is the likely causative organism in a patient that develops osteomyelitis after stepping on a rusty nail ? The nail pierced the patient's shoes and pierced the heel Pseudomonas aeruginosa - Staph aureus and Pseudomonas are responsible for most deep infections following puncture wounds; the sole of a shoe (warm, moist) is a hospitable environment for Pseudomonas - The Mona Lisa ( Pseudo mona s) looks into your soul ( sole )", 'ankihub_id': '2c967197-0071-4f93-8fa0-d6b1d4382874'}, {'anki_id': 1488248097320.0, 'document': 'Is reactive arthritis characterized by sterile or septic synovial fluid? Sterile ~ 5,000 - 50,000 WBCs/mm 3 but no bacteria present MORE common than having HLA-B27 (30%-50% of RA pts)', 'ankihub_id': '08e46fe1-e256-47ee-8d77-0e3a381db748'}, {'anki_id': 1505323783745.0, 'document': 'What is the most common finding on cervical radiography in patients with cervical spondylosis ? Osteophytes - Other findings include disc space narrowing and hypertrophic vertebral bodies; these can all compress the nerves and cause a radiculopathy - Osteophyte : a bony outgrowth that can occur in inflamed or degenerating joints (e.g., from osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, joint ligament injury, ankylosing spondylitis) - Can be asymptomatic or cause pain, joint deformity, tendinitis, restriction of joint movement, or compression of adjacent nerves - Visible on imaging as bony projections or spurs along the joint line', 'ankihub_id': '490c94df-eb5b-430f-8b5a-e3d11738400c'}, {'anki_id': 1523376903082.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with a morbilliform rash and eosinophilia 8 weeks after starting allopurinol ? DRESS syndrome - Treatment involves discontinuation of the offending drug - A morbilliform rash is an erythematous, maculopapular rash resembling measles DRESS syndrome D rug Allopurinol and antiepileptics (e.g., phenytoin, carbamazepine) R eaction (rash) Morbilliform starting on the face/upper trunk → becomes widespread Facial edema is common E osinophilia ↑ eosinophil count S ystemic symptoms Fever/malaise Diffuse lymphadenopathy ~90% of patients have involvement of ≥1 organ system ( e.g., liver [transaminitis], kidney, lung )', 'ankihub_id': '5a6dfd4e-edf9-4065-a061-721314ac8fe2'}, {'anki_id': 1504141588808.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a sexually active patient that presents with fever / chills , polyarthralgia , and pustules on the chest and extensor surfaces of the forearms ? Disseminated gonococcal infection - The patient is normotensive, has no abnormal heart sounds, and has a rash that spares the palms and soles (helps rule out toxic shock syndrome, infective endocarditis, and secondary syphilis, respectively) - Palms and soles are occasionally affected - Treat with intravenous 3rd generation cephalosporin (e.g., ceftriaxone) Sara Mehrsefat , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via WikiDoc (image 1); Dr. Thomas F. Sellers , via CDC (i mage 2) & CDC (i mage 3)', 'ankihub_id': '92b67e83-5647-4b47-9939-8d63db1db5ae'}, {'anki_id': 1488418099220.0, 'document': 'Dermatomyositis may present with a(n) malar rash that is similar to SLE - Also appears after sun exposure - Distinguished by involving the nasolabial folds (spared in SLE)', 'ankihub_id': '45e6f61c-db36-43ba-9703-80795cde5925'}, {'anki_id': 1681522950380.0, 'document': 'Prophylactic antimicrobial therapy for patients with chronic granulomatous disease (CGD) includes TMP-SMX and itraconazole::2 - Can also add IFN-γ for severe phenotypes - If the patient develops breakthrough infection despite appropriate antimicrobial prophylaxis, biopsy the affected area prior to empiric therapy due to risk of resistant organisms', 'ankihub_id': '3f5c8b6b-0a68-400c-a652-03738ac09f11'}, {'anki_id': 1489968436766.0, 'document': 'Golimumab is a monoclonal antibody against TNF-α', 'ankihub_id': '358f49f9-6c1a-4205-ac1f-485bffad0cb3'}, {'anki_id': 1523584884341.0, 'document': 'Patients with DRESS syndrome present with fever, generalized lymphadenopathy, facial::location edema, and diffuse morbilliform skin rash The rash can progress to a confluent erythema with follicular accentuation DRESS syndrome D rug Allopurinol and antiepileptics (e.g., phenytoin, carbamazepine) R eaction (rash) Morbilliform starting on the face/upper trunk → becomes widespread Facial edema is common E osinophilia ↑ eosinophil count S ystemic symptoms Fever/malaise Diffuse lymphadenopathy ~90% of patients have involvement of ≥1 organ system ( e.g., liver [transaminitis], kidney, lung )', 'ankihub_id': '100c052d-b6d4-4017-b622-3d4b5d8c9aff'}, {'anki_id': 1686427339913.0, 'document': 'Autoimmune polyendocrine syndrome type 2 (Schmidt syndrome / APS-2) is characterized by a triad of: - Adrenal insufficiency - Autoimmune thyroid disease - T1DM - Classically associated with antibodies against adrenal steroid enzymes (e.g., 17α-hydroxylase) - Other associated conditions include alopecia areata, pernicious anemia, vitiligo, myasthenia gravis, and rheumatoid arthritis Autoimmune Polyendocrine Syndromes APS-1 APS-2 Clinical Features Adrenal insufficency, hypoparathyroidism, chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis, ectodermal dystrophy Adrenal insufficiency, autoimmune thyroid disease (e.g., Hashimoto or Graves), T1DM Age of Onset Childhood Adulthood Genetic Association AIRE gene mutaton HLA-DR3/DR-4', 'ankihub_id': '0a164c7a-0b78-463a-b066-718fe15a4a05'}, {'anki_id': 1505323439318.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an elderly patient with unilateral neck pain and sensory deficits over the posterior forearm ? Physical exam reveals limited neck rotation and lateral bending Cervical spondylosis - Limited neck rotation and lateral bending is due to osteoarthritis with secondary muscle spasm; sensory deficit is due to osteophyte-induced radiculopathy - Spondylosis : a broad term used to describe degenerative changes of the spine that may result in irritation and/or damage of the adjacent nerve roots; symptoms may include pain, paresthesia, and weakness', 'ankihub_id': '7987feeb-6ff0-46ff-9e1f-dd380e7fb2e9'}, {'anki_id': 1476583253097.0, 'document': 'Chronic vitamin A toxicity may cause arthralgias ::joint complication', 'ankihub_id': '013b636a-f659-41c2-889e-471da615b090'}, {'anki_id': 1509211489613.0, 'document': 'Azathioprine/6-MP can be used to treat inflammatory bowel disease (GI) - Crohn disease, ulcerative colitis - Use is limited due to concerns of toxicity', 'ankihub_id': '312d4da6-8c1e-48b8-a23f-77231cf6e382'}, {'anki_id': 1572911199883.0, 'document': 'The next step in management for a patient with rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis (RPGN) is immediate IV glucocorticoids::treatment - Combination therapy with cyclophosphamide is generally recommended as well because it significantly decreases the risk of recurrence - Blood pressure control should also be initiated and kidney function must be monitored to assess the need for renal replacement therapy (RRT) - "pauci" immune on microscopy', 'ankihub_id': '8d359cf7-c0dd-4e5a-8352-26a9219030e6'}, {'anki_id': 1505170857657.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young female athlete that presents with sharp, localized pain to palpation along the 2nd metatarsal bone ? The patient is an avid runner and her BMI is 18 kg/m 2 Stress fracture More common in patients with the " female athlete triad" (oligo/amenorrhea, decreased caloric intake, osteoporosis) ; manifests as localized pain (stress the point)', 'ankihub_id': 'aa800b10-805c-4f68-aece-654daa5641c1'}, {'anki_id': 1555719638350.0, 'document': 'Thyroid nodule and normal or elevated TSH should be evaluated using ultrasound +/- FNA*::next step Likely nonfunctioning → higher risk of cancer *Thyroid nodules >1 cm with high-risk sonographic features (microcalcifications, irregular margins, internal vascularity) and all noncystic thyroid nodules >2 cm-should undergo fine needle aspiration (FNA) biopsy', 'ankihub_id': 'df2fe57f-8eb5-49be-be69-3ba7c881c8f1'}, {'anki_id': 1500053449197.0, 'document': 'The oral antifungal drug terbinafine is used to treat onychomycosis ( dermatophyte infection of nails) and tinea capitis::what 2 dermatophyte infections - "Terbin"-afine turban - "Oneycomb"-mycosis', 'ankihub_id': '66b4b097-61b9-473f-bdbf-5622ead7c3c6'}, {'anki_id': 1496872960311.0, 'document': 'Probenecid may increase the risk of forming renal stones due to increased uric acid excretion Prevent with hydration and urine alkalinization (NaHCO 3 )', 'ankihub_id': '87352de3-564d-4711-ad6f-eff2073523ae'}, {'anki_id': 1505936409887.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with progressive peripheral neuropathy ? Physical exam reveals areas of hyper- and hypopigmentation , as well as hyperkeratosis . LFTs are also elevated with pancytopenia . The patient restores antique furniture as a hobby Arsenic poisoning (chronic) - Arsenic may be found in pressure-treated wood and insecticides - Diagnosis is confirmed with elevated urine arsenic level - Mees lines (leukonychia striata) on the nails are a characteristic finding - Imagine an "arse" that is hyper/hypopigmented', 'ankihub_id': '74381ea4-3766-409a-a917-b44ea815a61a'}, {'anki_id': 1518028693618.0, 'document': 'Hypertrophic osteoarthropathy is caused by an abnormal proliferation of skin and bone at distal extremities', 'ankihub_id': 'dbb17418-2d9e-43a4-8066-54e3443fc7ef'}, {'anki_id': 1516129830494.0, 'document': 'Which bacteria is seen sampled from the vagina below? Gardnerella vaginalis Epithelial cell covered with bacteria ( clue cell )', 'ankihub_id': '6c4aa476-a303-465a-b097-277f2c995693'}, {'anki_id': 1517771826170.0, 'document': 'Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis can result from congenital defects in IL-17 signaling, commonly due to a deficiency in AIRE protein - Thus these mutations cause Th 17 dysfunction IL-17 is secreted by Th 17 and is a proinflammatory cytokine that is involved in: - Production of neutrophil chemokines (recruits neutrophils to a site of inflammation) - Production of proinflammatory cytokines (IL-6, IL-1β, TNF-α) - Production of PGE 2 - Production of antimicrobial peptides by keratinocytes', 'ankihub_id': '3c8ae426-fb41-4f17-924f-0a7f15ac22c5'}, {'anki_id': 1488248029605.0, 'document': 'Which arthritis is associated with Heberden nodes and Bouchard nodes ? Osteoarthritis::Osteoarthritis or Rheumatoid arthritis - " H igh" (distal) for H eberden (DIP) - " B elow" (proximal) for B ouchard (PIP)', 'ankihub_id': '3e5e94f4-a025-4ec4-8dd0-6f1cb1b96715'}, {'anki_id': 1556313890639.0, 'document': 'Are nonpharmacologic treatments or pharmacological treatments used first in treatment of osteoarthritis ? Non-pharmacologic NSAIDs have side effects, so try to avoid them if possible Nonpharmacologic treatments: - Lifestyle changes: weight management, exercises, decrease weight-bearing exercises - Braces, foot orthoses, cane, crutches - Heat Pharmacologic treatment: - Oral and topical NSAIDs - Topical capsaicin - Duloxetine - Intraarticular glucocorticoid injections - Hyaluronate injections for viscosupplementation Surgical treatment: joint replacement', 'ankihub_id': 'cae70c67-1264-4dea-824d-dc588023602d'}, {'anki_id': 1553593811829.0, 'document': 'How do you treat the pain in rheumatoid arthritis ? Slipped capital femoral epiphysis (SCFE)::Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease vs Slipped capital femoral epiphysis (SCFE) - Requires fixation with a screw, and there may be a prophylactic screw fixation of the contralateral hip as well - Note: Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease requires surgery if the patient is ≥ 6 years old', 'ankihub_id': '9def5dd8-5056-4d21-84bc-d79a4c104f81'}, {'anki_id': 1488247917419.0, 'document': 'Does osteoarthritis present with systemic symptoms (e.g., fever, fatigue)? Allopurinol Delayed type IV hypersensitivity - DRESS syndrome (life-threatening!) DRESS syndrome D rug Allopurinol and antiepileptics (e.g., phenytoin, carbamazepine) R eaction (rash) Morbilliform starting on the face/upper trunk → becomes widespread Facial edema is common E osinophilia ↑ eosinophil count S ystemic symptoms Fever/malaise Diffuse lymphadenopathy ~90% of patients have involvement of ≥1 organ system ( e.g., liver [transaminitis], kidney, lung )', 'ankihub_id': '8747353c-f9a7-4ca8-b0d4-21edacd3aaef'}, {'anki_id': 1515775469790.0, 'document': 'In iliotibial band syndrome , pain develops secondary to friction of the iliotibial band against the lateral femoral epicondyle', 'ankihub_id': '00759995-93e8-41df-97e5-271cafe0d5e1'}, {'anki_id': 1487815461024.0, 'document': 'Sjögren syndrome can be primary ( sicca syndrome ) or associated with another autoimmune disorder, especially rheumatoid arthritis', 'ankihub_id': 'c6efc778-c208-4cde-85b7-c0aa380546ed'}, {'anki_id': 1402678070433.0, 'document': 'Septic arthritis , most commonly of the knee , is a musculoskeletal complication of Neisseria gonorrhoeae infection - This is typically a symmetrical - Joint-tap will show purulent synovial fluid that does not gram stain (because infection is intracellular - PMNs) - Not to be confused with reactive arthritis seen in Chlamydial infections', 'ankihub_id': '234f31fd-08a6-47e8-a13d-78aa0f3b895f'}, {'anki_id': 1516553657699.0, 'document': 'In patients with Osgood-Schlatter disease , patients report pain on resisted knee extension Can take a lateral radiograph of the knee to confirm (classic fragmentation of tibial tubercle is observed)', 'ankihub_id': 'f61c0846-2018-4ca3-bdd0-a92349a24590'}, {'anki_id': 1503087564104.0, 'document': 'Systemic release of Streptococcus pyogenes erythrogenic exotoxins A, B, and C results in scarlet fever - Pathogenesis not clear, but treatment with antifungals supports theory for involvement of Malassezia species (altered lipid composition on skin surface leading to inflammation) - Shampoos work well if used properly - Topical steroids or systemic antifungals can be attempted if refractory', 'ankihub_id': '893ea7e0-2559-4e38-8721-f2f40018e556'}, {'anki_id': 1556361157501.0, 'document': 'Middle-aged person with unilateral hip pain on palpation, external rotation, or resisted abduction associated with overuse = greater trochanteric pain syndrome (GTPS) - Pain is exacerbated by external pressure (e.g., lying on hip when going to sleep) - Previously known as trochanteric bursitis; renamed as bursa involvement is uncommon', 'ankihub_id': 'dae7bbfb-d631-4112-a6e3-e2c85257d206'}, {'anki_id': 1554136971157.0, 'document': 'Asthma Palpable purpura Sinusitis Neuropathy Eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA)::Vasculitis - Lungs = asthmatic symptoms A-CHURG/CHOO - EGPA was formerly known as Churg-Strauss syndrome Palpable purpura:', 'ankihub_id': '3c3da5e6-3fc0-4dac-a955-abc2fc85b17d'}, {'anki_id': 1488418278945.0, 'document': 'Polymyositis is an inflammatory disorder of skeletal muscle only - Most commonly involves the shoulders - Skin is NOT involved', 'ankihub_id': 'cf174dba-014c-4dee-b22a-519a630b8a30'}, {'anki_id': 1481857933770.0, 'document': 'Huntington disease presents initially with chorea , and may later show depression ::cognitive, dementia ::cognitive, and/or aggression - Chorea may progress to hypo/akinesia in later stages - Symptoms may be initially mistaken for substance abuse', 'ankihub_id': '8a6cf252-6dd7-4c6f-bc70-6140a224e006'}, {'anki_id': 1516045605143.0, 'document': 'De Quervain tenosynovitis can be diagnosed with the Finkelstein test , in which pain is elicited over the radial styloid with ulnar deviation of the hand while the thumb is flexed in the palm - Clinical diagnosis - no additional testing / imaging required! - AKA De Quervain tendinopathy', 'ankihub_id': 'c24d59a8-cacd-4996-8d58-4958a2b6b58b'}, {'anki_id': 1545267033146.0, 'document': 'Itchy , coin -shaped, well-demarcated erythematous plaques associated with dry skin is characteristic of nummular eczema::condition Mohammad2018 (photo 2), both CC BY-SA 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons - Topical glucocorticoids are first-line - Lesions usually on dorsal hands and feet, extensor surfaces of arms and legs, flanks, and hips - Keys to diagnosis are sharply defined, round, erythematous, scaly, fissured-plaque lesions; may also have intermittent exudate - Exact etiology unknown, but occurrence in the setting of chronically dry skin suggests decreased production of skin lipids - Skin biopsy is nonspecific and not often done, but may help exclude other diagnoses', 'ankihub_id': '4f2e2b78-36f5-44fb-8a6e-73d9573e7875'}, {'anki_id': 1504830934779.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with recent steroid use who presents with uniform-appearing , erythematous papules across the back, shoulders, and upper arms ? The papules appear to be in same stage of development and do not have associated comedones Drug-induced acne (e.g., secondary to glucocorticoid use)', 'ankihub_id': '201e849b-865c-4c3f-9f20-69434f1b82f5'}, {'anki_id': 1488247957804.0, 'document': 'Does rheumatoid arthritis present with systemic symptoms (e.g., fever, fatigue)? Yes', 'ankihub_id': '44727cb4-4664-47b5-8550-5ff8117be8db'}, {'anki_id': 1581618328984.0, 'document': 'IL-12 receptor deficiency is an immunodeficiency that may present with miliary TB and generalized rash with hemorrhagic necrosis - If IL-12 receptors on naive T cells are defective, macrophages cannot be activated by IFN-γ to trigger cytotoxicity in cells infected with intracellular pathogens such as mycobacteria and salmonella - Patients with IL-12 receptor deficiency often manifest for the first time with features of disseminated disease, sepsis, and DIC Yale Rosen , CC BY-SA 2.0 , via Flickr', 'ankihub_id': 'ca0d36e4-c5e0-4476-872c-87e41c34b830'}, {'anki_id': 1557532395675.0, 'document': 'Nail pitting and onycholysis are most closely associated with? Psoriasis Onycholysis = separation of the nail plate from the nail bed', 'ankihub_id': '6ad4551f-045b-43b9-9c94-fac8509c2608'}, {'anki_id': 1487815555439.0, 'document': 'Mixed connective tissue disease is characterized by speckled ::pattern ANA and anti-U1 RNP antibodies AKA Sharp syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '2c93cb98-2d58-4d11-aa9a-e3f09b05fb5f'}, {'anki_id': 1582642895292.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient on several medications with swelling and tenderness of the hand and knee joints and acute pericarditis ? Drug-induced lupus - New onset lupus symptoms and positive ANA and anti-histone antibodies - Anti-dsDNA antibodies are rarely seen', 'ankihub_id': '8059eecb-33bb-4fba-999c-4b530adb10ab'}, {'anki_id': 1539186050114.0, 'document': 'What is the most likely diagnosis in a young adult with recurrent sinopulmonary infections and low levels of all immunoglobulins? Common variable immunodeficiency (CVID) Chronic respiratory problems are also common (asthma, bronchiectasis)', 'ankihub_id': '800e17b5-5a4e-4f28-8868-39e107ef3407'}, {'anki_id': 1488679992616.0, 'document': 'Bullous pemphigoid is due to Ig G antibodies against hemidesmosome components (BP180 & BP230) May have autoantibodies against type XVIII collagen or bullous pemphigoid antigen', 'ankihub_id': '1776747b-5451-4e42-829f-a84d6292ca81'}, {'anki_id': 1505158085865.0, 'document': "What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with diffusely rough , dry , and scaly skin ? The symptoms are worse in the winter , and symptoms of dry skin have been present for most of the patient's life Ichthyosis vulgaris - Chronic, inherited skin disorder characterized by diffuse dermal scaling ; treatment includes topical emollients, keratolytics, and topical retinoids (ikhthys = fish) - Keratolytics = hydroxy acid (e.g., lactic acid), urea, and salicylic acid", 'ankihub_id': '78034185-12a7-482a-be8b-1ba370436608'}, {'anki_id': 1518398718435.0, 'document': 'Cachexia is mediated by pro-inflammatory cytokines ( TNF, IFN-γ, IL-1, and IL-6::4), which cause activation of the ubiquitin-proteasome pathway - Thus, chronic disease and chronic inflammation are intrinsically linked - These cytokines are also responsible for constitutional symptoms (e.g., IL-6 in cardiac myxoma) - Ubiquitination of sarcomeric proteins → skeletal muscle loss', 'ankihub_id': '4fce1326-7a5f-4df6-b3c0-099d5ba7b1c4'}, {'anki_id': 1463101179451.0, 'document': 'What type of cancer does vaginal adenosis increase risk for? Clear cell adenocarcinoma - Thus, increased risk with exposure to diethylstilbestrol (DES) in utero - Also may have Müllerian abnormalities in females and increased risk of breast cancer in the mother Tumor outgrowth, 2cm in diameter (1st image), clear cell adenocarcinoma histology (2nd image):', 'ankihub_id': 'bc1c5dcf-0e26-4441-b214-de04a7973570'}, {'anki_id': 1481857904337.0, 'document': 'What is the mode of inheritance of Huntington disease ? Autosomal dominant', 'ankihub_id': '730c5424-ae53-4897-86be-b2e7ba6ea9bd'}, {'anki_id': 1516748457318.0, 'document': 'How do the following laboratory values change in anemia of chronic disease ? Serum iron : decreased TIBC : decreased % Saturation (of transferrin) : decreased Ferritin : increased High ferritin and low TIBC help distinguish ACD from iron deficiency anemia', 'ankihub_id': '05508172-905a-4b0c-8558-cecfd0d7e49c'}, {'anki_id': 1487117234083.0, 'document': 'Which immunoglobulin is released into breast milk (colostrum)? IgA', 'ankihub_id': '327aaaae-adc0-493f-8a6b-763fef1d3e56'}, {'anki_id': 1488680031918.0, 'document': 'Which blistering skin disorder presents as groups of pruritic vesicles , papules , or bullae located on extensor surfaces? Dermatitis herpetiformis - Often found on the extensor surfaces (e.g. knees, elbows) - Do not confuse with contact dermatitis (e.g., poison ivy): Typically localized itchy erythematous papules and vesicles (in severe cases) with serous oozing', 'ankihub_id': '7a6a3449-eb2e-48b2-a981-7f1fa18e89bf'}, {'anki_id': 1544184409399.0, 'document': 'What is the most definitive test for diagnosis of polymyositis ? Muscle biopsy - Shows a CD8 + lymphocytic infiltrate in the endomysium (vs. CD4 + infiltrate in the perimysium in dermatomyositis) - Dermato = outside, closer to skin - Poly = inside - CD4+ = derm4+omyositis (4+ resembles a capitalized "A" followed by a lowercase "t")', 'ankihub_id': '5cba9a4a-4747-4489-beb1-a809eee8a218'}, {'anki_id': 1544201912998.0, 'document': 'Patient with a "twisted ankle" leading to pain, swelling, and inability to bear weight : Ankle fracture::Diagnosis?', 'ankihub_id': '18c7e7ee-545e-4d39-8db6-b09138395346'}, {'anki_id': 1521739439913.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an elderly patient that presents with dry eyes and dry mouth ? ANA is negative Age-related sicca syndrome - Due to age-related exocrine gland atrophy - Sjögren syndrome typically presents in younger patients with a positive ANA', 'ankihub_id': '23ab4abe-2fb1-4c8a-a7fb-e924bc49e861'}, {'anki_id': 1471806231010.0, 'document': 'Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) may present with polyneuropathy::neuro and/or stroke::neuro - Polyneuropathy presents as mononeuritis multiplex (neuropathy of ≥ 2 noncontiguous peripheral nerves) - P olyarteriti S = P olyneuropathy and S troke Other clinical features : - Renal (∼ 60%): HTN, renal impairment - Coronary artery (∼ 35%); ↑ risk of MI - Skin (∼ 40%): rash, ulcerations, nodules - GI : abdominal pain, melena, nausea, vomiting - Lungs : Usually spared', 'ankihub_id': 'cf574e86-00f6-4971-b130-41dc5b67bb7b'}, {'anki_id': 1550334542442.0, 'document': 'Where is the pain felt with osteoarthritis of the hips ? Groin Non -tender (vs. greater trochanteric pain syndrome (trochanteric bursitis), tender), worsened with activity (vs. meralgia paresthetica, unaffected), and radiates to the anterior thigh or knee', 'ankihub_id': 'ed1b2e42-2a79-459a-9997-7193c581ce82'}, {'anki_id': 1545791891367.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young female that presents with foot pain between the toes with a clicking sensation when the 3rd/4th metatarsal heads are squeezed together ? The patient also experiences numbness and paresthesias radiating to the toes proximal to the pain Morton neuroma - Mechanically-induced entrapment of the intermetatarsal plantar nerves ; M has 3 points or "toes" - Morton neuroma is an inflammation of the common digital nerve between the third and fourth toes - The cause is often pointed, high-heeled shoes that force the toes to be bunched together - Conservative management includes analgesics and sensible shoes, but surgery can be done if needed', 'ankihub_id': '99b3e1e0-b072-46a3-9079-2ba455280d35'}, {'anki_id': 1536791338200.0, 'document': 'Inability to extend thumb / ring finger but pops with forced extension is suggestive of trigger finger::diagnosis - Trigger and pop - Trigger finger is due to injury that involves the proximal interphalangeal and metacarpophalangeal joint; glucocorticoid injections are attempted if conservative therapy fails - Mallet finger is due to forced flexion of extended digit, the distal interphalangeal joint is involved; glucocorticoid injections are not a treatment option', 'ankihub_id': 'c0c39c1a-a285-4eaa-8f67-fed930d5a598'}, {'anki_id': 1488418582332.0, 'document': 'Raynaud phenomenon is decreased blood flow to the skin due to arteriolar vasospasm in response to cold or stress', 'ankihub_id': 'a49da262-cbe0-4cb0-9f1d-a43f3c58eafc'}, {'anki_id': 1488154244383.0, 'document': 'Paget disease of bone (osteitis deformans) often presents with hearing loss due to CN impingement from foramen narrowing - May also have bone pain, leg bowing, and headaches - No known treatment for reversal', 'ankihub_id': '1fe74bd4-1617-4b7c-9e9c-ac2a33cbf640'}, {'anki_id': 1585609953732.0, 'document': 'Autoimmune polyendocrine syndrome type 1 (APS-1) is characterized by a triad of: - Hypoparathyroidism - Adrenal insufficiency - Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis APS-1 is due to mutations in the autoimmune regulatory gene (AIRE) which lead to impaired negative selection of T-cells Mnemonic: "without AIRE , your body will CHAR " C hronic mucocutaneous candidiasis H ypoparathyroidism A drenal insufficiency R ecurrent candida infections Autoimmune Polyendocrine Syndromes APS-1 APS-2 Clinical Features Adrenal insufficiency, hypoparathyroidism, chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis, ectodermal dystrophy Adrenal insufficiency, autoimmune thyroid disease (e.g., Hashimoto or Graves), T1DM Age of Onset Childhood Adulthood Genetic Association AIRE gene mutation HLA-DR3/DR-4', 'ankihub_id': '6f323bc7-fdb7-4d8c-b09d-9d42fb03173f'}, {'anki_id': 1554030704021.0, 'document': 'Diagnosis of polymyositis or dermatomyositis is made with electromyography (EMG)::diagnostic tool and confirmed with muscle biopsy ::procedure UWorld 2023 claims EMG / MRI are for diagnostic uncertainty and that diagnosis is made via clinical features and serum antibody testing', 'ankihub_id': '8ca7e73d-1b79-47d2-ba39-6c268584a55d'}, {'anki_id': 1471806235020.0, 'document': 'Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) may present with skin lesions in up to 1/3rd of patients - e.g., cutaneous eruptions - Including livedo reticularis (a purplish network-patterned discoloration) and palpable purpura Other clinical features: - Re nal (~60%): HTN, renal impairment - Coronary artery (~35%); ↑ risk of MI - Neuro : polyneuropathy, stroke - GI : abdominal pain, melena, nausea, vomiting - Lungs : usually spared', 'ankihub_id': '23742d3a-9be8-4840-82d9-13f420dae78a'}, {'anki_id': 1505254071463.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an older woman with pain behind the right heel several days after beginning treatment for a UTI? Achilles tendinopathy Likely secondary to fluoroquinolone use; risk factors include old age (> 60) and female gender', 'ankihub_id': '3bcc782e-24cb-400a-afc1-c7e8ed2b9c17'}, {'anki_id': 1554655138926.0, 'document': 'Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) shows patchy demineralization on X-ray and increased uptake in affected limbs on bone scintigraphy May also have local erythema or vasomotor changes', 'ankihub_id': 'a698610c-815d-4a3b-bd66-bca691cab816'}, {'anki_id': 1555544702218.0, 'document': 'Severe sepsis , obstetric complications, cancer , burns , trauma , major surgery , acute pancreatitis , APL are all possible causes of disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC)::hematological problem Watch Acute Pancreatitis Watch Postpartum Hemorrhage', 'ankihub_id': 'dd3afaad-a4d4-4af9-a361-725aa73563a9'}, {'anki_id': 1482374188222.0, 'document': 'Which form of IBD involves only mucosal and submucosal inflammation ? Ulcerative colitis Contrast with Crohn disease, which is transmural', 'ankihub_id': 'be2c4023-025a-43a4-98b6-df0bc5fe96c4'}, {'anki_id': 1505262379706.0, 'document': 'What imaging modality is initially used to diagnose and monitor ankylosing spondylitis (AS) ? X-ray (of the sacroiliac joints) - Classically shows narrowing or widening of the sacroiliac joint space; another classic finding is fusion of vertebral bodies with ossification of the intervertebral discs ( bamboo spine ) - HLA-B27 is not specific for AS and is not necessary for diagnosis', 'ankihub_id': 'cbe6edf2-ec80-41f7-9670-2a0cf748e352'}, {'anki_id': 1482374241957.0, 'document': 'Crohn disease::IBD appears grossly with cobblestone mucosa', 'ankihub_id': '316cc15a-8c03-488d-84ed-1090be2652ab'}, {'anki_id': 1580265185930.0, 'document': 'Anti-Saccharomyces cerevisiae antibodies (ASCAs) are found in 60–70% of individuals with Crohn disease and in 10–20% of individuals with ulcerative colitis', 'ankihub_id': '300bc32a-ff76-4179-a745-12c1747495be'}, {'anki_id': 1557182959790.0, 'document': 'Refractory osteoarthritis of the knee is managed with surgery (total knee arthroplasty)::next step Replaces the articular surface of the knee with prosthetic components', 'ankihub_id': '0cc529a8-8ae6-4561-ad9a-fa88c9ac7dd0'}, {'anki_id': 1488680484433.0, 'document': 'What is the prognosis of the superficial spreading subtype of melanoma ? Good (early radial growth) Omar Bari (1st); Philip R. Cohen, CC BY 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons (2nd); 0x6adb015, CC BY 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons (3rd); Will Blake, CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons (4th )', 'ankihub_id': '111b069e-3d89-4057-ac74-2e49a2706192'}, {'anki_id': 1533467583384.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for a patient with suspected mild carpal tunnel syndrome with no thenar or hypothenar atrophy on physical exam? Wrist splinting - No thenar or hypothenar atrophy on physical exam → not severe disease - Splinting in neutral position affords the lowest pressure in the carpal tunnel - Glucocorticoids and/or decompression surgery may be considered in patients with severe disease ( significant weakness or refractory symptoms ) - Intial treatment is wrist splinting; second-line is local anesthetic + steroid injection; third-line is surgical intervention', 'ankihub_id': '72f6e5cb-9b80-49ef-8a02-3ebc1f9f3d18'}, {'anki_id': 1554223545390.0, 'document': 'Chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy (CIDP) presents with symptoms similar to Guillain-Barré syndrome::disease, though over a period of > 2 months (chronic) - Patients present with ascending symmetric sensory and motor deficits that progress over a period greater than two months - Likely autoimmune in nature as anti-GM1 antibodies , anti-contactin 1 , and anti-neurofascin have been detected', 'ankihub_id': '035351cb-b88e-4ab1-9882-f939f4629473'}, {'anki_id': 1544184366652.0, 'document': 'All patients with polymyositis / dermatomyositis should be screened for occult malignancy Most commonly ovarian, lung, pancreatic, stomach, or colorectal cancers, or non-Hodgkin lymphoma', 'ankihub_id': '39fc6614-9f07-4189-ac4d-b695ef6aa013'}, {'anki_id': 1578778171637.0, 'document': 'Which of the following medications provide fast-acting symptomatic relief during a flare-up of rheumatoid arthritis ? Prednisolone::Methotrexate / Prednisolone', 'ankihub_id': '9ff02407-9d8d-4064-b3f9-baff5b45c990'}, {'anki_id': 1489968286922.0, 'document': 'Alemtuzumab is primarily used to treat chronic lymphocytic leukemia and multiple sclerosis - a LE mtuzumab = LE ukemia - ale M t U zumab = MU ltiple sclerosis Targets CD52 on lymphocytes', 'ankihub_id': 'b13481ed-a81a-45ee-94e2-e81a3102c2a4'}, {'anki_id': 1584475300101.0, 'document': 'What is the management for patients ≥ 6 y/o with Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease ? Femoral osteotomy::specific - Surgery is also indicated for extensive femoral head damage (>50%) or lateral pillar type B or C classification - In children > 6 yo, bone formation capacity is too limited to repair the femoral head damage without intervention', 'ankihub_id': 'a800f8f9-88d5-454f-b687-657fbef0be08'}, {'anki_id': 1473638633433.0, 'document': 'Sarcoidosis is associated with lupus pernio , which are skin lesions on the face resembling lupus', 'ankihub_id': 'aa15a14c-2e7a-4218-846a-b3d51819c6a5'}, {'anki_id': 1523377868136.0, 'document': 'DRESS syndrome is most commonly precipitated by allopurinol and antiepileptics (e.g., phenytoin, carbamazepine) Typically has a long latency period (2-8 weeks) DRESS syndrome D rug Allopurinol and antiepileptics (e.g., phenytoin, carbamazepine) R eaction (rash) Morbilliform starting on the face/upper trunk → becomes widespread Facial edema is common E osinophilia ↑ eosinophil count S ystemic symptoms Fever/malaise Diffuse lymphadenopathy ~90% of patients have involvement of ≥1 organ system ( e.g., liver [transaminitis], kidney, lung )', 'ankihub_id': 'bfdf5af2-ec39-4ac0-b0d2-b9f6f6c2a6b7'}, {'anki_id': 1488247856555.0, 'document': 'Which joint pathology is caused by a progressive degeneration of articular cartilage , most often due to " wear and tear "? Osteoarthritis (degenerative joint disease)', 'ankihub_id': '8cf9a641-2f16-489e-8aea-50c387d8fd88'}, {'anki_id': 1554064304169.0, 'document': 'Spondylosis is a general term for degenerative changes of the spine This can lead to cervical radiculopathy (e.g., osteophytes, degeneration of vertebral body ) by compression of nerve roots', 'ankihub_id': '05e56ac1-abea-404d-a81a-58e1e1f339ab'}, {'anki_id': 1473986300420.0, 'document': 'Decreased ADAMTS13 (e.g., TTP) is usually due to an acquired autoantibody Can also more rarely be due to genetic disorder', 'ankihub_id': 'c6c90792-9326-4e53-a829-4365294abf1f'}, {'anki_id': 1555755710769.0, 'document': 'Which form of dysphagia is characterized by coughing , choking , or nasal regurgitation on swallowing ? Oropharyngeal dysphagia::Oropharyngeal or Esophageal - Oropharyngeal dysphagia is difficulty propelling a food bolus from the oral cavity into the pharynx, or from the pharynx into the upper esophagus (ie. difficulty initiating swallowing - vs. Esophageal dysphagia: difficulty moving food down the esophagus → food stops / "sticks" after being swallowed', 'ankihub_id': 'f49d962e-b13d-4bd7-9218-c035cbd0d1d4'}, {'anki_id': 1476660908107.0, 'document': 'What does the carrier molecule S-adenosylmethionine (SAM) carry in its activated form? CH 3 groups AKA a methyl group', 'ankihub_id': 'd65f72cc-ffda-4102-bb24-fb77562150cc'}, {'anki_id': 1515775658338.0, 'document': 'Patients with a(n) leg-length discrepancy are at increased risk of greater trochanteric pain syndrome (GTPS) - Gluteus medius is overused due to compensating for the hip instability - Previously known as trochanteric bursitis, renamed as bursa involvement is uncommon Leg length discrepany after hip replacement', 'ankihub_id': 'dfb889e6-3289-442a-aaf6-d77ef757fdfc'}, {'anki_id': 1473995698255.0, 'document': "Von Willebrand disease is associated with an abnormal ristocetin assay - i.e., no platelet aggregation with ristocetin cofactor assay - Ristocetin binds vWF and platelet glycoprotein Ib (thus, platelet aggregation if vWF / GPIb present) - Patient's serum + ristocetin are placed together, then platelet aggregation stimuli are added (ADP, arachidonic acid) - Normal aggregation = vWF active, poor aggregation = vWF defective - Ris(kt) o see it in → it's a risk to see if vWF is there... no good if it's not", 'ankihub_id': 'f5619ede-effe-42e3-a07c-8b4b51cc7c63'}, {'anki_id': 1506275084063.0, 'document': 'Typhus is a rickettsial disease that presents with a rash that starts centrally and then spreads out , but spares the palms and soles - Also spares the head - R MSF (R. r ickettsii) = palms/soles/w R ists - T yphus (R. typhi; R. prowazekii) = T runk', 'ankihub_id': 'd8f79608-c708-4ce5-ac8f-2646b8a3228a'}, {'anki_id': 1556914319676.0, 'document': 'Which type of skin cancer is most likely to arise from chronically wounded , immunocompromised , scarred , or inflamed skin ? Squamous cell carcinoma - SCC arising in chronic wounds tends to be more aggressive with an increased risk of metastasis - SCC arising from burn wound/previously damaged skin is termed a Marjolin ulcer - Marjolin ulcer: diagnose with biopsy; treat with wide local excision and skin grafting', 'ankihub_id': 'd01b358a-999d-49ca-9a41-b1bf6a7b6720'}, {'anki_id': 1516552882272.0, 'document': 'In Osgood-Schlatter disease, healed microavulsions can be noted on physical exam by the presence of a pronounced/enlarged tibial tubercle During healing process, callus formation causes tubercle to become elevated and prominent', 'ankihub_id': '8a4f436f-da83-4b4a-84eb-8a92630e02ce'}, {'anki_id': 1553592792572.0, 'document': 'What serologic markers are associated with systemic lupus erythematosus ? Sensitive , but not specific : ANA Specific , but not sensitive : anti-dsDNA::renal involvement and anti-Smith Drug -induced lupus: anti-histone Reflects disease severity: CRP', 'ankihub_id': '0bd5143b-dc43-4bfc-99e2-977bb373a64b'}, {'anki_id': 1660151469988.0, 'document': 'Which antibiotics are commonly associated with distal symmetric polyneuropathy ? Fluoroquinolones, isoniazid, metronidazole::3 - Sensory loss in stocking-glove distribution progressing over 2-3 weeks; may also have significant pain (burning) and hyporeflexia - Cessation of the offending drug is the first step in management', 'ankihub_id': 'd7d6089c-7011-4e8a-98c9-ecd0ce969b8b'}, {'anki_id': 1553766910010.0, 'document': 'Takayasu arteritis::vasculitis - Flu-like symptoms and skin nodules: due to generalized inflammation - Weak pulses in upper extremities, ocular: due to involvement of aortic arch feeding upper body', 'ankihub_id': 'c143060e-ceb3-469e-8bec-af7d7fcd1840'}, {'anki_id': 1578194990599.0, 'document': 'Syphilis can present with a " Christmas tree" patterned rash with involvement of the palms and soles Differentiate from pityriasis rosea and pityriasis versicolor which does not involve the hands and soles', 'ankihub_id': 'ea8dfcbd-e05a-4303-9599-86579e5042c1'}, {'anki_id': 1487727540150.0, 'document': 'Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID) may be caused by MHC class II deficiency MHC II is necessary for CD4 + helper T cell activation and cytokine production', 'ankihub_id': 'ad831b68-5b6d-4988-a320-22a88fd24857'}, {'anki_id': 1521427925529.0, 'document': 'Dermatomyositis may present with " mechanic\'s hands ", which is darkening / thickening of fingertips + sides of fingers + palm sides resulting in irregular, "dirty" appearing marks', 'ankihub_id': 'c38ffc85-9aa9-413e-92d9-d07fe6896361'}, {'anki_id': 1553593812072.0, 'document': 'Which cervical spinal levels can be affected in rheumatoid arthritis ? 10-15% Total calcium in the blood is distributed as follows: - 40% : Bound to proteins (mainly albumin ) - 45% : Ionized (free and physiologically active ) - 10-15% : Complexed with anions (e.g., phosphate , sulfate , citrate ) - In conditions like hypoalbuminemia (e.g., liver cirrhosis , nephrotic syndrome ), total calcium levels may be low, even if ionized calcium levels remain normal - Alkalosis increases calcium binding to albumin, which lowers ionized calcium levels - Acidosis decreases calcium binding to albumin, which raises ionized calcium levels', 'ankihub_id': '2f6a16d6-a864-434e-9f64-ca805c8da794'}, {'anki_id': 1474164748214.0, 'document': 'Glucokinase is regulated via negative feedback by fructose-6-phosphate Glucokinase is inhibited by fructose -6-phosphate Hexokinase is inhibited by glucose -6-phosphate', 'ankihub_id': '176e3266-13f3-4506-aac6-078a756bd474'}, {'anki_id': 1475890872086.0, 'document': 'Glucose-6-phosphate is ultimately converted to ribulose-5-phosphate via the enzyme glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) 6-phosphogluconate is an intermediate in this reaction', 'ankihub_id': '59bf7da5-1489-41e1-b03e-2c5787a019e5'}, {'anki_id': 1475890881661.0, 'document': 'Conversion of glucose-6-P into ribulose-5-P (HMP shunt) produces one molecule of CO 2 and two molecules of NADPH', 'ankihub_id': 'f27096ff-ac46-417f-bfa6-bcf71559e634'}, {'anki_id': 1474224761953.0, 'document': 'How many molecules of ATP are produced from one molecule of FADH 2 via ATP synthase (ETC)? Malignant (necrotizing) otitis externa - Usually caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa ; presence of granulation tissue, elevated ESR , and severe pain distinguish MOE from typical otitis externa; facial droop may be present due to spread to CN VII; MOE is an osteomyelitis of the external auditory canal spreading to the skull base - Pathology : trauma to external auditory canal, bacteria subsequently enters - Clinical features : erythema and granulation tissue on the floor of external auditory canal - Diagnosis : done via culturing the debridement - Treatment : debridement and multidrug antibiotics - Complication : osteomyelitis of the temporal bone and skull base especially if immunocompromised', 'ankihub_id': '5c28f51e-2223-4ce6-b60a-11eec4c1deb2'}, {'anki_id': 1463101154172, 'document': 'The normal fetal epithelium of the lower 1/3rd of the vaginal canal is squamous epithelium', 'ankihub_id': '2759fd1f-3838-4642-a99e-be408591dec1'}, {'anki_id': 1496110867291, 'document': 'Tumors of glandular epithelium are known as adenomas when benign and adenocarcinomas when malignant e.g., a mucinous cystadenoma vs. a mucinous cystadenocarcinoma ; both are tumors composed of the embryonic epithelial lining of the endocervix (mucus-secreting cells)', 'ankihub_id': '5ef116cb-9a50-45d4-a23a-af24c29cda6c'}, {'anki_id': 1496165181235, 'document': 'Immunohistochemistry ::Lab technique is used to characterize tumors that are difficult to classify on histology This can have prognostic and predictive value', 'ankihub_id': '680060d9-4623-4f57-ac1b-e2042f8e77f7'}, {'anki_id': 1474509484893, 'document': 'Type II pneumocytes are clustered, cuboidal ::shape cells', 'ankihub_id': '052b6501-b609-4f6e-b6a7-5d79a1946ea7'}, {'anki_id': 1479267508916, 'document': 'What class of cells have a round, densely stained nucleus with a small amount of cytoplasm ? U reters:: U C olon* (ascending and descending):: C K idneys:: K E sophagus (thoracic portion):: E R ectum (partially):: R - Includes GI structures that lack a mesentery and non-GI structures - *Surgeons consider these intraperitoneal Structures become retroperitoneal two ways: - Develop without a posterior peritoneum against the posterior body wall and only have an anterior peritoneum - Develop as an intraperitoneal organ with a mesentery, and then move / are pushed back (like the pancreas (except tail), the 2nd to 4th part of the duodenum, and the ascending/descending colon) against the posterior abdominal wall and fuse with the body wall (secondarily retroperitoneal)', 'ankihub_id': 'c0cad631-b0a9-4ec7-8f7e-69f4c7170ec6'}, {'anki_id': 1475463353900, 'document': 'Urothelial carcinoma may arise via two distinct pathways : flat and papillary', 'ankihub_id': 'c6a6ba62-1d3b-43f2-ae69-42ee9b14f6d0'}, {'anki_id': 1500151965518, 'document': 'Sporothrix schenckii lesions are granulomas made of histiocytes and giant cells', 'ankihub_id': '9004d91e-e7dc-452d-84cb-ba773dee304b'}, {'anki_id': 1500030924945, 'document': 'What shape is Rickettsia spp.? [{'anki_id': 1509449043151.0, 'document': 'What is the first-line pharmacotherapy for attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) ≥ 6 years old? Stimulants - e.g., methylphenidate, amphetamines - Non-stimulant treatment options include atomoxetine (no addiction risk!) and α 2 -agonists (e.g., guanfacine, clonidine) - < 6 years old: first-line is CBT', 'ankihub_id': '6efb29ba-2822-4dcf-afc1-3968f6339ea2'}, {'anki_id': 1519869369194.0, 'document': 'What is the treatment of choice for an adult with suspected ADHD and a history of substance use disorder ? Atomoxetine - Stimulants are the most effective treatment, but have potential for misuse / addiction; second-line non-stimulant options in adults include bupropion and TCAs - ADHD first-line = methylphenidate, amphetamines - Atomoxetine = 2nd-line; no potential for addiction (not a schedule II prescription drug); increased risk of suicide in children / adolescents', 'ankihub_id': '7872e50b-14be-4527-a522-695e3d5ab4c3'}, {'anki_id': 1484623964858.0, 'document': 'ADHD is treated with stimulants ± cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT)* - Behavioral interventions are first-line in patients ≤ 5 years old - Complete a cardiac history and physical prior to prescribing - e.g., methylphenidate; less likely to cause extrapyramidal symptoms compared to neuroleptic agents', 'ankihub_id': '0851b374-6f05-4deb-9ca0-a089cb76eb9f'}, {'anki_id': 1485313504398.0, 'document': 'Delirium tremens classically occurs in a(n) hospital setting e.g., 2-4 days post surgery where the patient cannot drink', 'ankihub_id': '663d9b5d-6f6f-40b2-9a15-7e78d86bb327'}, {'anki_id': 1585417702202.0, 'document': 'Are α 2 agonists (e.g. clonidine, guanfacine) used to treat ADHD in adulthood? Exerts its effects on both heart rate and blood pressure by stimulating presynaptic α 2 adrenergic receptors in the rostral ventrolateral medulla (area responsible for basal and reflex control of sympathetic activity) - This effect results in a subsequent decrease in presynaptic release of norepinephrine and decreased sympathetic outflow causing both bradycardia and a decrease in peripheral vascular resistance - Can cause orthostatic syncope', 'ankihub_id': 'c98e0262-dc7c-4f5a-a3d1-ba70355cff7b'}, {'anki_id': 1522546037015.0, 'document': 'Diabetes mellitus may result in overflow incontinence - Diabetic autonomic neuropathy affects detrusor muscle innervation - First, damage to autonomic afferent innervation (cannot sense a full bladder) - Then, damage to the efferent fibers to detrusor (incomplete emptying → bladder overdistension)', 'ankihub_id': '52f20121-87d3-4dea-ac4d-94f4cd0f9b7f'}, {'anki_id': 1485048840582.0, 'document': 'In the presence of MAO inhibitors , tyramine enters the circulation and acts as a(n) sympathomimetic agent Displaces neurotransmitters (e.g., norepinephrine) from neuronal storage vesicles, increasing sympathetic stimulation', 'ankihub_id': '25e21ae8-7443-4104-8283-12b9a65ca60a'}, {'anki_id': 1583368345930.0, 'document': 'Methylphenidate may be considered for terminally-ill patients with limited life expectancy and severe acute depression and/or those at risk of suicide - Amitriptyline (tertiary amine) May be a useful side effect in Parkinson disease patients (helps to restore cholinergic-dopaminergic balance)', 'ankihub_id': '4b2515fc-9c84-4776-ac6d-a0360b39acef'}, {'anki_id': 1485226951657.0, 'document': 'Tolcapone increases dopamine levels in the CNS', 'ankihub_id': '962ec948-36d6-40ed-b1e6-3cc8b0cd6297'}, {'anki_id': 1472782313881.0, 'document': 'Ranolazine may cause QT prolongation on ECG Ranolazine blocks I Kr channels involved in phase 3 (rapid repolarization)', 'ankihub_id': 'cb9bde2e-a64a-43bd-83ca-97be400d718c'}, {'anki_id': 1461767111073.0, 'document': 'Which two anti-emetics can cause torsades de pointes as a possible side effect? Chronic mercury toxicity Sympathetic symptoms: diaphoresis , tachycardia , hypertension , and anxiety - Mercury inactivates COMT , an enzyme responsible for catecholamine breakdown → chronic mercury toxicity mimics pheochromocytoma Neuropsychiatric symptoms: insomnia , tremor , and photophobia - Mercury crosses the BBB and deposits in the cerebral cortex Dermatologic symptoms: diffuse , pruritic rash or desquamating rash on palms/soles is common; hypersensitivity rash (acrodynia) may be seen in children', 'ankihub_id': 'b2d66ab3-696d-4db9-aa85-eb419526d3c6'}, {'anki_id': 1477447115841.0, 'document': 'Cardioselective β-blockers are useful in the acute treatment of MI and other ACS (e.g., unstable, NSTEMI) Cardioselective = β 1 -selective', 'ankihub_id': 'f49976bf-390f-4c30-aa47-a14e8dac75d3'}, {'anki_id': 1472091153400.0, 'document': 'Amiodarone , a class III antiarrhythmic, can cause both hyper- or hypo thyroidism - Am iod arone is 40% iod ine by weight; must check TFTs - Hyperthyroidism will occur in patients with pre-existing thyroid disease who will then receive excess iodine to the thyroid - Hypothyroidism occurs due to a direct toxic effect of the drug - Amiodarone can prevent conversion of T 4 to T 3', 'ankihub_id': '76ccbf5b-2cd6-418e-aef9-d78c1d4e4dbe'}, {'anki_id': 1519869027136.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for a patient that develops fatigue , insomnia , and myalgias after abruptly discontinuing paroxetine due to undesirable side effects? Restart paroxetine and taper gradually over several weeks This patient is experiencing antidepressant discontinuation syndrome , which can result in variable psychological and/or physical symptoms; more common with antidepressants with a shorter half-life (e.g., paroxetine, venlafaxine)', 'ankihub_id': '3583e186-bff6-4fd2-9f6d-15e24164c4d6'}, {'anki_id': 1484950251767.0, 'document': 'Opiate receptor activation causes closure of presynaptic Ca 2+ channels , which decreases release of neurotransmitters e.g., Glutamate , ACh, NE, 5-HT, and substance P - Activation of presynaptic μ receptors causes closure of voltage-gated calcium channels (VGCC), leading to decreased neurotransmitter release - Activation of postsynaptic μ receptors causes the opening of potassium channels, leading to membrane hyperpolarization', 'ankihub_id': 'f35125c6-05b8-4353-9b88-5d78b3b274c5'}, {'anki_id': 1484774548427.0, 'document': 'Suvorexant is contraindicated in patients taking strong CYP3A4 inhibitors', 'ankihub_id': '55c5f264-917c-4e71-ba76-253d9a686d40'}, {'anki_id': 1541344194253.0, 'document': 'What is the pharmacotherapy for tardive dyskinesia ? Psychotherapy (CBT) - Medication can be added if CBT fails - Treatment of adjustment disorder with CBT focuses on developing coping mechanisms and improving the individual's response to and attitude about the stressful situation", 'ankihub_id': '42db3ebf-5562-463c-8d65-632e398b4834'}, {'anki_id': 1472000134782.0, 'document': 'Class I B antiarrhythmics may be used to treat digitalis-induced arrhythmias Phenytoin can shorten the digitalis-induced prolongation of AV node conduction', 'ankihub_id': '7bae0d16-ac04-4eaf-b1e2-48371a0e936c'}, {'anki_id': 1505931728135.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with confusion and blurry vision after overdosing on an unknown medication? Physical examination reveals dry mucous membranes , decreased bowel sounds , and 8 mm pupils bilaterally Anticholinergic toxicity - "Mad as a hatter, blind as a bat, dry as a bone, full as a flask, red as a beet" - May be reversed with physostigmine (cholinesterase inhibitor)', 'ankihub_id': '04a682fe-1f5b-4f8e-b944-8df6569dc794'}, {'anki_id': 1572752026137.0, 'document': 'Citalopram::Specific SSRI is generally avoided in patients with a recent MI due to its potential for dose-dependent QT prolongation - "Avoid MI City " - First-line SSRIs in post-MI treatment are sertraline and escitalopram (due to low potential for drug-reactions)', 'ankihub_id': 'ae08b8ff-a4bd-4097-8783-b965e67d117b'}, {'anki_id': 1475115418560.0, 'document': 'Cholinomimetics cause contraction of bronchial smooth muscle - This may exacerbate asthma or COPD - Cholinomimetics can also exacerbate peptic ulcers in susceptible patients', 'ankihub_id': '443cf2af-5094-4cd1-8f88-5b78825990db'}, {'anki_id': 1485382157192.0, 'document': 'What drug class is used to reverse the effects of neuromuscular junction blockade ? Paroxetine - Parrot pecking the baby; ↑ cardiac malformation and pulmonary hypertension - SSRIs in pregnancy could cause persistent pulmonary hypertension of the newborn (PPHN) and neonatal adaptation syndrome - P aroxetine in P regnancy is Im P rudent', 'ankihub_id': '9e9f0af1-3dff-4db4-8b65-5a7e1d94ed9a'}, {'anki_id': 1477447319676.0, 'document': 'β-blockers may have CNS adverse effects , including seizures, sedation, and sleep alterations', 'ankihub_id': '32154c4f-53e4-4ebf-9ea4-35143198a3a3'}, {'anki_id': 1461598652927.0, 'document': 'Ondansetron can prolong the QT interval and induce torsades de pointes Thus, avoid ondansetron in patients with prolonged QT', 'ankihub_id': '0756cc0e-dfe3-41ca-99d1-c104bc16ff9c'}, {'anki_id': 1509199965189.0, 'document': 'Patients < 25 years old have a slightly increased risk of becoming suicidal when initiating antidepressant treatment Slightly increased risk must be weighed against the benefits of antidepressants', 'ankihub_id': '9859fa41-d266-48fd-882a-5a0046edfea2'}, {'anki_id': 1484774422940.0, 'document': 'Nonbenzodiazepine hypnotics exert their effects via binding to an allosteric site on the GABA A receptor e.g., zolpidem, zaleplon, eszopiclone', 'ankihub_id': 'c80357a8-c6bb-4ce3-ab93-97986a85f47c'}, {'anki_id': 1497563667684.0, 'document': 'What drug class should be avoided in patients with MI that present with acute decompensated HF or bradycardia ? β-blockers MONA B ASH - However, β-blockers are recommended in compensated CHF', 'ankihub_id': '2e08ae0f-dde1-4dd8-9d76-b21248737ff3'}, {'anki_id': 1477433060866.0, 'document': 'Prazosin is a selective α 1 antagonist that may be used to treat post-traumatic stress disorder e.g., nightmares, sleep disturbance', 'ankihub_id': 'e5cebf9b-f733-4b65-8df1-771860bb615c'}, {'anki_id': 1557513437294.0, 'document': 'Triptan and ergot or another triptan = excessive vasoconstriction and HTN/MI/stroke - Overactivation of 5-HT receptors - Dihydroergotamine is the ergot used in migraine treatment. However, it is not frequently used due to its significant side effect profile, including gangrene and vasospastic (Prinzmetal) angina - Bromocriptine is also an ergot derivative. Both come from the ergot fungi. Thus, do not use triptans + an ergot derivative, or two ergot derivatives together. Do not use these drugs in the setting of uncontrolled hypertension either. Hence, this is why non-ergot dopamine agonists (e.g., pramipexole) are preferred in Parkinson disease', 'ankihub_id': '344ffa48-e954-4527-9a9f-49e6b241f319'}, {'anki_id': 1472091171892.0, 'document': 'Amiodarone can cause heart block as a result of its class II antiarrhythmic activity Thus may cause excessive block if combined with other negative chronotropic agents (e.g., β-blockers) Amiodarone has Class I effect: inhibits sodium channels → QRS prolongation Class II effect: beta blocker effect → Decrease HR and PR prolongation Class III effect: Potassium current inhibition → QT prolongation', 'ankihub_id': '7fc11137-76bd-4ba9-9b52-e6c04d3bf3f2'}, {'anki_id': 1485382077657.0, 'document': 'What drug class does edrophonium belong to? Acetylcholinesterase inhibitor', 'ankihub_id': 'fd04babd-af83-4202-a0b1-b3f1193628db'}, {'anki_id': 1485382166758.0, 'document': 'Acetylcholinesterase inhibitors may be used to treat post-operative and neurogenic ileus', 'ankihub_id': 'f3fae40a-6450-434e-bd35-b2b23da6cc48'}, {'anki_id': 1461797760919.0, 'document': 'Simeprevir is a(n) inhibitor of cytochrome P450 and thus may have many drug interactions', 'ankihub_id': 'd8b0e621-3a9d-4c87-8aff-ac5d652537f4'}, {'anki_id': 1485140579000.0, 'document': 'Narcolepsy type 1::Specific is associated with cataplexy , which is the loss of all muscle tone following a strong emotional stimulus (e.g., laughter) - Narcolepsy type 1 does not require cataplexy for a diagnosis; can also be diagnosed with low orexin levels - Narcolepsy type 2 does not have cataplexy or low orexin levels', 'ankihub_id': 'db5394cd-9c4f-4fb1-a041-3b533ee43205'}, {'anki_id': 1484768625035.0, 'document': 'Benzodiazepines may have additive CNS depression effects with alcohol, barbiturates, 1st generation antihistamines, and antipsychotics', 'ankihub_id': '07ea3f08-68e2-4f3d-9a99-767a34cb43b3'}, {'anki_id': 1474503743647.0, 'document': 'Obesity hypoventilation syndrome is a condition in which severely overweight people fail to breathe rapidly or deeply enough - Also known as Pickwickian syndrome - Characterized by increased awake CO 2 with a normal A-a gradient', 'ankihub_id': 'a40d58e0-92e4-41b6-bf67-9b46af7bc7f6'}, {'anki_id': 1477447082664.0, 'document': 'What type of β-blocker is acebutolol ? Selective β 1 partial agonist (cardioselective) - Therefore contraindicated in ischemic heart disease due to partial β1 agonism - Selective β 1 antagonists may be remembered with the mnemonic A-BEAM (atenolol, betaxolol, esmolol, acebutolol, metoprolol)', 'ankihub_id': '12915ff2-7aca-47ad-aee8-21286701932d'}, {'anki_id': 1485042680339.0, 'document': 'Adverse effects of tricyclic antidepressants (TCAs) include respiratory depression and hyperpyrexia Hyperpyrexia is a medical emergency characterized as fever > 41.5 °C (106.7 °F)', 'ankihub_id': '86d07f2c-5342-478b-a631-b4aa0abaf7da'}, {'anki_id': 1482022131650.0, 'document': 'What neurotransmitter mediates relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter in response to swallowing? Non-selective β-blockers', 'ankihub_id': '82cae426-21da-43be-822c-f001a75ac602'}, {'anki_id': 1572585449948.0, 'document': 'Nausea, vomiting, abdominal cramping, diarrhea, and muscle aches characterizes which common withdrawal syndrome ?
