Death most commonly occurs secondary to neurologic impairment (i.e., seizures, aspiration PNA, hydrocephalus) - 1st: Hypopigmented macules (Ash leaf spot), 2nd: Shagreen patch and 3rd: periungual fibroma of tuberous sclerosis Renal angiomyolipoma: ©️ Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': 'cf0aa67f-400d-456b-8bce-54107e2ab86d'}, {'anki_id': 1462206451792.0, 'document': 'One possible treatment for a growth hormone adenoma is a(n) somatostatin analog , such as octreotide Somatostatin suppresses GH release; may also surgically remove the adenoma', 'ankihub_id': 'eef2227d-44de-4c22-9568-03336b2463af'}, {'anki_id': 1462810965063.0, 'document': 'Which two endocrine hormones act to increase bone growth ? MEN 1 MEN 1 : 3 "P"s = Parathyroid, Pancreas , Pituitary gland Type MEN 1 MEN 2A MEN 2B Gene Menin RET RET Chromosome 11 10 10 Principal findings Primary hyperparathyroidism ( adenoma ) Medullary thyroid carcinoma (calcitonin) Medullary thyroid carcinoma (calcitonin) Additional findings Pituitary tumors (Prolactin or GH) Pheochromocytoma Pheochromocytoma Pancreatic tumors (Zollinger-Ellison, insulinomas, VIPomas, glucagonomas) Primary hyperparathyroidism ( hyperplasia ) Mucosal neuroma/Marfanoid habitus', 'ankihub_id': '72ae64ff-d969-4907-93d2-c77ba8c638c6'}, {'anki_id': 1482978510390.0, 'document': 'Which type of gallstone is associated with total parenteral nutrition (TPN)? No', 'ankihub_id': '078dd02f-07ba-46ad-b5a8-601fdaad48ef'}, {'anki_id': 1481048550071.0, 'document': 'The locus coeruleus of the reticular formation is located in the posterior rostral pons and is responsible for synthesis of norepinephrine - Sends projections to most brain areas involved in the control of cortical activation (arousal) - Also involved in control of mood, sleep-wake states, cognition, and autonomic function - Specifically, located near the lateral floor of the fourth ventricle', 'ankihub_id': 'c15795cd-97dc-414e-86e6-e451bb5b5cee'}, {'anki_id': 1509842423348.0, 'document': "Trichomonas vaginalis causes cervicitis described as a(n) ' strawberry cervix '", 'ankihub_id': '5c17160a-b9ff-4048-bbc3-25e9be0d10da'}, {'anki_id': 1482115365440.0, 'document': 'Which hormone provides the major stimulus for bile ejection ? Cholecystokinin (CCK) Via contraction of the gallbladder and relaxation of the sphincter of Oddi', 'ankihub_id': '23ed56e2-5cb6-41ff-9e01-58c3e510e4b7'}, {'anki_id': 1581787804953.0, 'document': 'β-adrenergic antagonists are associated with reduced insulin sensitivity and increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes - Normally, α 1 receptor stimulation causes vasoconstriction, which reduces glucose uptake into skeletal muscles; β 2 receptor stimulation opposes this effect - In the presence of β blockade, α 1 -mediated effects are unopposed, leading to further reduction in glucose uptake, higher levels of circulating glucose, and resultant increased insulin secretion from the pancreas - Insulin resistance is effectively increased (i.e. insulin sensitivity is reduced) - As a result, patients experience weight gain. A reduction in lipolysis in adipocytes (which is largely β 1 receptor-mediated) likely also contributes to weight gain', 'ankihub_id': 'b8952f04-b7e4-44f1-93c3-efc35dfb1b90'}, {'anki_id': 1583977878218.0, 'document': 'Childhood insulin resistance is associated with peripheral::central/peripheral precocious puberty Insulin resistance results in hyperinsulinemia → insulin stimulates androgen production and suppresses SHBG → increased free sex steroids can lead to isolated premature adrenarche or peripheral precocious puberty', 'ankihub_id': '98ed6ad1-c923-4a3a-a2b4-7224daafcc36'}, {'anki_id': 1481418775282.0, 'document': 'Circadian rhythm : The suprachiasmatic nucleus releases norepinephrine , which stimulates the pineal gland to secrete melatonin Darkness causes norepinephrine release onto pinealocytes, resulting in melatonin secretion and increased sleep drive', 'ankihub_id': '379018b3-c0f8-4c34-a954-da9a469a1992'}, {'anki_id': 1474571653671.0, 'document': 'In the brain , histamine may regulate sleep and arousal via its H 1 receptor', 'ankihub_id': 'f061b20e-e0c3-471f-9907-f1cebea438f4'}, {'anki_id': 1671847140277.0, 'document': 'Proton pump inhibitors enhance::enhance/impair fat absorption - Useful in patients taking pancreatic enzyme replacement; exogenously-administered pancreatic lipase is normally inactivated by low pH → PPIs prevent this by reducing gastric acid secretion - Contrast with impaired absorption of divalent cations (calcium, iron, magnesium) and vitamin B12', 'ankihub_id': 'f01f4b42-3ced-45a0-a80b-9be5db1e84ef'}, {'anki_id': 1480876173338.0, 'document': 'The spinothalamic tract is accompanied by the hypothalamospinal tract throughout the brainstem Thus lesioned together in a lateral brainstem lesion', 'ankihub_id': '17f52500-03ed-4032-9162-50df6bb58dbe'}, {'anki_id': 1482022027494.0, 'document': 'Vasoactive intestinal polypeptide (VIP) is secreted from parasympathetic neurons in the gallbladder, small intestine, and sphincters', 'ankihub_id': '775de7f2-edce-4284-9236-4083fe999532'}, {'anki_id': 1483845104394.0, 'document': 'Lesion of the reticular activating system (RAS) ::midbrain results in reduced levels of arousal and wakefulness (i.e., coma ) Watch associated Bootcamp video - Midbrain, Pons, and Medulla', 'ankihub_id': '0a033a2e-83cc-4965-ac8c-0fb820f4c53c'}, {'anki_id': 1517407921808.0, 'document': 'Which nucleus of the hypothalamus is responsible for both thermoregulation and sexual behavior ? Preoptic nucleus Responsible for the sexual urges part of TAN HAT S', 'ankihub_id': 'be7070ed-b695-42dd-a19e-3246de562660'}, {'anki_id': 1461880451899.0, 'document': 'Prolactin secretion is tonically inhibited by dopamine Dopamine is also known as prolactin inhibiting factor (PIF)', 'ankihub_id': 'aa678019-234c-433f-a436-c42a2a53b9ef'}, {'anki_id': 1461875813135.0, 'document': 'The largest secretory burst of growth hormone occurs within 1 hour of falling asleep', 'ankihub_id': '6e538708-4ad2-4726-9ddd-8469529af7cb'}, {'anki_id': 1461878128995.0, 'document': 'After ::Before/After puberty, excessive levels of growth hormone cause increased periosteal bone growth, increased organ size, glucose intolerance, and coarsening of facial features', 'ankihub_id': '48cd147a-f173-41e1-9667-cc7f9822b963'}, {'anki_id': 1510262005893.0, 'document': 'What can be used in H. pylori triple therapy for those with a penicillin allergy ? Metronidazole - Triple therapy normally is a PPI, amoxicillin, and clarithromycin - If you substitute metronidazole for amoxicillin you still use a PPI and clarithromycin as usual - If the H. pylori strain is clarithromycin resistant, proceed to quadruple therapy (typically guided by local area resistance patterns)', 'ankihub_id': '23b42846-3296-4040-a259-d67d6757d23b'}, {'anki_id': 1471541725222.0, 'document': 'What is the major factor determining autoregulation of blood flow to the exercising skeletal muscle ? Local metabolites Local metabolites may be remembered with the mnemonic CHALK : C O 2 , H + , A denosine, L actate, K + While sympathetic innervation is the major factor determining autoregulation of blood flow to the resting skeletal muscle', 'ankihub_id': 'c52363cc-5b9c-4b07-86ed-7f4f4d949ac0'}, {'anki_id': 1476661061176.0, 'document': 'Non-heme (Fe 3+ ) iron (vegetable-derived) must be converted to Fe 2+ in the duodenum / proximal jejunum by cytochrome B and/or vitamin C for absorption However, reduction from Fe 3+ to Fe 2+ occurs in the stomach as well (via low pH and vitamin C)', 'ankihub_id': 'adff6fd1-c523-4ffe-bdbd-eef3191d9ad3'}, {'anki_id': 1584134939832.0, 'document': 'Excess glucose and free fatty acids (FFAs) may contribute to β cell dysfunction - Via accumulation in β cells and cytokine release - Leads to insulin resistance in obesity', 'ankihub_id': 'a876cf1c-b851-4364-a843-a895e19bd766'}, {'anki_id': 1584562227120.0, 'document': 'Muscle loss , truncal obesity , and osteoporosis are clinical manifestations of growth hormone deficiency in adults', 'ankihub_id': '174bd9a4-3d25-47fb-911c-4f6fbe26838a'}]

[{'anki_id': 1522424264465, 'document': 'Triazolam and midazolam are benzodiazepines that have short half lives Duration of action of common benzodiazepines Short (half-life < 6 hrs) Triazolam, midazolam Intermediate (half-life 6-50 hrs) Oxazepam, alprazolam, lorazepam, clonazepam Long (half-life >50 hrs) Diazepam, chlordiazepoxide, flurazepam', 'ankihub_id': '58f7fcfe-c71a-4932-8847-d843ff742c65'}, {'anki_id': 1484768571600, 'document': 'Benzodiazepines may be used to treat generalized anxiety disorder and panic disorder , though SSRIs and SNRIs are first-line Benzodiazepines can be used temporarily to treat anxiety while waiting for SSRIs/SNRIs take effect', 'ankihub_id': '1669356a-74a3-4811-9f02-e012baf539ab'}, {'anki_id': 1484768430296, 'document': 'Benzodiazepines exert their effects via binding to an allosteric site on the GABA A receptor', 'ankihub_id': 'da660a47-f487-4b0f-9329-7e32420eeac6'}, {'anki_id': 1522424066052, 'document': 'Alprazolam , lorazepam , temazepam , and oxazepam are benzodiazepines that have intermediate half-lives - ALT-M(edium) - *Some sources classify alprazolam and oxazepam as short-acting (Jun 2023) Duration of action of common benzodiazepines Short (half-life < 6 hrs) Triazolam, midazolam Intermediate (half-life 6-50 hrs) Oxazepam, alprazolam, lorazepam, clonazepam Long (half-life >50 hrs) Diazepam, chlordiazepoxide, flurazepam', 'ankihub_id': '4b583de1-2d62-46e1-a76e-b617a06e9e4b'}, {'anki_id': 1484768625035, 'document': 'Benzodiazepines may have additive CNS depression effects with alcohol, barbiturates, 1st generation antihistamines, and antipsychotics', 'ankihub_id': '07ea3f08-68e2-4f3d-9a99-767a34cb43b3'}, {'anki_id': 1522424293535, 'document': 'Diazepam , chlordiazepoxide , and flurazepam are benzodiazepines that have long half-lives - e.g., sedation, drowsiness - Additive with other CNS depressants (commonly alcohol)', 'ankihub_id': 'c76ea9cd-77b1-4a1c-8976-dd0001d69ed9'}, {'anki_id': 1484768461819, 'document': 'The GABA A receptor is a ligand-gated Cl - channel', 'ankihub_id': '9e15f78e-a8be-452a-a809-011d83cc21a8'}, {'anki_id': 1484768639954, 'document': 'The benzodiazepines that are safe to use in patients with liver disease may be remembered with the mnemonic LOT L orazepam O xazepam T emazepam - Benzodiazepines are metabolized in the liver and then excreted in the urine - Most benzodiazepines are metabolized via CYP-mediated hepatic oxidative reduction (phase I) followed by glucuronide conjugation (phase II) - However, certain benzodiazepines (lorazepam, oxazepam, temazepam) undergo only glucuronide conjugation, which tends to be relatively preserved in the elderly and those with liver disease', 'ankihub_id': '17cc2b96-9b04-495f-94c5-5062ffb282bb'}, {'anki_id': 1484768639953, 'document': 'The benzodiazepines that are safe to use in patients with liver disease may be remembered with the mnemonic " LOT ": L orazepam:: L O xazepam:: O T emazepam:: T - Benzodiazepines are metabolized in the liver and then excreted in the urine - Most benzodiazepines are metabolized via CYP-mediated hepatic oxidative reduction (phase I) followed by glucuronide conjugation (phase II) - However, certain benzodiazepines (lorazepam, oxazepam, temazepam) undergo only glucuronide conjugation, which tends to be relatively preserved in the elderly and those with liver disease', 'ankihub_id': '8af338ff-a4ab-43c4-8fcb-716a43329a0b'}, {'anki_id': 1484768396948, 'document': 'The higher addictive potential benzodiazepines may be remembered with the mnemonic ATOM A lprazolam* T riazolam O xazepam* M idazolam - These short acting benzodiazepines are more addictive - Thus these do NOT get metabolized by the liver into active metabolites *Alprazolam and oxazepam are technically intermediate-acting agents - A TOM = A ddictive', 'ankihub_id': 'bf5da9cc-5718-42a7-8e09-7aa5d646b2c4'}, {'anki_id': 1484768435794, 'document': 'Benzodiazepines enhance ::enhance or inhibit the action of GABA A By increasing the frequency of chloride channel opening', 'ankihub_id': 'f2efc110-29d5-404e-8ac3-748bb1b68cc0'}, {'anki_id': 1519790798022, 'document': 'Nonbenzodiazepine hypnotics work by decreasing sleep latency High affinity for BZ1 receptor (more than benzodiazepines); have less effect on sleep cycle than benzos', 'ankihub_id': '73c4ca0a-04fe-48e1-b9e3-37f0022ae618'}, {'anki_id': 1484774422940, 'document': 'Nonbenzodiazepine hypnotics exert their effects via binding to an allosteric site on the GABA A receptor e.g., zolpidem, zaleplon, eszopiclone', 'ankihub_id': 'c80357a8-c6bb-4ce3-ab93-97986a85f47c'}, {'anki_id': 1484778145187, 'document': 'Barbiturates exert their effects via binding to an allosteric site on the GABA A receptor', 'ankihub_id': 'f1aa979a-aa7c-4a30-8da1-6ab806ff0b18'}, {'anki_id': 1484768396947, 'document': 'The benzodiazapenes with higher addictive potential may be remembered with the mnemonic " ATOM ": A lprazolam*:: A T riazolam:: T O xazepam*:: O M idazolam:: M - These short acting benzodiazepines are more addictive - Thus these do NOT get metabolized by the liver into active metabolites *Alprazolam and Oxazepam are technically intermediate-acting agents', 'ankihub_id': 'bd12f68b-8044-432f-9168-23bfa915f5fb'}, {'anki_id': 1528757961792, 'document': 'Benzodiazepine overdose leads to CNS depression , causing lethargy , somnolence , and hyporeflexia Usually seen in patients who are on chronic benzodiazepine therapy', 'ankihub_id': '15967e73-3e80-475a-9369-d60eeff7e113'}, {'anki_id': 1484774475310, 'document': 'Nonbenzodiazepine hypnotics should not be combined with other CNS depressants e.g., alcohol, benzodiazepines, barbiturates, first generation antihistamines', 'ankihub_id': '5870fbb0-022e-4a96-9663-eb53867f5b11'}, {'anki_id': 1484768528915, 'document': 'Long-acting benzodiazepines are useful in the treatment of alcohol withdrawal (if no cirrhosis or alcoholic hepatitis) e.g., chlordiazepoxide, diazepam - L orazepam, O xazepam, and T emazepam → "preferred for individuals who drink a LOT "', 'ankihub_id': 'c4d085eb-8078-4951-aed5-c25b98b8392a'}, {'anki_id': 1484774431076, 'document': 'The nonbenzodiazepine hypnotics bind to the same GABA A receptor allosteric site as benzodiazepines (BZ1 subtype) e.g., zolpidem, zaleplon, eszopiclone', 'ankihub_id': 'abe05cf9-09e5-43a5-a364-b4d15d892457'}, {'anki_id': 1484768472408, 'document': 'Benzodiazepines , barbiturates , and alcohol all bind different allosteric sites of the GABA A receptor', 'ankihub_id': 'a01a3c99-3442-4c14-bb64-098f01ea7255'}, {'anki_id': 1528226356630, 'document': "Long-acting benzodiazepines (e.g., diazepam, chlordiazepoxide) can be used to treat alcohol and benzodiazepine withdrawal What is the choice in a patient with hepatic disease (e.g., chronic alcohol use disorder) or in inpatient setting ? Insomnia Other pharmacologic treatment options: non-benzodiazepine hypnotics, antidepressants', 'ankihub_id': 'b4692538-ff19-4dfb-a3b6-002a7e6a7702'}, {'anki_id': 1484768567591, 'document': 'Benzodiazepines may be used to treat spasticity caused by UMN disorders (e.g., MS, stroke, spinal cord trauma, tetanus)', 'ankihub_id': '048a6139-6553-4a49-b189-4cf8c7168d1a'}, {'anki_id': 1527554535842, 'document': 'What is the most likely explanation for a patient who stopped taking fluoxetine and lorazepam yesterday after 2 years of continuous therapy and now complains of insomnia , dysphoria , irritability , and anxiety ? Benzodiazepine withdrawal - Abrupt discontinuation of benzos can result in life-threatening withdrawal syndrome and cause early rebound effects of insomnia and anxiety and it can be hard to differentiate between the return of the anxiety disorder; also increases risk for seizures - Lorazepam withdrawal → may produce symptoms within 1-2 days - Fluoxetine withdrawal → 4-6 days (longer half-life)', 'ankihub_id': '210509d5-6e82-4af4-85eb-1653c48aad6a'}, {'anki_id': 1484768601168, 'document': 'Do benzodiazepines have addictive potential ? Trauma-focused CBT ± SSRIs / SNRIs - Trauma-focused CBT is commonly first-line treatment, although other forms of psychotherapy (e.g., eye movement desensitization and reprocessing ( EMDR ), interpersonal therapy, mindfulness-based stress reduction) may also be used - CBT helps the patient emotionally process the trauma and recognize and correct maladaptive thought patterns while also targeting avoidance behaviors with exposure techniques (eg, in vivo or imaginal exposure) - Pharmacotherapy alone is used in patients with PTSD who opt out of or do not have access to CBT - Add prazosin for nightmares', 'ankihub_id': 'bd077175-557f-4774-82e2-0af1d4066211'}, {'anki_id': 1579534219611, 'document': 'Opioids and other CNS depressants can cause rhabdomyolysis by inducing impaired consciousness with prolonged immobilization and ischemic compression - Occurs in dependent areas of skeletal muscle (e.g., mottled skin over back) - e.g., ethanol, benzodiazepines', 'ankihub_id': '76370b2d-fdc1-420a-a49e-97e90f81bb40'}, {'anki_id': 1659398781520, 'document': 'Persistent unresponsiveness after pharmacological treatment of status epilepticus may be due to either: Sedation due to effects of benzodiazepines or nonconvulsive status epilepticus Differentiate using EEG Watch Pediatric Seizure DDx', 'ankihub_id': '2568a5fb-f9e1-4863-ac30-050a197525e3'}, {'anki_id': 1541614757846, 'document': 'Atypical antipsychotic with sedative / orthostatic effects? Reverse is also true (i.e., must wait 2 weeks after stopping SSRIs or other serotonergic drugs before starting MAO inhibitors, and fluoxetine requires 5 weeks due to its long half-life) - Phenelzine irreversibly inhibits both MAO A and B, resulting in increased presynaptic concentration and release of MAO neurotransmitters - It takes up to two weeks to regulate MAO synthesis to appropriate levels for normal degradation, avoiding the risk of SSRI-induced serotonin syndrome', 'ankihub_id': '7bdaaf36-d0f5-4b6e-a6e9-2a5736691a42'}, {'anki_id': 1502344277221, 'document': 'Pregabalin is a gabapentinoid that works by binding the α2δ subunit of N-type voltage gated calcium channels - Non-depolarizing agents (e.g., vecuronium, rocuronium) Competition with ACh Mechanism : 1- Competitive binding of a nondepolarizing muscle relaxant to the acetylcholine receptor 2- Acetylcholine binding is prevented 3- Receptor channel for ions doesn't open The elimination of the nondepolarizing muscle relaxant via the blood and lymph signals the end of the effect following the temporal latency period. Cocaine = sympathomimetic = vasoconstriction; don't want unopposed α constriction of coronary vessels - Cocaine prevents the reuptake of serotonin, dopamine, and norepinephrine having many adrenergic agonist effects - Vessels expresses α 1 and β 2 receptors and as norepinephrine has an affinity α > β cocaine causes hypertension - By giving β blockers, vasodilatory effect of β 2 agonists is inhibited on the vessels thus leaving unopposed α 1 agonism → vasoconstriction → HTN urgency/emergency", 'ankihub_id': '2bcccbeb-ecbf-4dbe-aed6-f93aa5eb9d64'}, {'anki_id': 1573172942959, 'document': 'In a patient with acute psychosis and escalating agitation , olanzapine would be the next step in management because it can be administered IM and has a(n) rapid onset of action Olanzapine > clozapine since clozapine requires mandatory monitoring of CBC', 'ankihub_id': '8c7828a2-3eef-44bf-8f65-b67130553f60'}, {'anki_id': 1490066198198, 'document': 'In first-order kinetics , a drug infused at a constant rate takes 4 - 5 half-lives to reach steady state It takes 3.3 half-lives to reach 90% of the steady-state level', 'ankihub_id': '7ff710f2-02ad-4f40-839f-b828d93f4714'}, {'anki_id': 1479430475147, 'document': 'Astrocytes are glial cells that are capable of removing excess neurotransmitters - Reuptake and metabolize glutamate and GABA - Astrocytes use NH 3 and glutamate to make glutamine (which is then shuttled to neurons who convert it back to glutamate for neurotransmission) - In hyperammonemia , astrocytes get fed too much NH 3 , and thus they make too much glutamine which causes the astrocytes to swell and become dysfunctional ( depleting glutamate stores ) - Thus GABA is not metabolized and there is an excess of GABA in the CNS (energy supply to other brain cells is decreased) - This results in impaired excitatory neurotransmitter release', 'ankihub_id': 'c4418b25-c90b-42d6-b92f-3588358c0472'}, {'anki_id': 1477089822695, 'document': 'Stimulants (e.g., amphetamine, methylphenidate) may suppress appetite Can be taken after a meal', 'ankihub_id': 'd2a51d02-ba38-4817-bf23-d813e9f93412'}, {'anki_id': 1461599476879, 'document': 'Diphenhydramine and meclizine (1st generation H 1 receptor blockers) may cause significant sedation and have significant anti- muscarinic properties', 'ankihub_id': '6cd1939c-154e-422e-8ded-41af1c7cfc5f'}, {'anki_id': 1484879734307, 'document': 'Inhaled anesthetics can cause myocardial depression::stimulation or depression Decreased cardiac output and hypotension', 'ankihub_id': '4ea71ae0-358a-4305-8dd7-fbbfbbf2a934'}, {'anki_id': 1475114980575, 'document': 'What G-protein is the M 2 muscarinic receptor coupled to? input:
Shape: Single, circular, double-stranded, and supercoiled (like a twisted rubber band). 

Supercoiling Enzyme: DNA gyrase – Targeted by Quinolones (antibiotics). 

Location: Attached to the inner membrane (not free-floating) 

No histones or nuclear membrane → enables fast replication (e.g., E. coli: ~20 min; C. perfringens: ~10-12 min). 

Transcription and translation occur simultaneously → increases replication speed. 

Ribosomes: 70S (50S + 30S) → targeted by aminoglycosides, tetracyclines, chloramphenicol, macrolides (erythromycin)
output: [{'anki_id': 1508430090586.0, 'document': 'Which two enzymes are inhibited by fluoroquinolones ? DNA topoisomerase II ( Prokaryotic DNA gyrase), DNA topoisomerase IV - "II, IV, hit the fluor " ( fluor oquinolone antibiotics) - Inhibit DNA replication, therefore are bacteri cidal - Topoisomerase II introduces negative supercoils and opens DNA to expose DNA to replication enzymes - Topoisomerase IV prevents sister chromatid from getting twisted and recombined', 'ankihub_id': '23df91e4-a1dd-4e71-a6f0-7b7574393dee'}, {'anki_id': 1467771810893.0, 'document': 'What is another name for prokaryotic topoisomerase II? Topoisomerases', 'ankihub_id': 'd97ab362-b3f8-42af-b2e5-b69eb10add08'}, {'anki_id': 1502065388242.0, 'document': 'DNA viral genomes can either be circular or linear and are usually double-stranded dsDNA', 'ankihub_id': '7aad0213-bd62-4c79-b0d8-2169be7fe496'}, {'anki_id': 1467771801123.0, 'document': 'Which enzyme is responsible for relaxing the DNA strand by creating single- or double-stranded breaks in the DNA helix to add/remove supercoils? Aminoglycosides - Aminoglycosides bind 30S irreversibly and prevent initiation complex formation - Tetracyclines bind the 30S to prevent aminoacyl tRNA attachment - 30S + 50S = 70S in prokaryotes - " Buy a t 30 ccel at 50"', 'ankihub_id': '9002e530-bbfe-4c8e-bc7b-4b15820fc73a'}, {'anki_id': 1516850294247.0, 'document': 'Polyomaviruses have circular ::circular/linear DNA genomes', 'ankihub_id': 'de90f360-003a-47c5-b28e-eeb54c4da7a8'}, {'anki_id': 1467771762899.0, 'document': 'The origin of replication is a particular consensus sequence of base pairs in a genome where DNA replication begins May be single (prokaryotes) or multiple (eukaryotes)', 'ankihub_id': 'b920d053-7f77-4713-bfa9-b61abb7a55b5'}, {'anki_id': 1506551550710.0, 'document': 'Hepatitis B virus is partially double-stranded - Becomes fully double-stranded during replication (see below) - HBV DNA polymerase has DNA & RNA-dependent activities 1. Circular', 'ankihub_id': '5be0158b-c1ed-4f3d-aa54-111974dd1420'}, {'anki_id': 1468090131838.0, 'document': "In addition to GTP, translocation of the ribosome during translation also requires eukaryotic elongation factor 2 (eEF-2)::specific - Pseudomonas exotoxin A and diphtheria toxin act via inhibition of eukaryotic elongation factor 2 via ADP ribosylation - Translocation occurs when ribosome advances 3 nucleotides towards 3' end, moving the peptidyl tRNA to the P site (A site is now empty)", 'ankihub_id': '25b4b3ee-b15b-408c-a09c-77af07e54862'}, {'anki_id': 1496162245188.0, 'document': 'Once hyperphosphorylated, Rb releases the E2F transcription factor which initiates the S phase E2F upregulates: - Cyclin A and cyclin E → helps push through the cell cycle - PCNA → speeds DNA replication and repair by helping attach DNA pol to template DNA - Nucleotide synthesis enzymes (thymidine kinase, DHFR, thymidylate synthase) - DNA polymerase alpha / delta', 'ankihub_id': '030119d9-6571-4c98-a92a-ac04137dcddd'}, {'anki_id': 1467833332774.0, 'document': 'The template strand is the dsDNA strand used for transcription; S 3 ::S 3 /S 4 - S3 - The sound that emanates from the heart when it is overwhelmed and struggling to accommodate the excessive volume of blood within the ventricle. The left ventricle can be likened to a teapot reaching its boiling point, resulting in a distinct sound occurring shortly after the second heart sound, marking the beginning of the relaxation phase (diastole). - S4 - It can be described as the sound produced by the left atrium when it is exerting significant effort to expel its contents. This occurs when the left ventricle is not sufficiently compliant and experiences elevated pressure during the filling phase. In simpler terms, it's comparable to the strain one feels when attempting to have a bowel movement.", 'ankihub_id': '0d05047a-74ed-4d5a-87ef-90ee37095d98'}, {'anki_id': 1506280240661.0, 'document': 'What is the shape of Borrelia burgdorferi ? Chloramphenicol', 'ankihub_id': '1748317e-ee1c-4ecf-a3a9-ef24acadc247'}, {'anki_id': 1474253815146.0, 'document': 'Pompe disease is caused by a deficiency of the enzyme lysosomal α-1,4-glucosidase (acid maltase) \' P om P e trashes the P um P \' ("P\'s" in the 1 st and 4 th letters to remember the "1,4" in the enzyme name)', 'ankihub_id': '9d0a0999-28d9-45be-833c-0e3953233f83'}, {'anki_id': 1505263570928.0, 'document': 'Monobactams bind to penicillin-binding protein transpeptidases - e.g., aztreonam - Are β-lactams!!! - Mimic the D-ala-D-ala sequence of peptidoglycan', 'ankihub_id': 'b7f330b6-2671-4366-af01-bf152e003651'}, {'anki_id': 1508429879304.0, 'document': 'Fluoroquinolones are indicated mostly for gram negative infections - Gram negative rods of the urinary and GI tract (including Pseudomonas ) - Some gram positive activity ( Bacillus anthracis , Strep pneumo )', 'ankihub_id': 'e420ad15-4bb1-460d-90d5-6a3839e180d2'}, {'anki_id': 1510191392218.0, 'document': 'Campylobacter jejuni , Vibrio cholerae, and Helicobacter pylori are all curved rods that are oxidase positive', 'ankihub_id': '637e2fcc-a45a-4e4a-9b99-f1d36b8e6ebb'}, {'anki_id': 1608909487566.0, 'document': 'After translation , the S , M , and E proteins of coronavirus are transported to the Golgi apparatus::what organelle? The N protein forms the nucleocapsid in the cytoplasm! (i.e., does not go to the Golgi)', 'ankihub_id': '62afcaa4-f179-46e7-b9fe-77ab281ec428'}, {'anki_id': 1501984223104.0, 'document': 'Cells infected with Chlamydia spp. will show cytoplasmic inclusion/reticulate bodies under microscope', 'ankihub_id': '01b9d808-fff7-4fe9-ae2b-6c45f78d9d2b'}, {'anki_id': 1500752837278.0, 'document': 'Gram negative algorithm: Bacilli who are not lactose fermenters and are oxidase negative, H 2 S production on TSI agar negative - Shigella , Yersinia TSI agar:', 'ankihub_id': '817c2f76-f0b0-41c5-8153-f6eedc5d0695'}]

input: 2. A 10-year-old boy who was adopted from the Democratic Republic of Congo 2 weeks ago is brought to the physician for an initial examination. He appears slim, has thin extremities, and is in no distress. His temperature is 37.3°C (99.1 °F), pulse is 100/min, respirations are 20/min, and blood pressure is 118/68 mm Hg. The lungs are clear, and heart sounds are normal. The abdomen is soft and nontender, and there is no hepatosplenomegaly. There are four 0.5-mm, firm, nontender nodules: two over the right iliac crest, one on the left thigh, and one on the left knee. Examination of a skin snip from one of the nodules shows microfilariae. Which of the following is the most likely vector of this patient's infection? \\nA) Blackfly\\nB) Body louse\\nC) Culex species mosquito \\nD) Ixodes species tick\\nE) Reduviid bug
output: [{'anki_id': 1504652342629.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with recent travel to a (sub)tropical region that presents with fever , polyarthralgias , and a diffuse maculopapular skin rash ? Laboratory exam reveals leukopenia and thrombocytopenia Chikungunya fever - Due to the Aedes mosquito; presentation is very similar to Dengue fever, however Dengue fever has more pronounced bone pain (breakbone fever) and the second infection is more severe than the first - Commonly seen in Asia (e.g., India), Africa, South America, and the Pacific and Caribbean islands', 'ankihub_id': '698323bc-adc5-40f2-8bd1-32ab2f4d66a7'}, {'anki_id': 1499975518179.0, 'document': 'Systemic (disseminated) infections of coccidioidomycosis are treated with amphotericin B', 'ankihub_id': '813e5bc6-65f0-4b6e-b939-56972ffadd71'}, {'anki_id': 1555460580898.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient from the southeastern US who presents with flu-like symptoms without a rash after being bitten by a tick two weeks ago? Laboratory exam reveals leukopenia , thrombocytopenia , and elevated LFTs Ehrlichiosis - Carried by ticks, especially the lone star tick ( Amblyomma americanum ), in the southeastern and south-central United States - Diffuse, maculopapular rash is uncommon (< 30% of adults) - Anaplasmosis has virtually identical presentation, but is endemic to the midwest/northeastern US - Babesiosis would have leukocytosis, thrombocytopenia, and hemolytic anemia', 'ankihub_id': 'f472fb6b-918b-4dad-bc3f-e29f8c3f02f6'}, {'anki_id': 1556472680754.0, 'document': 'Bruising, petechiae, bleeding, non -tender lymphadenopathy, and hepatosplenomegaly in a child is suggestive of acute lymphoblastic leukemia::diagnosis - Hepatosplenomegaly due to leukemic invasion of the spleen/liver - Impaired platelet production due to invasion of the bone marrow', 'ankihub_id': '4ee27373-5b56-470a-9100-34fd5be4bae6'}, {'anki_id': 1506275062633.0, 'document': 'What is the vector for endemic typhus ( Rickettsia typhi )? Fleas', 'ankihub_id': 'cb2179c4-0044-4bdb-8cf0-bc19506eaca3'}, {'anki_id': 1509918968308.0, 'document': 'After maturation in the abdomen, the helminth Dracunculus medinensis migrates to the skin , inducing a painful ulcer This papule commonly occurs in the lower distal extremities Dead calcified worms in the skin seen below:', 'ankihub_id': 'de7a2af2-1336-4838-bb78-20666cc1cbbe'}, {'anki_id': 1552733743729.0, 'document': '"Breakbone fever" (muscle pain / fever), retroorbital pain, and hemorrhage (skin / nose) = dengue fever transmitted by the Aedes aegypti mosquito::vector - Same vector as Chikungunya (this presents with polyarthralgias , as well) - Other clinical features secondary to increased vascular permeability → pulmonary edema, hemoconcentration (increased HCT), end-organ damage (liver and renal failure)', 'ankihub_id': '3274cd32-0d69-4eeb-a7c4-12d9b3a6f591'}, {'anki_id': 1555800776497.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an immunocompromised patient with fever , pleuritic chest pain , hemoptysis and pulmonary nodules with ground-glass opacities ( halo sign ) on CT? Invasive aspergillosis - Especially in those with immunosuppression (steroids, HIV) - Pulmonary nodules with ground glass opacities = "halo sign" - imagine a halo around the aspergillus scarecrow. - Confirmed with biopsy', 'ankihub_id': '8866fc98-c6cc-4007-b648-46210a34b1f2'}, {'anki_id': 1509919991343.0, 'document': 'Microfilariae seen in skin biopsy under microscope is diagnostic of Onchocerca volvulus', 'ankihub_id': '4148d49f-f850-434e-8f36-6ca66a07e982'}, {'anki_id': 1504049626559.0, 'document': 'What is the likely causative microorganism in a renal transplant patient that develops fever , progressive dyspnea on exertion , abdominal pain , bloody diarrhea , and elevated LFTs ? Cytomegalovirus - Lung, liver, gut - Solid organ transplant patients that develop systemic illness involving multiple organ systems (e.g., pneumonitis, gastroenteritis, hepatitis) likely have CMV - vs. PCP, which presents primarily with pulmonary symptoms', 'ankihub_id': '78d55d40-0e29-4273-8bb3-1ef81d4cfd0c'}, {'anki_id': 1504648315246.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an Army officer in Arizona that presents with pleuritic chest pain , fever , arthralgias , and erythematous , tender nodules on the bilateral shins? CXR shows a right lower lobe infiltrate. Coccidioides immitis infection Causes community-acquired pneumonia symptoms , often with arthralgias and erythema nodosum ; endemic to Southwestern U.S.', 'ankihub_id': 'd0be4e9b-cf69-4966-8540-68c8447f7eeb'}, {'anki_id': 1669508742638.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an immunocompromised patient who presents with several months of pleuritic chest pain , cough, and fever ? No improvement with antibiotics & CXR shows lobar infiltrate Progressive primary tuberculosis - Approximately 5-10% of patients first exposed to TB develop symptomatic primary disease - CXR may show ipsilateral hilar lymphadenopathy and (sometimes) pleural effusion, but NOT classic upper lobe cavitation that is seen in patients with secondary TB - Should be suspicious of primary progression in patients with impaired immunity (e.g., diabetes mellitus, renal disease, HIV) & those in classic high-risk settings (homelesseness, nursing homes), especially if other treatment has failed', 'ankihub_id': '662bb306-cb9a-436b-8a81-0734440ddc03'}, {'anki_id': 1503861910369.0, 'document': 'Esophagitis with "punched-out" ulcerations is characteristic of HSV-1 - Multiple and shallow; AKA “volcano-like” - Contrast with CMV where ulcerations are linear Donald E. Mansell, MD , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': '764d094b-cb70-42df-bd6d-6c970eeafd2c'}, {'anki_id': 1517080329879.0, 'document': 'Malaria should be suspected in ill patients who have traveled to endemic regions , especially those with cyclic fevers Babesiosis has similar presentation but seen in NE and Midwest U.S.', 'ankihub_id': '4174085d-2ddc-489f-a291-f98e06fba051'}, {'anki_id': 1509841668420.0, 'document': 'Leishmania donovani presents as visceral leishmaniasis , also known as kala-azar (black fever) Due to the characteristic skin hyperpigmentation', 'ankihub_id': 'f89bd2ad-23cb-4039-8561-3c048b04b592'}, {'anki_id': 1509813815925.0, 'document': 'The vector for transmission of Trypanosoma brucei is a(n) tsetse fly - Tsetse fly has a painful bite - Trypanosoma brucei causes human African trypanosomiasis AKA sleeping sickness - T. brucei has two subspecies T. gambiense found in west or central Africa causes chronic vs T. rhodesiense found in south or east Africa cause acute. Both are fatal if untreated', 'ankihub_id': '150bd1ca-16e0-4694-8fee-56c9d955f839'}, {'anki_id': 1557224097510.0, 'document': 'What is the most common cause of osteomyelitis in the following populations: General: Staph aureus Foot puncture: Pseudomonas Sickle cell: Salmonella > Staph aureus Diabetes mellitus: Polymicrobial (cover Pseudomonas ) Oyster / liver disease: Vibrio vulnificus - Staph always #1 - Warm environment of the shoe facilitates Pseudomonas in a foot puncture - Think about IVDU as a "puncture" - Vibrio vulnificus from eating seafood or wound contamination by marine environments; ↑ infection risk in liver disease (e.g., cirrhosis, hepatitis, hemochromatosis) Per AMBOSS, in patients with sickle cell disease, Salmonella is most common cause of osteomyelitis in US and Europe. Staph is most common cause in Africa and the Middle East.', 'ankihub_id': 'fe1c44d4-88a3-47a9-896e-cdb0e744cccc'}, {'anki_id': 1482191403303.0, 'document': 'Oral candidiasis and hairy leukoplakia are usually seen in immunocompromised individuals e.g., HIV+ patients, organ transplant recipients the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously (© AnkiHub, LLC)', 'ankihub_id': '9e1fe1c0-e838-40cb-90a3-261ac12dfa2a'}, {'anki_id': 1500245993331.0, 'document': 'Treatment of Cryptococcal meningitis consists of a joint therapy of amphotericin B and flucytosine followed by maintenance therapy with fluconazole', 'ankihub_id': '79776742-5cb8-478a-b778-635d5f8f5c98'}, {'anki_id': 1496494837220.0, 'document': 'An infant with a fever , runny nose , and cough has the X-ray findings below. What does the arrow on the CXR point to? Thymus A large thymic silhouette is a normal finding on frontal CXR in children < 3 years', 'ankihub_id': '1fc8877d-3806-4340-8c5c-a7267b0ef3bd'}, {'anki_id': 1509842081155.0, 'document': 'Which form of Leishmaniasis can present with fever , pancytopenia , and hepatosplenomegaly ? Visceral leishmaniasis ( L. donovani ) Visceral leishmaniasis presents as: - Intermittent/spiking fever - Pancytopenia : anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia (patients can die from hemorrhage) - Splenomegaly with or without hepatomegaly (spleen can become bigger than the liver) - Kala-azar (black fever) presents as skin hyperpigmentation in fair-skinned individuals', 'ankihub_id': '158e3621-0bac-4511-b8f8-18ed6571fbd3'}, {'anki_id': 1544446066089.0, 'document': 'Palpable subcutaneous lesion > 1 cm = nodule::lesion type', 'ankihub_id': 'd6b41215-c202-4cc6-8af6-aef40dcc930d'}, {'anki_id': 1557250235826.0, 'document': "Smoker with constant, progressive back pain worse at night / supine and weight loss is suggestive of pancreatic cancer (body / tail)::diagnosis - This is referred thoracic pain via the splanchnic nerves - X-rays won't show anything since it's referred pain - Different than cancer of the pancreatic head (jaundice, epigastric pain)", 'ankihub_id': 'c8fd576b-07ec-467a-ad95-0c8ad41a00a2'}, {'anki_id': 1476416068006.0, 'document': 'Active tetrahydrofolate is used in the synthesis of purines and thymidine , which may then be used for DNA and RNA synthesis Critical for cell division', 'ankihub_id': 'be3bfbf9-4606-4fc0-a8c4-f095f956b838'}, {'anki_id': 1509842031182.0, 'document': "Visceral leishmaniasis can present with hepatosplenomegaly ::visceral complication Hence why it is known as 'visceral' leishmaniasis Visceral leishmaniasis presents as: - Intermittent/spiking fever (secondary to anemia) - Pancytopenia : anemia, leukemia, thrombocytopenia (patients can die from hemorrhage) - Splenomegaly with or without hepatomegaly (spleen can become bigger than the liver) - Kala-azar (black fever) presents as skin hyperpigmentation in fair-skinned individuals", 'ankihub_id': '1935b99b-305c-40c3-b603-bc35521c800a'}, {'anki_id': 1497106587707.0, 'document': 'Sulfasalazine can cause a hemolytic anemia in patients with G6PD deficiency Sulfa salazine is a sulfa drug', 'ankihub_id': 'ff483880-0548-4cae-88f8-f3c39707b528'}, {'anki_id': 1555459357027.0, 'document': 'In addition to O 2 , what are the pharmacological treatments of choice for an HIV patient with Pneumocystis pneumonia and a PaO 2 of 54 mmHg ? TMP-SMX and corticosteroids::2 - Normal PaO 2 = 75-105 mmHg - Corticosteroids are indicated for patients with PCP if SaO 2 < 92% , PaO 2 < 70 mmHg , or A-a gradient is > 35 mmHg on room air due to reducing inflammatory effects of dying organisms', 'ankihub_id': 'c60dde95-9e32-4ca9-b8de-8dc3373577c4'}, {'anki_id': 1509920358089.0, 'document': 'Which helminth can present with microfilariae in the lungs causing cough ? Wuchereria bancrofti', 'ankihub_id': '75926a0d-4faa-45fa-b379-55034b162720'}, {'anki_id': 1509841911928.0, 'document': 'Visceral leishmaniasis can present with pancytopenia ::blood complication Visceral leishmaniasis presents as: - Intermittent/spiking fever with weakness (secondary to anemia) - Pancytopenia : anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia (patients can die from hemorrhage) - Splenomegaly with or without hepatomegaly (spleen can become bigger than the liver) - Kala-azar (black fever) presents as skin hyperpigmentation in fair-skinned individuals', 'ankihub_id': 'b8d203d2-bae9-42d7-af97-d1a000109dca'}, {'anki_id': 1553891848262.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that emigrated from Southeast Asia and presents with a well-circumscribed , hypo pigmented patch on the arm with no sensation to pinprick ? The ulnar nerve on ipsilateral arm is thickened and tender Leprosy - Leprosy typically affects the skin and peripheral nerves - Diagnosis is made by a full-thickness biopsy from the edge of the lesion', 'ankihub_id': 'f65bb3d3-cc4a-471d-b229-774e4af83c82'}, {'anki_id': 1504220979797.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young patient that presents with two days of fever , altered mental status , seizures , and the lumbar puncture findings below? Opening pressure : normal Protein : normal RBCs : high WBCs : high Lymphocytes : 90% Viral encephalitis (e.g., HSV) HSV is the most common cause of viral encephalitis', 'ankihub_id': '9615075f-7ec4-4fbc-8d71-fc18145f132b'}, {'anki_id': 1503262526344.0, 'document': 'Well-demarcated , hairless, hypoesthetic , hypopigmented skin plaques are common in tuberculoid leprosy Source: “Fig 2c, In: Integrated Control and Management of Neglected Tropical Skin Diseases” by Mitjà O, Marks M, Bertran L et al., PLOS, licensed under CC BY 4.0. Modifications: removal of the letter C.', 'ankihub_id': '68913dc9-2a48-4afa-a4e6-81235af8939b'}, {'anki_id': 1506285427957.0, 'document': 'Yersinia pestis (plague) first spreads to the lymph nodes, forming characteristic buboes Swollen, tender lymph nodes that often drain purulent fluid', 'ankihub_id': '8942dcc5-cd90-4b98-8671-bf56ebd1d196'}, {'anki_id': 1504047647547.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with an intensely pruritic lesion on the foot (picture below)? Cutaneous larva migrans Typically begins as a pruritic, papular lesion at the entry site, followed by intensely pruritic , migrating, serpiginous reddish-brown tracks ; ivermectin is typically given to speed resolution and clearance Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) , Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': 'dcf44d35-c6e3-43b4-97c1-6d6ed1b49f57'}, {'anki_id': 1403025074063.0, 'document': 'African sleeping sickness is a CNS protozoal infection caused by Trypanosoma brucei subspecies that is diagnosed by a blood smear Will see Trypomastigotes on blood smear', 'ankihub_id': '6feda740-7cba-4120-a21e-de075adc008b'}, {'anki_id': 1509813986425.0, 'document': 'The early stage of Trypanosoma brucei infection (African sleeping sickness) includes cervical/axillary lymphadenopathy and recurrent fever - Early stage: intermittent fever, malaise, headache and lymphadenopathy - Late stage: CNS involvement, daytime somnolence, nighttime insomnia, persistent headache, eventual coma', 'ankihub_id': 'f34e6a0b-b5f4-40c4-a044-173156365c62'}, {'anki_id': 1557011308382.0, 'document': 'What is the procedure of choice to identify the site and attempt early therapeutic intervention for massive hemoptysis (> 600 mL/day or > 100 mL/hour)? Bronchoscopy - Bronchoscopy localizes the bleeding site, suctions the blood to help establish an airway, and can stop bleeding with cautery; this maintains the ABCs - Patients who continue to bleed after bronchoscopy may need surgical thoracotomy', 'ankihub_id': '8043ec08-745d-4c1c-bfe2-793daa885ff8'}, {'anki_id': 1538865864179.0, 'document': 'Neuroblastoma arising in the cervical paravertebral sympathetic chain can present as isolated Horner syndrome Ptosis, miosis, anhidrosis (lack of SNS)', 'ankihub_id': 'f8432f8c-dd14-4620-8f3d-0f884d0bd976'}, {'anki_id': 1476584154333.0, 'document': 'What malnutrition disorder presents as a small child with a swollen abdomen ? Kwashiorkor', 'ankihub_id': 'fde460e8-f794-4471-a704-78801714c57b'}, {'anki_id': 1509921165563.0, 'document': "Subcutaneous , ' Calabar ' swellings are diagnostic of the helminth Loa loa Calabar swellings are transient subcutaneous areas of localized erythema and angioedema on the face and extremities", 'ankihub_id': '74cde4a0-ac17-4b26-8e4e-57c306a8057c'}, {'anki_id': 1582996132870.0, 'document': 'Fetal ultrasound showing a dilated fluid-filled stomach is suggestive of duodenal atresia', 'ankihub_id': 'f6bd0878-820c-424b-b6a7-3d0995e864b2'}, {'anki_id': 1524014869403.0, 'document': 'What are the two most common causes of osteomyelitis in health-care related vertebral osteomyelitis associated with intravascular devices ? 1. Staph aureus 2. Coagulase-negative staphylococci (CoNS) Pseudomonas is also another option; devices include hemodialysis catheters', 'ankihub_id': 'e1fa108f-0b51-4c29-b2b0-7d69d2fc3b37'}, {'anki_id': 1474426261606.0, 'document': 'The V/Q mismatch seen in pulmonary embolism can result in hypoxemia , which causes hyperventilation with consequent respiratory alkalosis - Hyperventilation results in decreased PaCO 2 with little effect on PaO 2 - Typically, dead space does NOT lead to hypoxemia, but since dead space is so large, this causes a hypoxic vasoconstriction shunting of blood to other alveoli resulting in increased blood flow to remainder of lung - Additionally, ischemic injury results in inflammation which results in surfactant deficiency and atelectasis in the surrounding lung regions; leads to a high volume of deoxygenated blood traversing poorly ventilated lung regions (results in right-to-left intrapulmonary shunting → hypoxemia) - This will increase Q, leading to a V/Q mismatch - Thus some alveoli have high V/Q (= infinity b/c no blood flow), some alveoli have low V/Q (b/c of shunted blood flow)', 'ankihub_id': 'd10c17d6-ac16-4890-811f-80679623615c'}, {'anki_id': 1509920457655.0, 'document': 'How is Wuchereria bancrofti transmitted ? Mosquitos', 'ankihub_id': '1edb960e-fe9e-4c60-af66-09dbe12e2545'}, {'anki_id': 1463106074503.0, 'document': 'An abnormal Pap smear is followed by confirmatory colposcopy (visualization of cervix with a magnifying glass) and biopsy', 'ankihub_id': 'e252f5e7-dbcb-47b3-bd72-0176bbc769ea'}, {'anki_id': 1475890918882.0, 'document': 'In the RBCs , the HMP shunt provides a source of NADPH for reduction of H 2 O 2 (via reduced glutathione)', 'ankihub_id': 'f8e5d61a-f131-45fb-9301-dfe6c6aeeb74'}, {'anki_id': 1474426151822.0, 'document': 'Fat emboli are characterized by a triad of: Hypoxemia Neurological abnormalities Petechial rash overlying the chest - These symptoms are seen 1-3 days after the injury - Fat globules can escape lungs by opening precapillary arteriovenous shunts that open due to increased pulmonary artery pressure (allowing dissemination to the brain → confusion and neurologic abnormalities) - Once past lungs, may disseminate to dermal capillaries; petechial rash due to thrombocytopenia (platelets adhere to and coat fat macroglobules) - Anemia is also seen, due to increased RBC aggregation / destruction, as well as possible pulmonary hemorrhage', 'ankihub_id': 'a74b3998-b7e0-4d6a-bee7-5586a2a37549'}, {'anki_id': 1504049298870.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an IV drug user with a history of recent incarceration that presents with sub-acute onset of intermittent fevers , weight loss , fatigue , and non-productive cough (CXR below)? Miliary tuberculosis CXR shows a diffuse reticulonodular pattern; the most common behavioral risk factor for TB in the United States is substance abuse', 'ankihub_id': 'a6d91493-e025-4fa3-b591-f6b495b5f090'}, {'anki_id': 1509919432933.0, 'document': 'Which hematologic complication arises from Dracunculus medinensis infection? Eosinophilia', 'ankihub_id': 'fd831f19-c718-45dc-984f-8a623f3fe5c8'}, {'anki_id': 1517182412642.0, 'document': 'What mumps complication occurs predominantly in post-pubertal males ? Orchitis May result in impaired fertility (more common than aseptic meningitis or any other complications)', 'ankihub_id': 'cd636850-2964-40d3-994f-608b21ac7d49'}, {'anki_id': 1520088417035.0, 'document': 'Dengue fever is associated with a positive tourniquet test , which results in petechiae after blood pressure cuff inflation AKA the capillary fragility test / Rumpel-Leede test', 'ankihub_id': '44e0699d-7def-40bd-b2df-a42250bd1b10'}, {'anki_id': 1582400989553.0, 'document': 'Essential thrombocythemia is a myeloproliferative neoplasm with an increased number of megakaryocytes ::what cells in the bone marrow Normocellular marrow with marked proliferation of large to giant megakaryocytes: ©️ Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': '85cc1ecc-b50f-4d51-9bbc-33acf647445c'}, {'anki_id': 1480646912185.0, 'document': 'Chronic::Acute or Chronic lymphocytic leukemia is a neoplastic proliferation of mature circulating lymphocytes - Thus causing a high WBC count - Typically slower onset than Acute', 'ankihub_id': '4ea6d19b-8af0-4ac6-bfb2-f157b64834b8'}, {'anki_id': 1504047839475.0, 'document': 'How is cutaneous larva migrans typically acquired (mode of transmission)? Walking barefoot on contaminated sand or soil Imagine a hook on your foot Intensely pruritic serpiginous (snake-like) tracks indicating larval migration', 'ankihub_id': '8c04ba1a-a885-49b6-b7e6-672757f5eb46'}, {'anki_id': 1504643689275.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that recently returned from a trip to Kenya and presents with headache , fatigue , and episodic fever ? Systemic-onset juvenile idiopathic arthritis (systemic JIA) - Systemic type JIA is also known as Still disease ; most common in patients 2 – 4 years old - Symptoms : salmon-pink macular rash, hepatosplenomegaly, sore throat, lymphadenopathy, myalgias, fever, joint swelling and pain, pericarditis, pleuritis, myocarditis - Lab findings : leukocytosis, thrombocytosis, anemia, and elevated ESR Salmon colored macular rash (left); Destructive changes in the hips (right)', 'ankihub_id': '7ba7d532-9077-4302-b3ae-cba40c35885d'}, {'anki_id': 1472072268519.0, 'document': 'Libman-Sacks ( verrucous ) endocarditis is due to sterile vegetations that arise in association with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)', 'ankihub_id': 'a3cf7189-74b7-42dc-b566-054c663be4ce'}, {'anki_id': 1557163276028.0, 'document': 'Prolonged fever, cough with foul -smelling sputum and air-fluid levels on imaging is suggestive of lung abscess::diagnosis Often secondary to aspiration pneumonia (e.g., alcohol use disorder) Thick walled cavity (blue overlay); air-fluid level (red line)', 'ankihub_id': '491f43e6-486f-495f-b05a-16c78af84e2a'}, {'anki_id': 1478916064403.0, 'document': 'What is the most common cause of death in adult sickle cell anemia patients ? Leishmania donovani - i.e., Kala-azar (Hindi for "black fever," due to hyperpigmentation of the skin) Visceral leishmaniasis presents as: - Intermittent/spiking fever - Pancytopenia : anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia (patients can die from hemorrhage) - Splenomegaly with or without hepatomegaly (spleen can become bigger than the liver) - Kala-azar (black fever) presents as skin hyperpigmentation in fair-skinned individuals', 'ankihub_id': '370e9dc4-7b33-4089-966c-8743a9b8a9b0'}, {'anki_id': 1506628849279.0, 'document': 'West Nile virus vector(s) : Mosquito ( Culex ) - AMBOSS also states that the Aedes and Anopheles spp. are also vectors - West Nile virus is an arbovirus (i.e., a virus transmitted by arthropod vectors )', 'ankihub_id': '2441164e-5e85-4a08-b788-96ae7298bfa5'}, {'anki_id': 1481335477349.0, 'document': 'The t( 11; 14) translocation results in overexpression of cyclin D1 , which promotes the G 1 /S transition in the cell cycle, facilitating neoplastic proliferation - Thus in lymph nodes, the region next to the follicle (the mantle) expands, leading to mantle cell lymphoma - Cycl 1 n D 1 on chromosome 11', 'ankihub_id': 'dab45ee1-896d-459b-9854-ad7f09b0de16'}, {'anki_id': 1499970930064.0, 'document': 'Histoplasma ::Which fungus targets the reticuloendothelial system, ultimately resulting in dissemination to the liver and spleen - Gross presentation may reveal calcifications in these organs Other clinical features of disseminated Histoplasmosis include: - Nonspecific inflammatory symptoms (fatigue, fever, weight loss) - Bilateral reticulonodular pulmonary infiltrates - Lymphadenopathy - Pancytopenia - Bilateral adrenal enlargement', 'ankihub_id': 'f6ac2991-4e8e-4ccf-83a1-297e12a6a710'}, {'anki_id': 1537488001646.0, 'document': 'Rubella vs Measles childhood exanthems: Rubella rash : begins at head and moves down; postauricular lymphadenopathy::physical exam findings Measles rash : begins at head and moves down; preceded by cough, coryza, conjunctivitis, and Koplik spots::physical exam findings', 'ankihub_id': '9130ad36-e992-4314-bcfa-19d8e9165fa3'}, {'anki_id': 1516841909946.0, 'document': 'Roseola is also known as exanthema subitum Subitum = sudden (onset rash upon fever cessation)', 'ankihub_id': '7d36171f-ab9f-4f66-b372-621b84d63056'}, {'anki_id': 1504141588808.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a sexually active patient that presents with fever / chills , polyarthralgia , and pustules on the chest and extensor surfaces of the forearms ? Disseminated gonococcal infection - The patient is normotensive, has no abnormal heart sounds, and has a rash that spares the palms and soles (helps rule out toxic shock syndrome, infective endocarditis, and secondary syphilis, respectively) - Palms and soles are occasionally affected - Treat with intravenous 3rd generation cephalosporin (e.g., ceftriaxone) Sara Mehrsefat , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via WikiDoc (image 1); Dr. Thomas F. Sellers , via CDC (i mage 2) & CDC (i mage 3)', 'ankihub_id': '92b67e83-5647-4b47-9939-8d63db1db5ae'}, {'anki_id': 1517254602186.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young Asian child that presents with one week of conjunctivitis, maculopapular rash , lymphadenopathy , hand/feet swelling , and fever ? Kawasaki disease', 'ankihub_id': '9832951b-111e-4f5c-aa10-9486dabd065f'}, {'anki_id': 1580485234217.0, 'document': 'Toxic shock syndrome is a bacterial infection causing distributive shock that may affect the skin, resulting in a(n) diffuse erythematous macular rash DermNet and used with permission, CC-BY-NC-ND 3.0 NZ', 'ankihub_id': '0c8d5232-a880-4afc-897a-96d9f071fcf5'}, {'anki_id': 1516586631530.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an Asian / African-American infant that presents with flat blue-gray patches on the lower back and buttock? Congenital dermal melanocytosis - Caused by melanocytes getting stuck in the dermis during migration from neural crest - Benign and usually fade spontaneously during childhood (reassurance is appropriate) - May be easily mistaken as bruises, thus it is important to document the presence of these spots - Formerly known as "Mongolian spot", no longer used due to derogatory nature', 'ankihub_id': 'ce2952bd-cc55-46ba-8ae8-8495e7d97f18'}, {'anki_id': 1473548378667.0, 'document': 'Clinical features of pneumonia include productive cough with yellow-green or rust-colored sputum (due to pus and blood, respectively)', 'ankihub_id': '3621e773-948d-468c-a2b7-a792a7edec46'}, {'anki_id': 1509916965346.0, 'document': 'What is the route of transmission of Ascaris lumbricoides ( giant roundworm )? Fecal-oral - Ova are ingested and hatch in the small intestine, where they release larvae, penetrate the intestinal wall, and migrate hematogenously or lymphatically into the lungs - Larvae mature in the alveoli, where they ascend the bronchial tree and are swallowed ©️ Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': '35760c6d-71bb-4b40-870c-28f6d29ba132'}, {'anki_id': 1472611912290.0, 'document': 'IV Ca 2+ channel blockers such as nicardipine and clevidipine may be used in hypertensive emergency', 'ankihub_id': '86af7de8-4ca5-402c-ad7b-c71c95c7f465'}, {'anki_id': 1474059980809.0, 'document': 'Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) may occur secondary to sepsis , especially gram negative bacteria - e.g., E. Coli or N. meningitidis - Endotoxins from the bacterial wall and cytokines (IL-1, TNF) induce endothelial cells to make tissue factor', 'ankihub_id': 'd5c6621e-0c73-494b-bd6b-6c674400b504'}, {'anki_id': 1502041962430.0, 'document': 'Spirochetes of Treponema pallidum can be visualized within condylomata lata of secondary syphilis via darkfield microscopy Condition Pain Lymphadenopathy Appearance Condylomata lata Painless Yes Multiple, flat, round, moist Condylomata acuminata Painless No Multiple, verrucous Herpes Painful Yes Multiple, ulcers, vesicles Molluscum contagiosum Painless Rare Umbilicated papules in clusters', 'ankihub_id': '3d930597-7dc2-4d27-9c68-c671732e39e8'}, {'anki_id': 1578627140675.0, 'document': 'Aortic regurgitation murmurs due to aortic root dilation are best heard at the base (aortic area 2nd ICS) - While AR due to valvular disease is heard best in the left 3rd and 4th ICS and along the LSB (Erb point) - Collagen vascular diseases (e.g., Marfan, Ehlers-Danlos) can cause aortic root dilation - Aortitis in tertiary syphilis can cause aortic root dilation', 'ankihub_id': 'acdb05d6-3d12-4766-b005-b70a683b5262'}, {'anki_id': 1553163350257.0, 'document': 'What is the best next step in a patient who presents with endocarditis and acute onset CHF ? Surgery Surgical Criteria: 1) > 15 mm without embolization 2) > 10 mm with embolization 3) Presence of abscess 4) Valve destruction or CHF', 'ankihub_id': '94ecb46f-cdd5-4105-88d1-2f48efd7a4f6'}, {'anki_id': 1495903799502.0, 'document': 'When using a ventilator , the goal is to keep SpO 2 between 88 - 95%', 'ankihub_id': '89d67283-bb29-4b19-b6e5-d1b731184c11'}, {'anki_id': 1477011672952.0, 'document': 'Unlike phenylephrine, norepinephrine causes increased cardiac contractility due to β 1 activation, which results in increased pulse pressure', 'ankihub_id': 'f0408255-f900-4757-aa31-aebfc0ae055c'}, {'anki_id': 1550712329135.0, 'document': 'Fever and cough = CXR::imaging and SpO 2 Infiltrate confirms, but normal does not rule out pneumonia', 'ankihub_id': 'b89e154d-e09d-493a-bc1d-bdbfbe38c673'}, {'anki_id': 1480564186735.0, 'document': "Treatment of B-ALL requires prophylaxis to the scrotum and CSF - Chemotherapy doesn't pass the blood-brain or blood-testis barrier - Can lead to male infertility - For B -ALL, protect the B rain and B -ALLs", 'ankihub_id': 'c69f5dba-815a-4996-9201-70be97667da7'}, {'anki_id': 1505741901026.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with pain , edema , and redness over the medial canthus of the right eye for two days? Slight pressure over the area causes expression of purulent material Dacryocystitis (infection of the lacrimal sac) - Due to nasolacrimal duct obstruction - Typically caused by Staphylococcus aureus and Streptococcus pyogenes; Dack / Sack / Pack imagine a Sack Packed with pus hanging off the medial part of eye - Treated with o ral amoxicillin-clavulanate the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously (© AnkiHub, LLC)', 'ankihub_id': '304fad25-1a97-453a-80b7-d0a2432d3fec'}, {'anki_id': 1516317385436.0, 'document': 'Congenital rubella is characterized by radio lucent bone lesions', 'ankihub_id': 'eb1ec77f-193f-49da-9da3-29ef442e4fd8'}, {'anki_id': 1581696622584.0, 'document': 'Below is a CT of a(n) lung abscess', 'ankihub_id': '046b322a-6f74-4711-a18c-595577fd2bfb'}, {'anki_id': 1505252173955.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with arthralgias , fatigue , and painless , palpable purpura on the bilateral legs? Laboratory examination reveals elevated LFTs, evidence of glomerulonephritis (hematuria & proteinuria), and low serum C4 Mixed cryoglobulinemia syndrome - Presents with fatigue, palpable purpura, arthralgias, renal disease, positive rheumatoid factor, elevated transaminases, hypocomplementemia, hepatosplenomegaly, peripheral neuropathy , and non-specific systemic symptoms - Tx: corticosteroids, rituximab, and treatment of the underlying cause', 'ankihub_id': 'f71b96d6-2de2-4bd1-a6fe-b16934d49fa8'}, {'anki_id': 1703169821806.0, 'document': 'Severe malaria commonly presents with hypoglycemia due to hepatic dysfunction - Sporozoites replicate in liver → damage to hepatocytes → impaired gluconeogenesis/glycogen storage - Other lab findings include signs of hemolysis (anemia, hyperbilirubinemia, elevated LDH), thrombocytopenia, AKI, and acidosis - May present clinically with CNS involvment (delirium, seizures, signs of increased ICP), shock, and/or ARDS', 'ankihub_id': 'ad8c6cf6-4488-46c3-b44a-6ebad772d71f'}, {'anki_id': 1516758648261.0, 'document': 'What is the initial presentation of Kaposi sarcoma ? Cutaneous disease - Typically begin as flat purple skin lesion (often mistaken for a bruise) which progress to nonpainful papules - Lesions can present in a variety of colors that can include purple , pink, red, and brown on lower extremities, face (esp. nose), and oral mucosa', 'ankihub_id': 'e5ece865-6709-4e20-9c28-551f904fe4e2'}, {'anki_id': 1581716603314.0, 'document': 'Below is a babygram of a patient with Neonatal respiratory distress syndrome (NRDS) - Chest radiograph one day after birth of a boy after 29 weeks and 3 days of gestational age who developed respiratory distress. It shows signs of infant respiratory distress syndrome (IRDS), in the form of a generalized fine granular opacities that creates air bronchograms. The thorax is bell-shaped due to decreased lung volume - In addition, there are both arterial and venous umbilical lines, a nasogastric tube and electrocardiography electrodes. Diagnosis Transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN) Respiratory distress syndrome Persistent pulmonary hypertension Pathophysiology Alveolar fluid not cleared properly at birth Alveolar collapse and atelectasis due to lack of surfactant Right to left shunting due to high pulmonary vascular resistance resulting in hypoxia Clinical features Tachypnea resolves by day 2 Respiratory distress (premature birth) Tachypnea and cyanosis Chest x-ray Perihilar linear streaking bilaterally Ground glass (reticulogranular), air bronchograms, decreased lung volumes Clear lung fields, decreased pulmonary vascularity', 'ankihub_id': '6068d17e-74c2-4337-96c7-4c599daa7a57'}, {'anki_id': 1516464000101.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an afebrile child who presents with abdominal pain , jaundice , and a palpable RUQ mass with a normal gallbladder on ultrasound? Biliary cyst - Most commonly a type 1 cyst, which is single and extrahepatic - Biliary cysts may be asymptomatic until complications arise (e.g., cholestasis, pancreatitis)', 'ankihub_id': 'dd658b82-1131-4346-9bb5-02b3e92dce20'}, {'anki_id': 1513194388496.0, 'document': "What is the likely diagnosis in a child with a history of tetralogy of Fallot and recurrent sinusitis that presents with a two-week history of worsening morning headaches , fever , focal neurological deficits , and a recent first-time seizure ? Brain abscess Congenital heart disease and recurrent sinusitis are important predisposing factors for brain abscess (right to left shunt bypasses the pulmonary 'filter' for bad stuff)", 'ankihub_id': '5de645ca-1bb4-42b0-bad7-a325abbad889'}, {'anki_id': 1532452453844.0, 'document': 'Bicuspid valve predisposes to aortic stenosis (older patients) and aortic regurgitation (young adults)', 'ankihub_id': 'cb9b6060-f489-4578-a4f8-8ec7c5270aab'}, {'anki_id': 1555781017510.0, 'document': 'High CO 2 and respiratory acidosis = COPD::COPD/CHF exacerbation Low CO 2 and respiratory alkalosis = CHF::COPD/CHF exacerbation', 'ankihub_id': '8fdd92f9-9ef2-443c-8f3b-72cf0e3fcd83'}, {'anki_id': 1510103857856.0, 'document': "Salmonella typhi can present with abdominal pain with ' rose spots ' cutaneously Described as a salmon-colored macule", 'ankihub_id': '7650842e-e25d-475c-96cb-a1822176cc0f'}, {'anki_id': 1467819843271.0, 'document': "The triphosphate bond of DNA is the target of 3' hydroxyl attack (strand elongation)", 'ankihub_id': 'c832cb68-38b0-4dcc-85cf-5e1b8a920f59'}, {'anki_id': 1487727700012.0, 'document': 'What is the major cause of death in patients with Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome ? Bleeding WA T ER → T hrombocytopenia (fewer and smaller platelets)', 'ankihub_id': 'd3dbb5c9-ede2-41a2-9e8d-5900eeccca49'}, {'anki_id': 1569207092297.0, 'document': 'Burn wound sepsis can develop rapidly and is diagnosed when ≥3 of the following systemic findings are present: - Temperature : < 97.7 ºF (36.5 ºC) or > 102.2 ºF (39 ºC) - HR > 90 bpm - RR > 30 breaths/min - SBP < 90 mmHg Other signs: - Lab abnormalities such as evolving leukocytosis, leukopenia, or thrombocytopenia - Evidence of organ hypoperfusion and/or dysfunction (e.g., new-onset enteral feeding intolerance, oliguria, unexplained hyperglycemia, and/or AMS)', 'ankihub_id': 'b1546d91-9b40-46bb-aaa9-9b5a4e6955b4'}, {'anki_id': 1506275084063.0, 'document': 'Typhus is a rickettsial disease that presents with a rash that starts centrally and then spreads out , but spares the palms and soles - Also spares the head - R MSF (R. r ickettsii) = palms/soles/w R ists - T yphus (R. typhi; R. prowazekii) = T runk', 'ankihub_id': 'd8f79608-c708-4ce5-ac8f-2646b8a3228a'}, {'anki_id': 1593880180753.0, 'document': 'Pediculus humanus / Phthirus pubis ( lice )::specific can transmit Borrelia recurrentis , Rickettsia prowazekii , and Bartonella quintana', 'ankihub_id': '7b3386e5-b5c0-4b94-a8c3-7613d25c893a'}, {'anki_id': 1555363906160.0, 'document': 'Abscess::diagnosis - A bscess is often due to a naerobes → fever + cough + foul-smelling sputum - Cavitary lesion with air fluid level', 'ankihub_id': 'e1f795c6-eba4-4274-95c6-8719cdc5ce49'}, {'anki_id': 1503252300691.0, 'document': 'Primary Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection is diagnosed via presence of the Ghon complex Ghon complex = Ghon focus (granuloma in lower/middle lobe) paired with swelling of the associated hilar lymph node', 'ankihub_id': '32682dc7-d773-47ca-8dff-f7ec0b7c053b'}, {'anki_id': 1517255209808.0, 'document': 'Patients with Kawasaki disease have sandpaper-like skin F::T/F Scarlet fever presents with sandpaper-like skin Sandpaper-like skin:', 'ankihub_id': 'f1d940e0-ed0f-44fa-a69b-38f831f15e64'}, {'anki_id': 1487727731817.0, 'document': 'What is the mode of inheritance of IL-12 receptor deficiency ? Autosomal recessive', 'ankihub_id': 'fd1d2d00-f7b1-4563-8a18-ec7e1be57d5b'}, {'anki_id': 1547916069521.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young, sexually active patient that presents with fever , sore throat , and lower abdominal pain ? Physical exam reveals erythematous tonsils without exudates and non-tender cervical lymphadenopathy Gonococcal pharyngitis with pelvic inflammatory disease - Oral sex → pharyngitis! - vs. Epstein-Barr virus , which typically causes tender cervical lymphadenopathy and exudative pharyngitis', 'ankihub_id': '8e085f66-4b9e-44e9-ac9d-08028e7256e4'}, {'anki_id': 1516557597122.0, 'document': 'Filoviruses (Ebola, Marburg) cause acute hemorrhagic fever that can progress to end-organ failure With petechial rash', 'ankihub_id': '395e2c37-f3af-4018-b15d-2df0f23519fa'}, {'anki_id': 1517176726851.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for an asymptomatic adolescent that presents with several soft , mobile , non-tender cervical lymph nodes measuring < 2 cm in diameter? Observation - < 2 cm without worrisome features (firm, immobile, supraclavicular or generalized, systemic symptoms) can be monitored for 10-14 days - Further work-up is indicated if lymphadenopathy persists, the node enlarges, or if symptoms develop', 'ankihub_id': 'eb01249b-43e2-46da-b158-83bc48891560'}, {'anki_id': 1556653250607.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with weight loss , tachycardia , anti-thyroid peroxidase antibodies ( TPOAbs ) , and the physical exam findings below? Thyroid gland : normal size, non-tender TSH : low Free T 4 : high Radioactive iodine uptake : < 5% Subacute lymphocytic thyroiditis - AKA painless thyroiditis or silent thyroiditis - Painless thyroiditis is often a self-limited hyperthyroid phase of Hashimoto thyroiditis (both have TPOAbs ) - RAIU is decreased due to preformed thyroid hormone - Compared to subacute granulomatous thyroiditis which presents with very tender thyroid gland', 'ankihub_id': 'a51cddac-09b3-4767-80d1-0376c511e71b'}, {'anki_id': 1509917128260.0, 'document': 'Which nematode is most likely to cause respiratory symptoms ? Ascaris lumbricoides (giant roundworm) - Ascaris lumbricoides usually is asymptomatic, but may cause hypersensitivity pneumonitis called Loeffler syndrome (dry cough, substernal burning, dyspnea, fever, crackles and wheezing) - The trematode Paragonimus westermani also commonly causes respiratory symptoms (both are helminths) - Ascaris " Lung "-ricoides invades the Lungs ©️ Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': 'f53f498b-dd30-48c3-95bd-2e8dc9557e7d'}, {'anki_id': 1544385358722.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a child that notices multiple, pruritic hypopigmented skin lesions on the face and trunk after beginning summer camp ? Pityriasis versicolor (AKA tinea versicolor*) - Typically noticed after sun exposure as the surrounding skin gets darker (lesions do not tan in the sunlight) - *Note that pityriasis versicolor is not actually a tinea infection and tinea versicolor is a misnomer*', 'ankihub_id': 'b1fca6f2-688e-415a-82af-e9e4f5bffb6b'}, {'anki_id': 1509919181753.0, 'document': 'Which helminth has a mature form that emerges from painful skin ulcers ? Dracunculus medinensis', 'ankihub_id': '80ae96c0-c16e-4e1f-8fd8-06601d903b3c'}, {'anki_id': 1503966481068.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents in the winter with abrupt onset high-grade fever , headache , and severe myalgias ? No lymphadenopathy or abnormal lung sounds are appreciated on physical exam Influenza', 'ankihub_id': 'aabbb3af-a491-457a-a8bd-351238c89baa'}, {'anki_id': 1520088493022.0, 'document': 'Primary infection with dengue fever is asymptomatic or self-limited', 'ankihub_id': 'dd5e0954-aadb-419c-94fa-7f5bba4ec2ef'}, {'anki_id': 1402799666317.0, 'document': 'Q fever is a Rickettsial-like disease that can be obtained via aerosolized spores released from livestock amniotic fluid - Caused by Coxiella burnetii - Primary reservoirs are goats, sheep, and cattle; infection is usually passed via amniotic fluid or secretions - Less common modes of transmission include ingestion of unpasteurized milk , tick bites , and person-to-person spread', 'ankihub_id': '19956081-76ba-47be-98d7-743760c38a87'}, {'anki_id': 1506297574155.0, 'document': "What are the 4 C's of measles ? Cough Coryza Conjunctivitis Koplik spots Coryza = runny/stuffy nose due to inflammation (AKA rhinitis)", 'ankihub_id': 'e426f109-004c-40dc-8d5e-229f426eb450'}, {'anki_id': 1484603417128.0, 'document': 'ID Eye Structure : Fovea', 'ankihub_id': 'f99130ff-1e05-4618-8d40-3ec7d133ce91'}, {'anki_id': 1516054334746.0, 'document': 'Indirect transmission of Francisella tularensis results from bite by Dermacentor tick or deerfly', 'ankihub_id': 'c95d5786-fa79-4f67-82ba-5de4e0c92e8a'}, {'anki_id': 1547566175769.0, 'document': 'Fetal accelerations are good::good/bad Accelerations are consistent with a fetal pH of greater than 7.2', 'ankihub_id': 'c97840cc-102f-4029-a2be-841fccf9fc01'}, {'anki_id': 1525463186426.0, 'document': 'The most commonly identified pathogens in febrile neutropenia are gram positive bacteria - Gram negative pathogens might be suspected if onset (e.g., hypotension, tachycardia) is very rapid (4 hours) - Gram positive infections = less virulent, less severe, slower onset - However, those with profound and prolonged neutropenia are especially at high risk for viral and fungal infections ( Aspergillus / Candida )', 'ankihub_id': 'c376f0b3-7c50-4b77-83fb-dcf3868dca78'}, {'anki_id': 1577239995026.0, 'document': 'At what age can you start screening patients for HIV ? 15 years old - Or at < 15 years if patient is at increased risk - Also screen pregnant patients, even those who present in labor who are untested and whose HIV status is unknown', 'ankihub_id': '4fe78e02-8bb5-422a-a70b-ba66852ccf06'}, {'anki_id': 1502067509832.0, 'document': "The acute phase of HIV consists of flu or mono-like symptoms with generalized lymphadenopathy and fever - Known as acute retroviral syndrome ; can occur anywhere from 2-8 weeks after infection , and is commonly self-limited - ~25% of patients with acute HIV present with mild a septic meningitis (headache, nuchal rigidity, photophobia) - Following the resolution of symptoms, there is a period of clinical latency that can last from 6 months to 10 years , during which most infected persons are a symptomatic - This card used to say cervical lymphadenopathy, but both AMBOSS and UWorld confirm it's nontender generalized lymphadenopathy (May 2024)", 'ankihub_id': '54a5e4cb-2a31-470b-9988-beabaf92bfb0'}, {'anki_id': 1553766910010.0, 'document': 'Takayasu arteritis::vasculitis - Flu-like symptoms and skin nodules: due to generalized inflammation - Weak pulses in upper extremities, ocular: due to involvement of aortic arch feeding upper body', 'ankihub_id': 'c143060e-ceb3-469e-8bec-af7d7fcd1840'}, {'anki_id': 1473548836664.0, 'document': 'Primary tuberculosis (TB) results in focal caseating necrosis in the lower or middle lobes of the lung and hilar lymphadenopathy', 'ankihub_id': '3d72945a-4fc3-4f58-a043-d04171d0757b'}, {'anki_id': 1516557533616.0, 'document': 'Filoviruses (Ebola, Marburg) cause petechial rash and fever', 'ankihub_id': '0a93ffa3-17b1-4515-9e93-bcb774bbd393'}, {'anki_id': 1482203808143.0, 'document': 'Achalasia is characterized by high LES pressure on esophageal manometry - Important distinguishing feature from sclerodermal esophageal dysmotility - Achalasia in Greek means "does not relax"', 'ankihub_id': '4a3540cf-1f4c-408f-a2d3-4072e674a890'}, {'anki_id': 1515895167033.0, 'document': "Legionnaires' disease caused by Legionella pneumophila is associated with diarrhea::GI symptom", 'ankihub_id': '63cb09cd-5c47-424d-8a1a-e0c61b335650'}, {'anki_id': 1522789525715.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a child that develops a blanching maculopapular rash after four days of a high fever ? Roseola - Due to infection by HHV-6 or HHV-7 (rare) - Rash classically occurs as the fever subsides', 'ankihub_id': 'e7d3deb5-9263-46e3-9a49-e72d92575760'}, {'anki_id': 1517078424898.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a neonate that presents with hypothermia , hypotonia , poor feeding , and lethargy ? Neonatal sepsis - Get blood, CSF, and urine cultures before starting antibiotics - Signs of neonatal sepsis are non-specific ; it may manifest with hypothermia or hyperthermia, leukocytosis or leukopenia, etc.', 'ankihub_id': 'ef558553-dd2b-4a4c-8335-7f3f87016f73'}, {'anki_id': 1577321713294.0, 'document': 'What is the best next step in management of a pregnant patient with rectus abdominis diastasis ? Observation and reassurance ± exercise program - Typically resolves postpartum - May also be congenital - Although diastasis recti may resolve spontaneously postpartum, initiating an exercise program 6–8 weeks after the delivery can help strengthen the abdominal rectus muscles and reduce the abnormal extension of the linea alba - Additional measures, such as weight loss , may be appropriate in patients who develop diastasis recti secondary to obesity', 'ankihub_id': 'ec9c7056-1417-430a-b75d-ea920e38910c'}, {'anki_id': 1577732407925.0, 'document': 'Why is there an increased risk of pyelonephritis during pregnancy ? Widened ureters (caused by progesterone) + increased glucose levels in the urine → ascension of organisms to the kidney Also contributing is the dextrorotation of the uterus as it rises out of the pelvis (12+) weeks. This laterally displaces and compresses the ureters at the pelvic brim leading to elevated intrauereteral tone and ureteral dilatation (Association of Professors of Gynecology and Obstetrics (APGO))', 'ankihub_id': '69f49ae8-ecbb-4079-b337-60665192caac'}, {'anki_id': 1539182460216.0, 'document': 'Baby < 28 days and fever > 100.4 ºF / 38 ºC = sepsis until proven otherwise Watch associated Bootcamp video - Bacterial Toxins: Gram Negative Sepsis', 'ankihub_id': '576cf567-bc6e-4884-a231-ba86453659eb'}, {'anki_id': 1509919748473.0, 'document': 'Which helminth can result in hyper and hypopigmented cutaneous spots ? Mosquitos; most commonly the Aedes Hence is an arbovirus', 'ankihub_id': '0933ca9e-aacd-4fc7-9274-5224be52abfd'}, {'anki_id': 1582815004210.0, 'document': 'A young child with red , tender , and fluctuant mass approximately 2 cm in diameter on the left anterior cervical chain is suggestive of unilateral cervical lymphadenitis Most commonly caused by Staphylococcus aureus or Streptococcus pyogenes', 'ankihub_id': 'ab459256-4490-4784-8641-b40239839eae'}, {'anki_id': 1499974698514.0, 'document': 'A(n) clear CXR with possible lesions or cavities in the lungs is characteristic of Coccidioidomycosis ::which fungal infection', 'ankihub_id': 'f92709e2-29ec-4b92-91b1-c6028b3a2d81'}, {'anki_id': 1503876044883.0, 'document': 'Which herpesvirus infection can result in cauda equina syndrome in HIV/AIDS patients ?
