Eosinophilia', 'ankihub_id': '2576f306-3ba1-4779-95ef-91110f1ca366'}, {'anki_id': 1557665746889.0, 'document': 'What is the most common dermal manifestation of antiphospholipid syndrome ? Livedo reticularis LR may also be associated with polyarteritis nodosa, SLE, cholesterol embolization, cryoglobulinemia', 'ankihub_id': '67443567-b9fd-4175-acc2-f90971b9ec93'}, {'anki_id': 1509925987471.0, 'document': "Neurocysticercosis due to the helminth Taenia solium has a(n) ' swiss cheese ' appearance of the brain on CT/MRI Suspect if patient is immigrant / farmer, has seizures or hydrocephalus Brutto et al. , CC BY 4.0 , via PLOS Neglected Tropical Diseases", 'ankihub_id': '368c0d51-1c0d-42d7-a7c0-9ee29d95fcac'}, {'anki_id': 1500235087296.0, 'document': 'Candida albicans :: Candida albicans or Leukoplakia results in white patches in the oral cavity that can be scraped away', 'ankihub_id': '820a500d-b0c1-4cf9-b8c3-117a6e811947'}, {'anki_id': 1517081172326.0, 'document': 'Cat scratch disease often manifests as a localized papule followed by regional tender lymphadenopathy that develops in the subsequent 1 - 2 weeks Affected lymph nodes are enlarged, tender, and have overlying erythema', 'ankihub_id': '3d6c352f-97d9-4a11-b0a6-88fd2410a265'}, {'anki_id': 1500031705084.0, 'document': 'The natural life cycle of Rickettsia prowazekii generally involves a vertebrate (usually squirrel) and an invertebrate host human body louse - The louse defecates near feeding sites, you scratch this site allowing the larvae to get into your blood - Side note R. prowazekii also appears to be the closest free-living relative to mitochondria', 'ankihub_id': '655096d0-7076-4ce3-a17b-d719c022ac41'}, {'anki_id': 1506628336655.0, 'document': 'Which vector transmits Yellow fever ? Mosquito , specifically the Aedes Hence is an arbovirus', 'ankihub_id': 'e9d32258-30d6-438f-a68b-5fc7a7ba788e'}, {'anki_id': 1614809251322.0, 'document': "What are the 6 common childhood exanthems ? First disease - Measles Second disease - Scarlet fever ( S. pyogenes ) Third disease - Rubella Fourth disease - Scalded skin syndrome ( S. aureus )* Fifth disease - Erythema infectiosum ( Parvovirus B19 ) Sixth disease - Roseola ( HHV-6 ) *The term fourth disease was previously used to describe Filatov-Dukes' disease, which is no longer recognized as a discrete entity - S carlet is S econd - Three day measles → Third - SSSS is 4 letters → Fourth - Five fingers on cheek → Fifth - HHV- 6 → Six", 'ankihub_id': '577ebe46-ff4e-41ed-8329-758d60d8a062'}, {'anki_id': 1500058721659.0, 'document': 'Cryptosporidium spp. infections are often found in HIV+ patients with CD4+ cell counts < 100/mm 3', 'ankihub_id': 'adfbc47a-b230-4be3-9828-215604eb2789'}, {'anki_id': 1506285532917.0, 'document': 'Yersinia pestis (plague) often escapes the lymph nodes to cause septicemia and widespread necrosis of the organs - Necrosis of organs is probably how Yersinia pestis got the name "the black plague" - Flea bite → lymph nodes (buboes) → blood stream → septicemia/septic shock/organ necrosis/DIC', 'ankihub_id': '28e6cafe-2994-4772-9327-7461478376e1'}, {'anki_id': 1692574789340.0, 'document': 'What is the most appropriate next step in management for a patient with recurrent tinea cruris? Perform thorough skin inspection & treat other sites of infection - Recurrent tinea cruris suggests re-exposure to an external source or autoinfection from a concurrent dermatophyte infection elsewhere on the body (eg, tinea pedis, tinea corporis, onychomycosis) - Untreated dermatophyte infection → reinfection & potential secondary bacterial infection (e.g., cellulitis)', 'ankihub_id': 'f8c3c9fe-5955-4e3c-8ecc-d213b66274c1'}, {'anki_id': 1474932405759.0, 'document': 'Phosphate is primarily reabsorbed in the early PCT through Na + -phosphate cotransport', 'ankihub_id': 'dedc91bd-e0ac-42ba-b28e-4210688503a7'}, {'anki_id': 1516664409922.0, 'document': 'The arenaviruses include lymphocytic choriomeningitis virus (LCMV) and lassa fever - LCMV : transmitted by exposure to rodent urine/feces; presents with flu-like systemic illness, headache, meningismus - Lassa fever : transmitted via exposure to rodent urine/feces or close contact with infected individuals; hemorrhagic fever restricted to West Africa', 'ankihub_id': 'a72df344-13e0-4cc5-bb12-89adad751113'}, {'anki_id': 1539463025075.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with preexisting lung disease (e.g., cystic fibrosis; COPD) who presents with JVD , hepatomegaly , and pitting edema ? Cor pulmonale - e.g., RHF from pulmonary hypertension → backup of blood backwards - Note loud S2 due to pulmonary HTN - Hypoxic vasoconstriction increases pressure in lungs, which increases workload of right ventricle → cor pulmonale', 'ankihub_id': '374e70a9-3402-4f21-bb3a-7664d3c6a8c4'}, {'anki_id': 1535222825333.0, 'document': "Ventilator Settings: PEEP : Ventilator provides a pressure of gas at the end of breathing cycle to keep alveoli open; important in ARDS::what condition? In ARDS, the alveoli aren't staying open", 'ankihub_id': 'cf2dddff-d4dd-44be-9d09-41e3d9f50c2d'}, {'anki_id': 1473466832973.0, 'document': 'What cause of hypoxemia is not greatly helped by supplemental O 2 ? Right-to-left shunt High altitude, hypoventilation, diffusion defects, and V/Q mismatch are all greatly helped with supplemental O 2', 'ankihub_id': 'c2d129f9-bda5-4438-ac04-1c482a116e73'}, {'anki_id': 1516927232077.0, 'document': 'Does the rash of erythema infectiosum (parvovirus B19) affect the face ? Yes Slapped cheek fever', 'ankihub_id': 'f82c3a4d-7a8d-4954-bed7-8afd63cd3d83'}, {'anki_id': 1530550123155.0, 'document': 'What is the treatment of neurogenic shock? Fluid and pressors Atropine can be considered to treat bradycardia Spinal vs Neurogenic Shock : - Spinal shock: temporary syndrome with flaccid paralysis and loss of all reflexes, urinary and rectal tone below the injury level - Neurogenic shock: hemodynamic state from disrupted sympathetic outflow, resulting in vasodilation, bradycardia, and hypotension', 'ankihub_id': 'b4c84c1d-2952-44b9-9b71-93fee8aefa02'}, {'anki_id': 1509921350618.0, 'document': 'How is Loa loa diagnosed ? Blood smear - Adult form crawling across conjunctiva also seen - Microfilariae will be seen in the smear', 'ankihub_id': '09d2ab38-09d0-4084-8327-161ea107a213'}, {'anki_id': 1509917022554.0, 'document': 'Ascaris lumbricoides , a helminth , enters the blood through the intestinal wall , making its way to the lungs ; the mucociliary escalator eventually causes it to be swallowed into the GI tract Fecal-oral transmission ©️ Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': '52be3e19-f109-4830-bede-ac622b97f026'}, {'anki_id': 1576372262344.0, 'document': 'A uterine fundus located at the level of the umbilicus indicates no uterine atony - Contractions immediately after delivery increase uterine tone → firm uterine fundus palpable at or below the umbilicus - Whereas patients with uterine atony have a soft, boggy, enlarged uterus with the fundus palpable above the umbilicus (due to decreased uterine tone)', 'ankihub_id': 'f1b2ea68-9c11-4098-8b67-6f19b0cc11a9'}, {'anki_id': 1657060575955.0, 'document': 'Small , pruritic , erythematous papules with central hemorrhagic punctum in a linear pattern are suggestive of bedbug bites - Treatment is supportive (e.g., topical corticosteroids, oral antihistamines) - Definitive treatment requires eradicating infestation with insecticides and high heat', 'ankihub_id': 'b66c3f7f-d1dc-45e1-8d7c-6b726ea51f53'}, {'anki_id': 1509814204918.0, 'document': "The late stage of Trypanosoma brucei infection (sleeping sickness) includes CNS involvement and coma - Hence why it is known as 'African sleeping sickness' - Early stage: intermittent fever, malaise, headache and lymphadenopathy - Late stage: CNS involvement, daytime somnolence, nightime insomina, persistent headache, eventual coma", 'ankihub_id': '9405033f-393b-45f2-8fac-42358599d837'}, {'anki_id': 1582070173562.0, 'document': 'Polycythemia vera may present with pruritus after a warm bath or shower due to mast cell degranulation AKA aquagenic pruritus', 'ankihub_id': 'f51a55bc-fb72-4ced-8821-6804365da327'}, {'anki_id': 1506297740188.0, 'document': 'Koplik spots are bright red spots with a(n) blue-white::color center on buccal mucosa Pathognomonic for measles', 'ankihub_id': 'f24976cb-39c9-49f6-be6c-f0c9e4d215be'}, {'anki_id': 1504136597828.0, 'document': 'What is the likely causative organism in a male that presents with dysuria , urinary frequency , and mucopurulent discharge ? Gram stain and urine culture are negative Chlamydia trachomatis - Gram stain shows gram-negative cocci in 95% of cases of gonoccocal urethritis - C. trachomatis is an intracellular organism that is difficult to stain & culture - C. trachomatis often asymptomatic , but may present with clear or mucopurulent discharge', 'ankihub_id': 'd637a19a-d7c1-4bc1-a3b9-3e8b7ed0357c'}, {'anki_id': 1509919483211.0, 'document': 'Which helminth is transmitted by the female black fly ? Onchocerca volvulus Everything turns black in onchocerciasis: - Black flies - Black skin nodules - Black vision (blindness)', 'ankihub_id': 'f76e9e88-fe96-47d2-a88f-c0f33ac71bd5'}, {'anki_id': 1492873335127.0, 'document': 'Characteristic petechial rash in meningococcemia indicates thrombocytopenia::platelet levels mage(s) licensed by DermNet and used with permission, CC-BY-NC-ND 3.0 NZ', 'ankihub_id': 'd9c6eae6-e963-4c98-8fbc-cc0f3642390f'}, {'anki_id': 1509916611971.0, 'document': 'How is the presence of hookworms ( Ancylostoma duodenale , Necator americanus ) diagnosed ? - Eggs in stool O&P - Eosinophilia', 'ankihub_id': '6c82bce8-9759-4c58-ba8f-dadd44b3e335'}, {'anki_id': 1509813878177.0, 'document': 'Trypanosoma brucei has two subspecies; either T. gambiense or T. rhodesiense - Trypanosoma brucei causes human African trypanosomiasis AKA African sleeping sickness - T. brucei is transmitted via painful bite of tsetse fly - T. gambiense found in west or central Africa causes chronic - T. rhodesiense found in south or east Africa cause acute both are fatal if untreated', 'ankihub_id': 'e61b48df-0596-4cdd-a0b4-28a7620d9f4c'}, {'anki_id': 1580011895096.0, 'document': 'What is the most common complication of peptic ulcer disease ? Gastrointestinal hemorrhage Second most common complication? Gastric perforation', 'ankihub_id': '567959fd-64ff-4668-9e3d-70f338cd9a27'}, {'anki_id': 1506275840916.0, 'document': 'What is the vector for Rocky Mountain spotted fever ( Rickettsia rickettsii )? Dermacentor tick', 'ankihub_id': '58c40e64-c0a1-4bf2-aee6-147ac752b5c0'}, {'anki_id': 1496528600710.0, 'document': "What type of V/Q mismatch may occur in patients with pneumonia ? Right-to-left intrapulmonary shunt Shunted deoxygenated blood due to lack of alveolar ventilation (they're filled with junk) → hypoxemia that cannot be corrected by oxygen Reasoning: - Infection (e.g., pneumonia, sepsis) leads to the production of inflammatory cytokines that disrupt hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction, increasing blood flow to infected lung areas - Adding 100% will improve right side, but left side is still <99%, and they will eventually mix, causing hypoxemia - Compare with V/Q mismatch (e.g., secondary to PE or COPD), which does improve with 100% oxygen - There is no mixing with the deoxygenated blood on the left side", 'ankihub_id': '7c15b037-2fa5-4a81-ade8-8e16f1ae2620'}, {'anki_id': 1522359545765.0, 'document': 'What initial imaging study is recommended for patients with erythema nodosum ? Chest X-ray Useful to evaluate for sarcoidosis and tuberculosis , which are both associated with EN; sarcoidosis patients may have no other symptoms (i.e., NO cough!)', 'ankihub_id': 'bb37b974-8365-4c53-88e7-a9c4187c8614'}, {'anki_id': 1484872061892.0, 'document': 'Scalded skin syndrome is caused by Staphylococcus aureus ::which organism? Exfoliative exotoxin destroys the keratinocyte attachments in the stratum granulosum, resulting in the skin sloughing off CNX OpenStax, CC BY 4.0 , via Wikimedia Commons', 'ankihub_id': 'dcb47774-1a75-4197-880f-4679f785177a'}, {'anki_id': 1516068055933.0, 'document': 'Leptospirosis is associated with fever and conjunctival suffusion ::eye Reddening of the eyes without exudate (erythema without exudate)', 'ankihub_id': '2c19f3f9-c5ff-4dcc-a5e7-f9a6be9ce5b9'}, {'anki_id': 1584316329320.0, 'document': 'What is the most likely diagnosis in a newborn with pallor, edema, hepatosplenomegaly, petechiae, and an indirect hyperbilirubinemia? Rh alloimmunization Severe anemia, e.g., Hb 4g/dL, jaundice, and respiratory distress', 'ankihub_id': 'e4054baf-934b-4ebf-9c1f-81a283166969'}, {'anki_id': 1486591352658.0, 'document': 'Metastasis to the liver may be detected clinically as hepatomegaly with a(n) nodular free edge of the liver', 'ankihub_id': '8452bd30-0dcb-465c-8a0c-574b1e7988e5'}, {'anki_id': 1581440608649.0, 'document': 'During ventilation , increasing the FiO 2 or PEEP are the 2 main methods of improving arterial oxygenation', 'ankihub_id': '65fa5965-7360-4076-bca2-ee55ca43c510'}, {'anki_id': 1516664461821.0, 'document': 'The arenaviruses include lymphocytic choriomeningitis virus (LCMV) and Lassa virus - LCMV : transmitted by exposure to rodent urine/feces; presents with flu-like systemic illness, headache, meningismus - Lassa fever : transmitted via exposure to rodent urine/feces or close contact with infected individuals; hemorrhagic fever restricted to West Africa', 'ankihub_id': 'ebd369f5-88df-408c-a7ca-65fd3a2274f2'}, {'anki_id': 1402799860948.0, 'document': 'Q fever is a rickettsial-like disorder caused by Coxiella burnetii that presents as pneumonia', 'ankihub_id': 'fec5b182-0bda-4752-9792-cd81b81793a7'}, {'anki_id': 1473457103123.0, 'document': 'What type of V/Q mismatch occurs due to pulmonary embolus ? Dead space ventilation - The PE creates dead space in the area of the embolism, but in such case the auto-regulatory mechanism of lungs shunt more blood to well perfused alveoli, essentially compensating the loss of perfusion and preventing hypoxemia. - In such cases, if there is hypoxemia in the lung as a whole, airway obstruction (decreased V/Q ratio) or massive pulmonary embolism (increased V/Q ratio) should be ruled out.', 'ankihub_id': 'd6a6f522-472a-4a8c-bc17-078861f975a9'}, {'anki_id': 1482965424718.0, 'document': 'Which embryologic gut region develops into the pancreas ? Foregut::Foregut/Midgut/Hindgut', 'ankihub_id': 'cccd5973-dc55-4be9-97e8-532ac91419b0'}, {'anki_id': 1489352841764.0, 'document': 'What 1 st generation cephalosporin(s) can be used to treat skin and soft tissue infections by Staph and Strep ? Cephalexin, cefazolin - e.g., lymphangitis, cellulitis, erysipelas - Cefazolin is better for systemic signs of infection (e.g., fever, chills)', 'ankihub_id': 'd68fe534-31a9-4ded-bfb4-6618d8b0f0a6'}, {'anki_id': 1556659424586.0, 'document': 'Post- bone related trauma, bilateral infiltrates and petechial rash (axilla, chest wall, conjunctiva) is suggestive of fat embolism::diagnosis ARDS and fat embolism both have bilateral infiltrates, but look for the history of bone fractures + petechiae', 'ankihub_id': '4bd77c58-322e-4585-b1a4-a44fc0564fd2'}, {'anki_id': 1500031144245.0, 'document': 'The general prodromal symptoms with a Rickettsial infection are headache and fever', 'ankihub_id': 'e095ca3e-b297-44a6-81af-285121f9add0'}, {'anki_id': 1471806302661.0, 'document': 'Kawasaki disease is a medium-vessel vasculitis AKA mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome', 'ankihub_id': 'af77f6f7-099b-4d4b-80f0-82dcaefef689'}, {'anki_id': 1516590476893.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an infant with an isolated , hyperpigmented patch with numerous dark, coarse hairs ? Congenital melanocytic nevus - Nevus = small spot (vs. melanocytosis, everywhere) - Benign; risk of malignant transformation increases with increasing size of the nevus', 'ankihub_id': 'd41c9d59-a96f-496e-9c11-5528bd9abf3e'}, {'anki_id': 1502154870583.0, 'document': 'PCR is the gold standard used in the diagnosis of herpes simplex virus (HSV) HSV diagnosis: - PCR (early detection of encephalitis) - Multinucleate giant cells on Tzanck smear of skin lesions - Eosinophilic Cowdry intranuclear inclusion bodies', 'ankihub_id': '63c4ce3c-3d82-43f7-ab05-759af341012d'}, {'anki_id': 1502571560356.0, 'document': 'Flesh-colored , dome-shaped , umbilicated skin lesions are diagnostic of molluscum contagiosum - A dermatofibroma is a skin lesion that when pinched produces a central dimple and may be described as umbilicated - Umbilicated = having a small depression resembling the belly button - Large lesions & diffuse infection often associated with HIV and/or immunosuppression', 'ankihub_id': 'bfe3779e-ed21-40b3-8b93-88f3bae2d58d'}, {'anki_id': 1683138813613.0, 'document': 'Persistent pulmonary hypertension of the newborn (PPHN) presents as respiratory distress , cyanosis , prominent S2 , and difference in pre-ductal and post-ductal O 2 saturation with normal pulses after birth - Persistently ↑ pulmonary vascular resistance → continued R-to-L shunting across PDA (i.e., persistent fetal circulation) Risk factors : - Lung hypoplasia (e.g., congenital diaphragmatic hernia, Potter sequence) - Infection (e.g., pneumonia) - Meconium aspiration - However, some patients have no identifiable cause and simply have a slower decline in PVR - Compare with coarctation of the aorta , which will present with diminished pulses Diagnosis Transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN) Respiratory distress syndrome Persistent pulmonary hypertension Pathophysiology Alveolar fluid not cleared properly at birth Alveolar collapse and atelectasis due to lack of surfactant Right to left shunting due to high pulmonary vascular resistance resulting in hypoxia Clinical features Tachypnea resolves by day 2 Respiratory distress (premature birth) Tachypnea and cyanosis Chest x-ray Perihilar linear streaking bilaterally Ground glass (reticulogranular), air bronchograms, decreased lung volumes Clear lung fields, decreased pulmonary vascularity', 'ankihub_id': '992e9853-56d4-462d-a5ee-64a30f3f0b55'}, {'anki_id': 1496181891349.0, 'document': 'Patients with COPD have an increased work of breathing due to hyperinflation of their lungs demonstrated by a(n) flattened diaphragm on chest X-ray The flattened diaphragm has more difficulty contracting to expand the thoracic cavity and generate a negative intrathoracic pressure', 'ankihub_id': '58732368-f1d9-4196-a533-b7311895f1c5'}, {'anki_id': 1545266684989.0, 'document': 'Erythematous papules post- heat exposure = miliaria rubra - Erythematous nonfollicular papules associated with heat exposure or fever ; lesions on back, trunk, neck, or occluded areas - Skin biopsy can be diagnostic but is not often done - Keys to diagnosis are history of heat exposure and distribution of lesions', 'ankihub_id': 'b114b30f-ca15-46f6-b65a-4532eb70e5f5'}, {'anki_id': 1506276691066.0, 'document': "Anaplasmosis is a Rickettsial disease that presents with neutrophils (granulocytes) with morulae in their cytoplasm ' MEGA ': - M onocytes for E hrlichiosis - G ranulocytes for A naplasmosis", 'ankihub_id': '636c95e0-1161-4a17-b404-0ebcdb5f0cf3'}, {'anki_id': 1575339448179.0, 'document': 'Miliaria rubra::Diagnosis? Also known as "sweat rash", "prickly heat", or "heat rash"', 'ankihub_id': '8a3278cd-3e36-4017-9638-4a130aa35029'}, {'anki_id': 1532614981841.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for a 12-month-old girl with a confirmed febrile E. coli UTI that is resolving after initiation of antibiotics? Renal and bladder ultrasound (RBUS) - US used to detect anatomical abnormalities suggestive of VUR - Followed by VCUG if abnormal - Contrast with voiding cystourethrogram, which are used in conjuction with RBUS for children (any age) with recurrent UTIs or a first UTI from an organism other than E. coli', 'ankihub_id': 'fece8094-0c62-46c2-9543-2319dd74d1b0'}, {'anki_id': 1516928179894.0, 'document': 'The fever of erythema infectiosum (parvovirus) is mild::severity - Compare with roseola , which has a high fever - Symptoms: mild fever lasting 2-5 days → erythematous macular malar rash (slapped cheeks rash) → lacy, reticular rash over trunk and extremities', 'ankihub_id': '709b426f-4174-449d-8167-a0a6a3487773'}, {'anki_id': 1509928603524.0, 'document': 'Which species of helminths migrate against portal blood flow ? Schistosoma spp. Schistosoma mature in the liver, so logically one would expect travel up to the heart and lungs, however this is not the case', 'ankihub_id': '811a0a04-c944-48d3-a1c6-ae2a05c03c8a'}, {'anki_id': 1509844164478.0, 'document': 'Hypnozoites of Plasmodium vivax and ovale are found in hepatocytes Two P. Vivax Trophozoites:', 'ankihub_id': '9618d09a-0996-4ec9-b4cc-ebc3943792ef'}, {'anki_id': 1547916083609.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a young sexually active patient that presents with multiple papular lesions around the anus? Some lesions bleed with manipulation Condylomata acuminata (genital warts) - Due to infection with HPV (strains 6 & 11); in contrast, condyloma lata (secondary syphilis) typically causes flat , velvety lesions - Accumulating pillbugs Condition Pain Lymphadenopathy Appearance Condylomata lata Painless Yes Multiple, flat, round, moist Condylomata acuminata Painless No Multiple, verrucous Herpes Painful Yes Multiple, ulcers, vesicles Molluscum contagiosum Painless Rare Umbilicated papules in clusters', 'ankihub_id': 'b2745fc2-e8be-45f9-8c70-71cb58de2c3d'}, {'anki_id': 1556499105068.0, 'document': 'Rapid Diagnosis Newborn with macrocephaly, hydrocephalus, diffuse intracranial calcifications, chorioretinitis: Toxoplasmosis vs. CMV = periventricular calcifications', 'ankihub_id': '435e5a19-d7ba-42ee-bb25-33f77ee825d0'}, {'anki_id': 1509927681810.0, 'document': "Imaging of an infection with the helminth Echinococcus granulosus reveals hydatid cysts with ' eggshell' calcifications , most commonly in the liver Can also affect the lungs and brain www.radiologyassistant.nl . Used with permission.", 'ankihub_id': '6dc5f815-3643-4a9a-a01d-a095741f7237'}, {'anki_id': 1582141193936.0, 'document': 'In Lemierre syndrome , septic thromboemboli from the neck can seed other organs, leading to multiple peripheral lung nodules on CXR - Infection → invade IJV → thrombus → septic microemboli - Fusobacterium necrophorum is the most frequent bacterial cause of LS - Usually begins as tonsilitis and can present with significant neck swelling or tenderness in the week following infection Image(s) provided by www.radiologyassistant.nl . No', 'ankihub_id': 'b948b852-e143-4537-a08c-88b9aef7e679'}, {'anki_id': 1582558551290.0, 'document': 'In addition to first trimester screening , patients with high-risk sex activity* require repeat screening for STIs in the third trimester - High risk includes patients < 25, prior STI, high-risk sexual activity (e.g., multiple partners, sex worker) - *Most US states have laws that encourage / require repeat screening in ALL patients in the third trimester, due to the high transmission rates - Screen for HIV, syphilis, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, gonorrhea, and chlamydia', 'ankihub_id': '9d2347b2-4286-46d2-a33b-686039bb6fe5'}, {'anki_id': 1567713671972.0, 'document': 'What vasculitis may present with palpable purpura , livedo reticularis and subcutaneous nodules ? Polyarteritis nodosa (seen in 33% of patients) - Palpable purpura : small 1 to 1.5cm infarcts, sometimes with ulceration - Livedo reticularis (pictured below): a purplish network-patterned discoloration', 'ankihub_id': '8b5007d8-df55-4d14-9bea-ab6d00b7ddf2'}, {'anki_id': 1516557177048.0, 'document': 'Outbreaks of Zika virus are more common in tropical climates Aedes mosquito vector', 'ankihub_id': 'c1715435-c06d-4233-8bc8-e54f39f052ff'}, {'anki_id': 1574142721203.0, 'document': 'What is seen on X-ray for transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN)? Hyperexpanded, wet lungs (e.g., perihilar linear streaking ) - Wet lungs due to interstitial edema - Characterized by perihilar linear streaking on CXR and pleural effusions with fluid in fissures CXR of 41 week old neonate with respiratory distress (below): - Marked hyperinflation of lungs - Increased vascular and interstitial markings - Some interfissural fluid ( yellow arrow) Diagnosis Transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN) Respiratory distress syndrome Persistent pulmonary hypertension Pathophysiology Alveolar fluid not cleared properly at birth Alveolar collapse and atelectasis due to lack of surfactant Right to left shunting due to high pulmonary vascular resistance resulting in hypoxia Clinical features Tachypnea resolves by day 2 Respiratory distress (premature birth) Tachypnea and cyanosis Chest x-ray Perihilar linear streaking bilaterally Ground glass (reticulogranular), air bronchograms, decreased lung volumes Clear lung fields, decreased pulmonary vascularity', 'ankihub_id': '6a6ae7d2-7582-4a15-9997-3fa2684b8aac'}, {'anki_id': 1583351466840.0, 'document': 'Fever and elevated CRP and CA-125 in a patient with an adnexal mass is suggestive of tubo-ovarian abscess::malignancy or tubo-ovarian abscess Laboratory findings include increases in nonspecific indices (e.g., leukocytosis, C-reactive protein, CA-125), which along with fever, suggest infection rather than malignancy', 'ankihub_id': '7660ab0f-c35f-4d59-b934-718a3f99a853'}, {'anki_id': 1402677908050.0, 'document': 'Neisseria meningitidis is transmitted via respiratory and oral secretions Spreads easily through college dorms (college student with meningitis)', 'ankihub_id': 'e5d94517-2f88-41ef-b99e-948ecb0f6d10'}, {'anki_id': 1500032694215.0, 'document': 'The incubation period for Rickettsia rickettsii is somewhere between 4-10 days', 'ankihub_id': 'd50bb586-8506-42a2-855c-aba75a989d28'}, {'anki_id': 1509921477554.0, 'document': 'Which hematologic complication arises from Loa loa infection? Erythema infectiosum (parvovirus B19) - When you get slapped there are five fingers on your face - Rash: erythematous malar rash on face, reticular/lace like rash on trunk/extremities 1 st - Measles (Rubeola) 2 nd - Scarlet fever ( S carlet → Second ) 3 rd - Rubella ( Three day measles → Third ) 4 th - Duke's disease (no longer 'distinct disorder') 5 th - Erythema infectiosum ( Five fingers on cheek → Fifth ) 6 th - Roseola infantum (HHV- 6 → Six )", 'ankihub_id': '9a010b78-6a2e-40d5-bcfc-e912371e1563'}, {'anki_id': 1521494987286.0, 'document': 'A PPD is considered positive in those with high risk of TB if the induration size is ≥ 5 mm - e.g., patients who are HIV positive / immunosuppressed, recent contacts of known TB case - May be false-negative in patients with CD4 + counts < 200/mm 3 - Compared to ≥ 10 mm in those with intermediate risk of TB', 'ankihub_id': '56ba336f-f0d1-4752-b5eb-7c093b76ccde'}, {'anki_id': 1556996200577.0, 'document': "Palpable cord-like structure with local tenderness + erythema and induration along the course of a superficial vein that do not resolve with elevation is suggestive of superficial thrombophlebitis::diagnosis - AKA superficial vein thrombosis - Associated with varicose veins - Superficial = can palpate (e.g., sapheneous vein) vs. femoral/popliteal ( deep ) - Duplex ultrasonography required to rule out concurrent DVT - Anticoagulation should be considered if thrombus is ≥ 5 cm in length, proximal to the deep venous system , and/or significant risk factors for DVT are present Superficial thrombophlebitis/Mondor's disease (left thoracoepigastric vein) Varicose veins (accessory saphenous vein)", 'ankihub_id': '63501702-fd7d-43fe-a340-83c7d6e569d6'}, {'anki_id': 1488247960155.0, 'document': 'This image is an example of a " swan neck " deformity , which is most commonly associated with rheumatoid arthritis Trachemys , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons; Used with permission. Boutonniere deformity (MCP extension, PIP flexion, DIP hyperextension) Swan neck deformity (MCP flexion, PIP hyperextension, DIP flexion)', 'ankihub_id': 'ef522047-0471-44a4-8180-ec14a8514ecd'}, {'anki_id': 1499970816194.0, 'document': 'Dissemination of Histoplasmosis ::which fungal infection in immunocompromised patients to the liver and spleen results in hepatospleno megaly , with gross pathology of these organs showing calcifications - H istoplasmosis = H epatosplenomegaly Other clinical features of disseminated Histoplasmosis include: - Nonspecific inflammatory symptoms (fatigue, fever, weight loss) - Bilateral reticulonodular pulmonary infiltrates - Lymphadenopathy - Pancytopenia - Bilateral adrenal enlargement', 'ankihub_id': 'fd79e707-12b7-4c53-9aff-997316865a38'}, {'anki_id': 1516560223191.0, 'document': 'California encephalitis is transmitted via the Aedes mosquito vector', 'ankihub_id': '86b13238-3f3c-4882-99cd-ecd9dabd47a9'}, {'anki_id': 1510276903576.0, 'document': 'Which form of Plasmodium spp. is seen here? Schizont (with merozoites) Recall that the schizont bursts, releasing merozoites which go on to infect more cells Schizont (1st image); Schizont with 14 merozoites (2nd image)', 'ankihub_id': '1ad4e03d-8c09-4bcd-8ab8-95afd96ec52f'}, {'anki_id': 1510275544204.0, 'document': 'Splenomegaly and anemia occur in Plasmodium spp. infection (malaria) due to increased clearance of infected RBCs', 'ankihub_id': '80448421-2bf4-4330-bd37-2755461a8ca7'}, {'anki_id': 1584061437456.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for a healthy patient with 16-mm induration at 48 hours following PPD testing, normal chest X-ray , and no acid-fast bacilli ? Isoniazid + rifapentine once weekly for 3 months - Diagnosis is latent tuberculosis (positive PPD and a negative chest x-ray) - Rifamycin-based regimens are preferred over isoniazid monotherapy in most HIV-negative patients - Other first-line options include 4-months daily rifampin or 3-months daily isoniazid + rifampin - Isoniazid monotherapy can still be used for patients with contraindications to rifamycins (e.g., rifampin, rifapentine)', 'ankihub_id': '1105df98-9afa-4b1e-9591-a2ac46ea971d'}, {'anki_id': 1504735977255.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for an HIV patient who has an 8-mm induration at 48 hours following PPD testing and a normal chest X-ray ? 9 months of isoniazid and pyridoxine (B 6 ) - Treat this patient for latent TB (> 5 mm) - Rifamycins induce CYP450; therefore, they are not preferred in HIV patients with latent TB - For active TB , rifabutin is the preferred rifamycin since it is a weaker inducer of CYP450', 'ankihub_id': '14a43420-ffa1-4c91-b9be-76339491cabf'}, {'anki_id': 1503183676277.0, 'document': 'Streptococcus agalactiae (GBS) causes neonatal meningitis , sepsis , and pneumonia Most common cause of neonatal meningitis', 'ankihub_id': '5d4bcd5f-51aa-42af-96f7-e1c189959292'}, {'anki_id': 1582422612583.0, 'document': 'Herpetic gingivostomatitis causes multiple small vesicles in the anterior pharynx/lips the supplementary image with overlays of the relevant areas was adapted from the image mentioned previously (© AnkiHub, LLC)', 'ankihub_id': '08f6e769-be03-441e-9217-d0524f0af2be'}, {'anki_id': 1503253872817.0, 'document': 'Miliary tuberculosis develops when the infection is disseminated into the blood (bacteremia)', 'ankihub_id': '87ae8828-66f9-404e-905d-9a5b3bef96bc'}, {'anki_id': 1484686761269.0, 'document': 'What neurotransmitter is increased in Huntington disease ? Transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN) Diagnosis Transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN) Respiratory distress syndrome Persistent pulmonary hypertension Pathophysiology Alveolar fluid not cleared properly at birth Alveolar collapse and atelectasis due to lack of surfactant Right to left shunting due to high pulmonary vascular resistance resulting in hypoxia Clinical features Tachypnea resolves by day 2 Respiratory distress (premature birth) Tachypnea and cyanosis Chest x-ray Perihilar linear streaking bilaterally Ground glass (reticulogranular), air bronchograms, decreased lung volumes Clear lung fields, decreased pulmonary vascularity', 'ankihub_id': '478cfebd-58ab-42f6-bb70-ae1a9616c9d8'}, {'anki_id': 1506274343067.0, 'document': 'Which Rickettsia spp. are characterized by a rash that starts at the trunk , spreading outwards to the extremities? Rickettsia prowazekii, Rickettsia typhi ::2 AKA centrifugal spread', 'ankihub_id': '433ccb16-e5f2-4301-8b5b-e8381478cc59'}, {'anki_id': 1556387251113.0, 'document': 'Delayed resorption and clearance of alveolar fluid leading to fluid in fissures / perihilar linear streaking on X-ray is suggestive of transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN)::diagnosis - Often seen in C-sections due to lack of resorption of fetal lung fluid - Presents as tachypnea shortly after birth Diagnosis Transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN) Respiratory distress syndrome Persistent pulmonary hypertension Pathophysiology Alveolar fluid not cleared properly at birth Alveolar collapse and atelectasis due to lack of surfactant Right to left shunting due to high pulmonary vascular resistance resulting in hypoxia Clinical features Tachypnea resolves by day 2 Respiratory distress (premature birth) Tachypnea and cyanosis Chest x-ray Perihilar linear streaking bilaterally Ground glass (reticulogranular), air bronchograms, decreased lung volumes Clear lung fields, decreased pulmonary vascularity', 'ankihub_id': '731c0069-e22c-4a54-ac19-1e9e5f800a1a'}, {'anki_id': 1535283600474.0, 'document': 'Blunt abdominal trauma and CT shows lower rib fracture and bleeding into the abdomen → spleen / liver::organ(s) laceration Spleen on left (9-11th), liver on right (5-9th)', 'ankihub_id': '33b485f3-a555-4f8f-91ea-b282f6001771'}, {'anki_id': 1520712406296.0, 'document': 'Increased cardiac output and decreased venous return are found in: Anaphylaxis::Chronic anemia or Anaphylaxis Anaphylaxis causes widespread venous/arteriolar dilation along with increased capillary permeability / third spacing: - decrease in venous tone results in decrease in mean systemic filling pressure - cardiac contractility increases in compensation (upward shift in cardiac function curve) Chronic anemia causes: - Increase in CO to meet metabolic demands of tissue (increased inotropy → cardiac function curve shifts upwards) - Slight increase in venous return due to decreased blood viscosity (resulting in a slight clockwise rotation of vascular function curve) - This results in increased cardiac output and slight increase/no change in venous return', 'ankihub_id': 'df43ef76-9393-44f0-ad1e-c50b9ac53f21'}, {'anki_id': 1503961234297.0, 'document': 'What is the next step in management for an asymptomatic patient that has a 12-mm induration two days after a PPD injection ? The patient has no TB risk factors No additional intervention required In the US, an induration size of < 15 mm is considered negative in healthy patients with a low likelihood of TB', 'ankihub_id': 'dcc4f65d-8933-4cbd-bc9e-fbda9feb0aba'}, {'anki_id': 1485048831798.0, 'document': 'Tyramine is a substance found in many aged foods (e.g., cheese, meats, alcohol)', 'ankihub_id': 'ea86d5f6-9c16-4218-ad9e-46b96d92d3a8'}, {'anki_id': 1578773835423.0, 'document': 'A PPD skin test is not routinely recommended as part of prenatal care T::T/F Only indicated in pregnant patients with one or more of the following risk factors : - Homelessness - Known HIV infection - Immigration from a highly endemic region - Living or working in prisons or mental health care facilities - Close contact with individuals suspected to have TB - Non-infectious diseases that increase risk of TB (e.g., diabetes mellitus, cancer, alcohol use disorder, intravenous drug use)', 'ankihub_id': '85954890-1fec-473f-8b77-4b01beadfced'}, {'anki_id': 1516219638812.0, 'document': "The risk factors for developmental dysplasia of the hip (DDH) may be remembered with the 4 F's: - F emales::Demographic - F irstborn::Birth order - F eet first (breech)::Fetal presentation - F amily history Breech presentation results in excessive uterine packing", 'ankihub_id': 'c9b5d2fb-1c77-47cc-84dc-ea6ce3e11334'}, {'anki_id': 1511204897755.0, 'document': 'What is the best diagnostic test for GERD , but is rarely done? 24hr-pH monitoring Only done if surgery is considered', 'ankihub_id': '84e0bd10-7399-453b-b0a5-e637f52f8cc4'}, {'anki_id': 1557067939517.0, 'document': 'A ruptured ovarian cyst can lead to an acute abdomen due to hemoperitoneum Especially if the person is on anticoagulation', 'ankihub_id': '13c982f7-bdb9-46c8-bb26-0779912b04a7'}, {'anki_id': 1503255747704.0, 'document': 'Diagnosis of active primary tuberculosis is made by chest X-ray demonstrating a(n) Ghon complex and pleural effusion - Ghon complex = Ghon focus (granuloma in middle/lower lobe) paired with swelling of the associated hilar lymph node - When a Ghon complex heals and calcifies, it is referred to as a Ranke complex - calcifications allow it to be identified radiologically - Ghon complex is seen in untreated primary pulmonary tuberculosis infection while the Ranke complex is a result of the healing of a primary tuberculosis', 'ankihub_id': '68da47bd-10f7-4133-a41a-fce8549b92fb'}, {'anki_id': 1550018422304.0, 'document': 'What should be suspected in long term fetal tachycardia (over 160) ? Secondary amyloidosis (AA) Facial swelling, lower extremity edema, and massive proteinuria are consistent with nephrotic syndrome (think deposition everywhere); these are secondary to the underlying inflammatory condition', 'ankihub_id': '12a556e3-000e-4be5-85bd-3431032a2681'}, {'anki_id': 1517264904432.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in an infant that presents with a scaphoid abdomen with bowel sounds heard over the left lung fields? Jaundice', 'ankihub_id': '9b5a4932-4e5a-4090-b42c-915b51d149ac'}, {'anki_id': 1557054938612.0, 'document': 'What syndrome is characterized by a triad of respiratory distress , neurologic dysfunction , and petechial rash ? X-ray shows bilateral infiltrates Fat embolism syndrome - Rash is present in less than half of cases - Typically develops following a latent period of 12 - 72 hours after the initial injury - Respiratory distress : SOB, hypoxemia - Neurologic dysfunction: confusion, visual changes - Note: initial symptoms and X-ray may mimic ARDS (hypoxia, bilateral) → ddx. with petechial rash', 'ankihub_id': 'eae8c034-2f11-42a9-9e28-0b45b034001f'}, {'anki_id': 1495489447045.0, 'document': 'What is the colonoscopy screening recommendation for patients with familial adenomatous polyposis and known polyps ? Begin at 10-15 years old and repeat q 1y - Proctocolectomy is delayed until early adulthood for children or at the time of diagnosis for adults - Severe disease (e.g., high grade dysplasia, high numbers of polyps) necessitates earlier surgery - FAP almost always involves the rectum, so flexible sigmoidoscopy may be considered in place of colonoscopy if there are no known polyps - EGD is indicated every 6m-4y starting at 25–30 years old', 'ankihub_id': '6a65a115-5a11-469d-be5f-3963ecb84d50'}, {'anki_id': 1403292961137.0, 'document': 'Esophagitis and colitis are GI complications that are often seen alongside CMV retinitis in immunosuppressed patients Large smudgy intranuclear and cytoplasmic inclusions in fibroblasts/histiocytes of an inflamed colonic mucosa: © Dr. Jian-Hua Qiao , all rights reserved, via Flickr (used with permission)', 'ankihub_id': 'fde53cc9-58cd-4649-9049-a800cede4a64'}, {'anki_id': 1500032764394.0, 'document': 'The rash from Rickettsia rickettsii is different from that of Rickettsia prowazekii in that this rash begins at the extremities and moves towards the trunk', 'ankihub_id': '4fe8fa0f-2866-4969-8f18-7791f2ff44ea'}, {'anki_id': 1500336632240.0, 'document': 'Pneumocystis jirovecii has a(n) respiratory transmission', 'ankihub_id': '94a2ed52-8921-4576-8963-6fc886df84b2'}, {'anki_id': 1474426154857.0, 'document': 'Fat emboli commonly present with dyspnea::symptom due to fat , often with bone marrow elements, in the pulmonary vessels', 'ankihub_id': '4a8d9d08-376f-4378-8349-cfb6c3df345b'}, {'anki_id': 1500746662349.0, 'document': 'Gram positive algorithm: First split into bacilli, cocci, and branching filaments', 'ankihub_id': '01df1189-a11a-4b2e-974d-253140931410'}, {'anki_id': 1516757959004.0, 'document': 'Which childhood exanthem is known as third disease ? CSF cytology is normal and there is no rash Tick-borne paralysis - Due to neurotoxin release which causes rapid ascending paralysis within hours (due to prevention of ACh release at NMJ) - Search meticulously for ticks and promptly remove them to prevent respiratory failure - Removal of ticks usually results in improvement within 1 hour with recovery after several days Differentiation from GBS : - GBS typically causes symmetric LE weakness & paresthesia over days to weeks with autonomic dysfunction (tachy, urinary retention, arrhythmias) following a prodromal viral illness - CSF analysis typically reveals albuminocytologic dissociation', 'ankihub_id': '7927d9ff-08a6-4664-a5fd-18a7ea9b439f'}, {'anki_id': 1547916101070.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a woman that presents with fever and RLQ abdominal pain with a large multiloculated adnexal mass on ultrasound? [{'anki_id': 1472668562134.0, 'document': 'All statins , except for pravastatin , are metabolized by cytochrome p450 Drugs that inhibit cytochrome p450 metabolism increase serum levels of statins, increasing risk of developing myopathy', 'ankihub_id': '68d1ed45-b073-4585-bc90-f259893e8e88'}, {'anki_id': 1472668526554.0, 'document': 'The most common side effect of statins is myopathy, which occurs weeks to months after starting therapy - e.g., muscle weakness, soreness - Exacerbated by fibrate usage - For patients who are intolerant of one statin due to myopathy, discontinue statin therapy for 2–4 weeks, then restart treatment with a different statin (e.g., pravastatin or fluvastatin) at low-dose once symptoms have resolved', 'ankihub_id': 'da8aa731-065e-4807-b473-50380a1f8a77'}, {'anki_id': 1585423252251.0, 'document': 'Is statin myopathy associated with diplopia ? No "Would be unusual"', 'ankihub_id': '684ac241-dbed-4a5a-b5a4-e714d3ba33f4'}, {'anki_id': 1472676561710.0, 'document': 'Fibrates may cause myopathy as an adverse effect , especially when combined with statins', 'ankihub_id': '83111403-3f59-4fb7-9091-ba977747cae3'}, {'anki_id': 1578697217693.0, 'document': 'Which three statins have the lowest risk of statin-associated myopathy ? Pravastatin, Pitavastatin, Fluvastatin - "A Low F lying P lane" - For patients who are intolerant of one high-intensity statin, switching to a different high-intensity or a moderate-intensity statin (such as the above) should be considered', 'ankihub_id': 'b912bba6-60cc-4852-a655-68a2259ed441'}, {'anki_id': 1556649769705.0, 'document': 'What is the likely underlying cause of muscle pain in a patient taking metoprolol , lisinopril , aspirin , and simvastatin ? Statin-induced myopathy Possibly due to decreased synthesis of coenzyme Q10 , which is involved in muscle cell energy production', 'ankihub_id': '825fdeaf-5656-4bde-814e-145c1c68f33b'}, {'anki_id': 1551651952834.0, 'document': 'Patient on statin experiencing myositis or hepatitis → stop the statin::next step Then start one at a lower dose', 'ankihub_id': '58db84b5-88b0-4e47-b71f-5270071be964'}, {'anki_id': 1472668470653.0, 'document': 'Statins are the most effective lipid-lowering medications for preventing future cardiovascular events - Initiated in the setting of MI and other acute coronary syndromes - Drugs that raise HDL (e.g., niacin) are not associated with improved cardiac outcomes', 'ankihub_id': '0e179b0e-2771-4653-b8a7-60deedf52c53'}, {'anki_id': 1472668485114.0, 'document': 'Statins are the only lipid-lowering drugs consistently proven to reduce risk of atherosclerotic heart disease', 'ankihub_id': '6ca27a34-2078-4144-b0e0-82c7251d0f70'}, {'anki_id': 1497310716073.0, 'document': 'Patients taking colchicine can develop agranulocytosis These patients will be neutropenic and thus are susceptible to infection', 'ankihub_id': '5a497078-ca0b-4013-96d6-e140f15d878d'}, {'anki_id': 1472668423640.0, 'document': 'Statins indirectly cause increased LDL receptor expression on hepatocytes Occurs in response to decreased cholesterol synthesis → results in ↑ LDL clearance from circulation (via receptor-mediated endocytosis)', 'ankihub_id': '4f6925ca-69e1-4b90-9064-278fc401315e'}, {'anki_id': 1472668510022.0, 'document': 'Statins reduce risk of future vascular events in patients with a history of TIA or stroke TIA = transient ischemic attack', 'ankihub_id': 'fe9e0924-1520-4ab1-a654-3bc289594f3f'}, {'anki_id': 1475982678107.0, 'document': 'Farnesyl PP i is an intermediate of cholesterol synthesis that is important for synthesis of coenzyme Q (ETC) Decreased in response to statin therapy, thus causing myopathy', 'ankihub_id': '77f3932e-cb04-441a-ae51-0254327709dc'}, {'anki_id': 1588871809870.0, 'document': 'What physical symptom do complete moles , partial moles , and choriocarcinoma all share? Vaginal bleeding', 'ankihub_id': '12c597b6-7de1-4be9-afc8-90b5c5b25a09'}, {'anki_id': 1472668415239.0, 'document': 'Statins exert their effects by inhibiting the enzyme HMG-CoA reductase , thus decreasing cholesterol production e.g., simvastatin, atorvastatin, rosuvastatin', 'ankihub_id': 'aea99b7f-4de9-4a14-9a80-c79d367478c1'}, {'anki_id': 1475982725907.0, 'document': 'What class of drugs inhibits the enzyme HMG-CoA reductase ? Statins', 'ankihub_id': 'cabe9687-2201-4531-aa16-46f9e3b290f4'}, {'anki_id': 1475982728516.0, 'document': 'Statins are competitive ::competitive or non-competitive reversible ::reversible or irreversible inhibitors of HMG-CoA reductase', 'ankihub_id': '544c4e7e-cc2e-4d1f-8864-c0d51521ddbf'}, {'anki_id': 1486591372327.0, 'document': 'Spontaneous bacterial peritonitis (SBP) is diagnosed by paracentesis with ascitic fluid absolute neutrophil count ≥ 250 cells/mm 3', 'ankihub_id': '0ca4fdd6-c234-43db-ae64-50ff7c4ad0a3'}, {'anki_id': 1551651951877.0, 'document': 'Statins::Drug class = inhibition of HMG-CoA reductase Reduce endogenous cholesterol production from the liver → ↑ LDL receptors suck LDL out of blood', 'ankihub_id': 'c80b5f03-8e44-4cc1-950f-1dc1d4ad9d43'}, {'anki_id': 1472668437183.0, 'document': 'Statins significantly reduce LDL levels (30-60% reductions)', 'ankihub_id': '084d7c88-2209-45f0-a050-32fab662d7c2'}, {'anki_id': 1515722684226.0, 'document': 'What two cholesterol-modulating drug classes should not be combined due to a high risk of causing rhabdomyolysis ? Statins + fibrates - Do not give with a CYP450 inhibitor - Other drugs include daptomycin, integrase inhibitors, and drugs that can cause seizures', 'ankihub_id': '22170d95-593d-4795-a032-113d9c273ef2'}, {'anki_id': 1551651953915.0, 'document': 'LDL < 70 and no disease = no statin::statin/no statin', 'ankihub_id': 'c73b9da5-17fc-4e91-b83a-e376104611c0'}, {'anki_id': 1582768481409.0, 'document': 'Penicillamine is a chelating agent that may cause myopathy as an adverse effect', 'ankihub_id': '90dd4bcf-b280-438c-b992-5f6459f26add'}, {'anki_id': 1477447324180.0, 'document': 'Metoprolol is a β-blocker that is associated with dyslipidemia as an adverse effect', 'ankihub_id': '75b79232-ee9d-4508-a95e-c2ab5f04814f'}, {'anki_id': 1550690803984.0, 'document': "Ischemic heart failure (with prior MI or ASCVD) = add aspirin and statin - To treat the coronary artery disease that's causing the ischemia - Large randomized controlled trials (CORONA and GISSI-HF) showed no mortality or morbidity benefit of statins in HFrEF (NYHA II-IV), irrespective of ischemic or nonischemic etiology - The decision to start asprin or statin therapy should be based upon other indications (e.g., ASCVD or elevated LDL)", 'ankihub_id': '43eba073-0b1f-44f7-99c3-cf02e0ca4b98'}, {'anki_id': 1472673225907.0, 'document': 'Ezetimibe indirectly causes increased LDL receptor expression', 'ankihub_id': 'e41c6101-22f5-4754-8943-85045aeca378'}, {'anki_id': 1472668493182.0, 'document': 'Statin therapy may be used to reduce the risk of cardiovascular events and mortality in patients with high-risk diabetes Also reduces risk in patients with peripheral artery disease', 'ankihub_id': '9363fbda-dc88-4b8a-b6c9-c4a96f4475af'}, {'anki_id': 1532705263030.0, 'document': 'What nerve is "paired" with the superior thyroid artery ? Superior laryngeal nerve - Leads to inability to sing high notes - Compare to recurrent laryngeal nerve ↔ inferior thyroid artery', 'ankihub_id': 'a1c650c8-9dc3-4cb0-8a66-3b1facf988f2'}, {'anki_id': 1497312676571.0, 'document': 'What is the recommended therapy for patients > 75 that have clinically significant atherosclerotic disease ? Moderate-intensity statin Watch Statins', 'ankihub_id': '95e9800c-614c-478e-a0c6-5965d59ae44a'}, {'anki_id': 1475363777148.0, 'document': 'Nephrotic syndrome is associated with hyper lipidemia and hyper cholesterolemia - This accelerates atherosclerosis and increases risk for MI and stroke; patients with risk factors may require short-term use of a statin - Low intravascular oncotic pressure stimulates increased lipoprotein production in the liver (blood "thins" due to low protein, liver pumps more lipoprotein to "beef it up") - Additionally, impaired lipid catabolism due to decreased lipoprotein lipase and abnormal transport of circulating lipid particles also contributes to hyperlipidemia', 'ankihub_id': '03fc9db1-7a83-4deb-b200-2c2db0b99595'}, {'anki_id': 1525220854667.0, 'document': 'Patients with hydatidiform moles may present with pelvic discomfort, vaginal bleeding, and hyper emesis::not HTN - Hyperemesis gravidarum = basically severe nausea and vomiting that can lead to weight loss and electrolyte imbalances - Can present with hypertension with proteinuria occurring especially before 20 weeks of pregnancy - May also present with hyperthyroidism due to high amounts of hCG (recall that the α-subunit of hCG structurally resembles TSH)', 'ankihub_id': '7047d36b-9b30-4ea4-9fcc-ca6ce5da14ba'}, {'anki_id': 1471914931976.0, 'document': 'Cor pulmonale refers to isolated right heart failure due to a pulmonary cause e.g., chronic lung disease : hypoxia causes pulmonary vasoconstriction; the right heart has to pump against these constricted vessels', 'ankihub_id': '474480e6-6014-4c28-ab5e-c0600d0e5645'}, {'anki_id': 1474253867764.0, 'document': 'Patients with McArdle disease may experience the " second-wind " phenomenon during exercise due to increased muscular blood flow - Better tolerance for aerobic exercise after approximately 10 minutes - The phenomenon is believed to be due to recruitment of alternative energy sources (e.g., fatty acids) and increased blood flow to muscles', 'ankihub_id': '53e5e2e8-1153-4ca0-903d-03e66619f843'}, {'anki_id': 1497569048598.0, 'document': 'What is the preferred treatment to prevent myocardial infarction in a patient with inducible ischemia seen on stress test? Anti-platelet therapy (e.g., aspirin) and high-intensity statin (e.g., atorva-, rosuvastatin) A decreased tracer uptake with stress but normal at rest indicates inducible ischemia, a diagnostic finding for CAD', 'ankihub_id': '38649527-4d3b-4dcb-9551-5b7e57195a00'}, {'anki_id': 1636708407688.0, 'document': 'A complete hydatidiform mole is p57 negative::positive or negative on immunostaining - p57 is expressed by maternal chromosomes only - p57 is p ositive in a p artial mole - p57 is " c ancelled" in a c omplete mole', 'ankihub_id': '9b4d614c-7c84-45a1-9f10-390e1513a08d'}, {'anki_id': 1584818358195.0, 'document': 'Rhabdomyolysis is characterized by myocyte necrosis , which may manifest clinically as lower limb swelling and pain Watch Acute Tubular Necrosis (ATN)', 'ankihub_id': 'e5cd3d27-dd72-41ed-90eb-715436cc8ad5'}, {'anki_id': 1512592675417.0, 'document': "What is the likely diagnosis in a patient that presents with pain less , proximal muscle weakness of the lower extremities? The patient has a history of giant cell arteritis that is medically managed. ESR and CK levels are normal Corticosteroid-induced myopathy - The muscle is being catabolized, but there's no inflammation - In contrast, polymyalgia rheumatica responds rapidly to glucocorticoids and is associated with ↑ ESR , muscle pain , and no weakness", 'ankihub_id': '1533f26b-69db-4624-95da-3526449d645d'}, {'anki_id': 1481335921954.0, 'document': 'Waldenström macroglobulinemia is a B-cell lymphoma with monoclonal IgM production - M spike is important distinguishing feature from multiple myeloma (typically IgG or IgA) - Has generalized lymphadenopathy - LymphoPlasmacytic Lymphoma causes a hyperviscosity syndrome (Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia) due to massive volume of circulating IgM pentamers', 'ankihub_id': 'bb658a40-d1e4-49a1-88e2-ef746313f983'}, {'anki_id': 1577239022547.0, 'document': 'Identification of dyslipidemia to calculate a 10-year CVD event risk requires lipid screening in adults ages: 40- to 75-years-old - Use low-moderate dose statin for primary prevention of cardiovascular disease - USPSTF recommends prescribing a statin in adults 40 to 75 with 1 or more CVD risk factor and estimated 10-year risk of CVD event 10% or greater, which requires lipid screening to calculate', 'ankihub_id': '5322c85a-2646-4888-b346-a36273c7c0c8'}, {'anki_id': 1488418541862.0, 'document': 'Myasthenia gravis classically involves the eyes , leading to ptosis and diplopia', 'ankihub_id': '2b42b4e7-ac5f-48c7-abf4-3723a733ea91'}, {'anki_id': 1551143620883.0, 'document': 'High intensity statins are recommended for: - Patients < 75 years old with clinical ASCVD::disease - Patients with LDL > 190 mg/dL::level - Patients with diabetes::with diabetes/without diabetes aged 40-75 with 10 yr. risk of ASCVD > 7.5% - ASCVD = atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (e.g., acute coronary syndrome, MI, angina, stroke, peripheral artery disease) - High-intensity statins include atorvastatin 40-80 mg & rosuvastatin 20-40 mg', 'ankihub_id': 'c338471c-08db-4fce-985e-9f3d9bc984d7'}, {'anki_id': 1476919831441.0, 'document': 'Adverse effects of antimuscarinics on the eye and its muscles ( not including glands ) include mydriasis and cycloplegia "Blind as a bat"', 'ankihub_id': '4b8d60f3-81a6-4e2b-ae41-3664fa840ff8'}, {'anki_id': 1488418555043.0, 'document': 'Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome (LEMS) is caused by autoantibodies to pre-synaptic voltage-gated calcium channels (VGCC) at the NMJ - Daptomycin Muscle pains within one week of starting therapy; check CPK (creatine phosphokinase) levels', 'ankihub_id': 'bceba13e-8e74-467e-ab7a-1a28b958e872'}, {'anki_id': 1475982843945.0, 'document': 'Primary carnitine deficiency may present with myoglobinuria - Prolonged exercise increases energy demands, and fasting depletes glycogen stores, forcing reliance on fatty acid oxidation - In primary carnitine deficiency , impaired transport of long-chain fatty acids into mitochondria limits beta-oxidation, leading to energy depletion - This can trigger rhabdomyolysis , characterized by muscle breakdown, release of myoglobin, and potentially dark urine (myoglobinuria)', 'ankihub_id': 'd17de926-f8b0-4b20-ba76-8968bb03371c'}, {'anki_id': 1474253806097.0, 'document': 'Treatment of von Gierke disease includes frequent oral glucose or cornstarch between meals Cornstarch is a glucose polymer, this will prevent hypoglycemia from developing', 'ankihub_id': 'f8b39b0e-c621-46b7-862a-29913346569a'}, {'anki_id': 1471898887090.0, 'document': 'One less common cause of myocardial infarction is coronary artery vasospasm (e.g., Prinzmetal angina, cocaine use)', 'ankihub_id': '99875922-9144-41a0-965f-6926e8efa7bf'}, {'anki_id': 1576816240575.0, 'document': 'Drugs that elicit a type IV HSR and free radical damage can cause myocarditis::heart condition', 'ankihub_id': 'b8b79de3-9b83-4b49-a180-dc5a788480a8'}, {'anki_id': 1584017299731.0, 'document': 'Which neuromuscular junction pathology is characterized by proximal lower extremity muscle weakness ? May have nonspecific morbilliform rash or no skin symptoms at all (rather than classic slapped-cheek rash in children) - Diagnosis of acute infection is with anti-B19 IgM antibodies (IgG = previous infection) - 75 y/o - USPSTF no longer has recommendations for lipid screening in adults, see Archived: Lipid Disorders in Adults Screening - This card used to state begin at 40 y/o based on USPSTF recommendations "Statin Use for the Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease" but per AMBOSS and 2019 ACC/AHA guideline screening recommendations are from 20 - Cholesterol embolism - Invasive vascular procedures can mechanically dislodge atherosclerotic plaques and send microemboli everywhere; the kidney is at a high risk for injury - Common complications include renal failure , skin manifestations , cerebral / intestinal ischemia , and Hollenhorst plaques (ocular involvement); treatment is supportive and involves statin therapy to prevent recurrent cholesterol embolism - Can also present as blue toe and livedo reticularis with normal peripheral pulses', 'ankihub_id': '513ec9e6-9b5d-4716-aa5f-c6382c0372be'}, {'anki_id': 1471812052582.0, 'document': 'One complication of atherosclerosis is chronic mesenteric ischemia, which may result from stenosis of ≥ 2 main mesenteric arteries - e.g., SMA, IMA, celiac artery - "intestinal angina"', 'ankihub_id': 'fea99c5a-fada-42a9-9311-55437c2821ec'}, {'anki_id': 1487986304432.0, 'document': 'Anti-histidyl-tRNA synthetase (anti-Jo-1) autoantibodies are associated with polymyositis and dermatomyositis', 'ankihub_id': 'dee043da-2bb1-4b5a-920c-3acb0cb34cf3'}, {'anki_id': 1471880947815.0, 'document': 'Coronary steal syndrome occurs because distal to coronary stenosis , vessels are maximally dilated at baseline Thus, vasodilators dilate normal vessels and shunt blood toward well-perfused areas', 'ankihub_id': 'c4161b5d-25ea-4274-8653-3a9e2c4ccf75'}, {'anki_id': 1489973165522.0, 'document': 'What ABO type is the universal recipient of plasma ? Clarithromycin and erythromycin inhibit CYP-450 - Azithromycin has no effect on CYP-450', 'ankihub_id': '6c3d4888-ae85-4618-b40c-b27d37fc023f'}, {'anki_id': 1567982467885.0, 'document': 'S ubendocardial vacuolization and patchy fibrosis due to severe coronary artery disease may cause chronic ischemic heart disease', 'ankihub_id': 'ad436579-3ed4-4840-9590-3d7d5503c5e3'}, {'anki_id': 1522375542266.0, 'document': 'The nephrotoxicity caused by calcineurin inhibitors can result in histologic findings that include early arteriolar hyalinization and tubular vacuolization These agents reduce renal blood flow and cause direct damage to renal endothelial and tubular cells', 'ankihub_id': '23e43a07-4785-42e7-ab2f-f2f9f00f9120'}, {'anki_id': 1471899462236.0, 'document': 'Sudden cardiac death may be prevented with an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (AICD) AICD = automatic implantable cardioverter-defibrillator', 'ankihub_id': '2680bdf6-5f5d-40fb-a7c3-4f895bcd024e'}, {'anki_id': 1472078884074.0, 'document': 'Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy usually arises due to genetic mutations (60-70%), especially in sarcomere proteins Commonly a β-myosin heavy-chain or myosin-binding protein C mutation', 'ankihub_id': '2d7f213f-adf4-4599-8e46-b87e24c375b0'}, {'anki_id': 1515722770836.0, 'document': 'Destroyed muscle cells release large amounts of myoglobin and purines , which lead to acute tubular necrosis - Myoglobin combines with Tamm-Horsfall protein to obstruct renal tubules, and heme from myoglobin forms free radicals that damage proximal renal tubule cells - Purines get metabolized into uric acid, which can lead to a urate nephropathy → ATN', 'ankihub_id': 'e74e94bd-4f52-4c7c-8c35-413b91949879'}, {'anki_id': 1488409952800.0, 'document': 'Dermatomyositis is an inflammatory disorder of the skin and skeletal muscle', 'ankihub_id': '89cca87a-4cff-415e-b84c-8ffe196fc8dd'}, {'anki_id': 1489963760474.0, 'document': 'PDE-5 inhibitors may cause life-threatening hypotension in patients taking nitrates', 'ankihub_id': 'ab090e77-b32e-4a14-a9d9-b4cd95db8f9e'}, {'anki_id': 1471378736900.0, 'document': 'In response to decreased afferent baroreceptor firing , there is increased efferent sympathetic firing (baroreceptor reflex)', 'ankihub_id': 'bd7b77e3-e96b-4122-bfe9-ef1b6f5194db'}, {'anki_id': 1551531335795.0, 'document': 'Vasospastic (Prinzmetal) angina is associated with Raynaud syndrome and migraine ; they all involve hyperactivity of smooth muscle Prinzmetal ↔ coronary smooth muscle Raynaud ↔ digital artery smooth muscle Migraines ↔ brain Vasospastic (Prinzmetal) angina : - Greatest risk factor is smoking - Common in young women - Episodes common at night, after exercise, hyperventilation, emotional stress, cold exposure or cocaine use - Transient ST elevation and then return to baseline - Presbyopia In presbyopia, progressive denaturation of lens proteins and changes in lens curvature causes the image of near objects to focus behind the retina, helping push the myopic image to focus on the retina', 'ankihub_id': 'bfb91d45-f9a4-40a7-ad25-be8278bf386e'}, {'anki_id': 1480549968931.0, 'document': 'Tabes dorsalis presents with a(n) positive Romberg sign Due to impaired proprioception', 'ankihub_id': '4c4484c7-0c70-4fa8-8cd4-10d02cbfc953'}, {'anki_id': 1505674672427.0, 'document': 'Macrolides (-thromycin) can prolong the QT interval, predisposing to torsades de pointes M A CRO (arrhythmia)', 'ankihub_id': 'd70f7078-0787-4c23-8d28-e1d79e91c8c0'}, {'anki_id': 1567825793500.0, 'document': 'Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is characterized by: - ↑::↑↓ LV mass - ↓::↑↓ LV cavity size - Preserved ::↑↓ ejection fraction (EF) - Because LV contractility is typically intact and outflow obstruction is dynamic and commonly only present with exercise, there is usually a preserved ejection fraction - However, impaired relaxation of hypertrophied LV wall → diastolic dysfunction', 'ankihub_id': '21958e1f-21db-4e51-a33e-985f13ff50d0'}, {'anki_id': 1519852745039.0, 'document': 'Myocarditis can be caused by the venom of the black widow - If the venom of a black widow bite makes it systemic ( latrodectism ), patients may present for ~ 1 week with severe muscle pain, abdominal cramps, hyperhidrosis, tachycardia, and muscle spasms - HOWEVER, black widow bites are rarely dangerous; typically, venom is super dilute and most people who are bitten are not injected with venom', 'ankihub_id': '22d42bca-99a6-4968-b80e-b5343ba1ccac'}, {'anki_id': 1469146882653.0, 'document': 'Muscle biopsies of patients with mitochondrial myopathies often show " ragged red " fibers Appearance is due to accumulation of abnormal mitochondria under the sarcolemma', 'ankihub_id': '3c0265b7-602b-4840-ba73-114d9819e20b'}, {'anki_id': 1516128485115.0, 'document': 'What is the cause of bacterial vaginosis ? Glutamate (excitatory) Only neuron in cerebellar cortex that is excitatory Cell Name Cell target (Axon terminates here) Neurotransmitter Function Stellate cell Purkinje cell GABA Inhibitory Basket cell Purkinje cell GABA Inhibitory Purkinje cell Deep cerebellar nuclei GABA Inhibitory Granule cell Purkinje cell Glutamate Excitatory Golgi cell Granule cell GABA Inhibitory', 'ankihub_id': 'd93bafd2-9dfc-4297-b09d-ddbe89257825'}, {'anki_id': 1550526835605.0, 'document': "What is the first-line pharmacologic treatment for stable angina ? Statins and aspirin → help prevent cardiovascular events β -blockers → reduce myocardial oxygen demand Nitrates → treat acute anginal symptoms by decreasing preload & LV wall stress Patients can be discharged with ' SABA ' (Statin + ACEi + BB + ASA) 1) Statins with goal LDL < 70 2) Aspirin decreases morbidity/risk of MI 3) BBs predominantly function by reducing myocardial oxygen demand through a decrease in heart rate and myocardial contractility, making them highly effective in delaying or eliminating exertional angina. 4) Nitrates vasodilate and reduce preload → ultimate effect is decreased LV wall stress → decreased myocardial oxygen demand", 'ankihub_id': '7d18c477-0ec8-4bcf-b4dc-5d12571f782f'}, {'anki_id': 1497563667684.0, 'document': 'What drug class should be avoided in patients with MI that present with acute decompensated HF or bradycardia ? β-blockers MONA B ASH - Ca 2+ is reaccumulated in the sarcoplasmic reticulum by the action of Ca 2+ ATPase (SERCA) - Ca 2+ is pumped out of the cell by the Na + /Ca 2+ exchanger (NCX) - The Ca 2+ ATPase (SERCA) is regulated by the protein phospholamban - Thus, chronic disease and chronic inflammation are intrinsically linked - These cytokines are also responsible for constitutional symptoms (e.g., IL-6 in cardiac myxoma) - Ubiquitination of sarcomeric proteins → skeletal muscle loss', 'ankihub_id': '4fce1326-7a5f-4df6-b3c0-099d5ba7b1c4'}, {'anki_id': 1471899464553.0, 'document': '90% of patients who suffer sudden cardiac death have pre-existing severe atherosclerosis Less common causes include mitral valve prolapse, cardiomyopathy, and cocaine use disorder', 'ankihub_id': '9c39fc49-c16a-4ab8-a59b-1db39d1ade13'}, {'anki_id': 1554471146635.0, 'document': 'What complication of shoulder dystocia manifests as a " claw hand ", an impaired palmar grasp reflex , and Horner syndrome in a newborn? Klumpke palsy - Due to lower trunk injury involving C8 and T1 - K lumpke K law; Grasp the Horn with the Klaw - Horner syndrome secondary to damage to SNS fibers (miosis + ptosis) - Compare with decreased Moro / biceps reflex for Erb\'s (C5/C6)', 'ankihub_id': 'cd13e56a-0b3f-4db8-ad62-b3f1dbc7503e'}, {'anki_id': 1481857900096.0, 'document': 'Huntington disease is characterized by degeneration of GABAergic neurons in the caudate nucleus and putamen of the basal ganglia', 'ankihub_id': 'c97d453f-a1fc-49ee-814f-89dc143e3e1a'}, {'anki_id': 1544446783615.0, 'document': 'Microscopic hematuria is the presence of ≥ 3::# RBCs per HPF - Macroscopic (gross) hematuria → visible (red urine) - Microscopic hematuria → ≥ 3 RBC/HPF from two of three urinary sediments without a urinary tract infection, or menstruation on microscopic evaluation', 'ankihub_id': 'c0c45256-c490-40af-8c20-b5d3089ccf76'}, {'anki_id': 1568310379729.0, 'document': 'Propionic acidemia is caused by a defect in the enzyme propionyl-CoA carboxylase Watch Organic Acidemias', 'ankihub_id': 'f12b32cc-f62e-492e-80fa-235c4c280e66'}, {'anki_id': 1539283451504.0, 'document': 'What is the likely diagnosis in a patient with staggering gait , kyphoscoliosis , pes cavus , hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), and diabetes mellitus ? Friedreich ataxia', 'ankihub_id': '649b95aa-4af8-4752-bed0-c4c8bbcb6a89'}, {'anki_id': 1462219894892.0, 'document': 'Which thyroid imbalance presents with proximal muscle weakness and increased creatine kinase ? thus maintain on mechanical ventilation until spontaneous respirations resume', 'ankihub_id': '43bc7217-4068-4a74-ac49-bbc38ce7c798'}, {'anki_id': 1489966899449.0, 'document': 'Cyclosporine and tacrolimus are calcineurin inhibitors that block T cell activation by preventing IL-2 transcription Calcineurin has phosphatase activity, which dephosphorylates the NFAT transcription factor, activating it and causing it to transcribe genes for IL-2', 'ankihub_id': 'de4705a0-b8b2-442f-854e-02d71ea47fe6'}, {'anki_id': 1565969910170.0, 'document': 'Type IIa familial dyslipidemia presents with increased levels of LDL and cholesterol::2', 'ankihub_id': '2fe2f8a8-568b-44f2-a2aa-a524e625d0b9'}, {'anki_id': 1515267100492.0, 'document': 'The serum lipoproteins elevated in type III familial dyslipidemia are chylomicrons and VLDL Because the liver cannot use apo E to uptake these lipoproteins by the remnant receptor (apo E receptor), chylomicrons and VLDL stay in the blood', 'ankihub_id': 'ec082ef6-b703-4aa6-b053-0864986950ab'}, {'anki_id': 1485913672021.0, 'document': 'Phase I of clinical trials uses a small number of healthy volunteers or patients with disease of interest Assesses safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and pharmacodynamics Mnemonic: I SWIM', 'ankihub_id': 'f1befa9f-3f1e-4bc0-88d3-d465ac9dcaba'}, {'anki_id': 1487469931164.0, 'document': 'Gangrenous necrosis is characteristic of chronic ischemia of the distal extremities and GI tract James Heilman, MD , CC BY-SA 3.0 , via Wikimedia Commons Small bowel gangrene from volvulus showing transmural hemorrhage and dilated blood vessels', 'ankihub_id': '57f7a6d6-fa21-4878-bfdf-48d5baa405a6'}]
